Title: Very good little projector
Comment: I bought the refurbished version for around $239.  Excellent condition, would have through it was brand new!Picture:  I could have sworn I was looking at HD.  I guess its 720 or 480p or something.  Enlarged to 100 inches, I could see pretty much everything clearly.  If you have to have 1080- upgrade but spend $300 more.  Very pleased for $250.Sound - meh.  It will work but only a little louder than an iphone, hardly any bass.  It will satisfy you if you don't have another bluetooth speaker for sound in general, but I would recommend pairing with something else with more bass.Apps/Streaming:  Conflicted.  You can sign into netflix and connect it to your phone's hotspot, but if you bought this to stream and airplay stuff from you phone, anything copyright protected wont work.  Even if you buy an hdmi to lightning adapter.  Luckily I have an AppleTV so I just plugged it in and streamed anything on there with the only downside being more cords and sources.  Again - You will not be able to Wifi mirrorcast airplay netflix, HBO, disney etc from your phone.  So I can use it as I need it, but just a  little disappointed I cant just sling anything from my phone for a true portable solution. .  However, plugging in an appleTV takes 1 outlet and an hdmi cord and 2 minutes.  Bluetooth speaker optional.  You can with the built in app for netflix, but its clunky.App for remote - really nice.After buying, I am very happy with the picture quality and will take this on trips or have outside movie night.  I didn't want to spend $500+ so this was a great solution.  Again -I thought it was 1080p until I read up on it.

Title: Anker very thoughtful!
Comment: I appreciate the product because the form and quality match the price.  What makes me most satisfied is the quality of Anker customer care.  Anker has supported me very quickly and enthusiastically.  Everyone can trust Anker products.  Thank you.

Title: Amazing things come in small packages!
Comment: This is an amazing little device! Full stop.The Anker Nebula Capsule is a pico projector that has it all. I don't even know where to begin but I suppose the star of the show is the projection mechanism. The colors are vivid, motion is very clean, and image size goes well beyond 100". I have used it on a 120" projector screen in a dark room with good results. I took it outside and projected on the side of my house which was probably about 200" with decent results. The bigger the image, the dimmer it will be so anything beyond 100" really should be in pitch black. It has an accelerometer which detects the angle of the unit and automatically adjusts the keystone to keep the image square despite the viewing angle. There is also a manual control but the automatic adjustment has worked flawlessly. Manual focus of the lens is on a small dial on the side. There is no zoom so you have to "zoom with your feet" and move the Nebula Capsule to adjust the picture size. Roughly 8 feet will give you a 100" screen.So we have a great projector... which is inside a case roughly the size of a 12 ounce soda can. It is an odd profile but there is an omnidirectional speaker in it which sounds incredible and is very loud. There is also a battery which gives it 2.5 hours of run time which is rechargeable with the included Micro USB cable and power adapter.Did I mention that it also runs Android? Once you have connected to your wifi network, you can download apps from the built in app store. There are many streaming services such as Netflix, Youtube, Amazon Movies, Spotify, even Kodi and VLC are present. There is a remote control included which lets you navigate through the launcher and has a "mouse mode" button for apps that require mouse input. Playback from the apps was flawless. There are issues with using some of the apps with a remote because there is of course no touch screen. For that, there is a Capsule Control app which allows you to use a smartphone or tablet to control the cursor and enter text. It isn't perfect but it does work.It's also a bluetooth speaker! You can connect to it and play audio through it without having the projector on.There is a full size HDMI port on the back to allow connection of external devices. The USB port does OTG to let you play files off of a thumb drive and there is a short adapter cable included as well. There is almost 3 gigs of free space internally so this can be a completely self contained projection device that doesn't need to be connected to the internet.If you are looking to mount the Nebula Capsule, there are many options. The bottom of the case has a standard tripod mount which, when combined with the ability to flip the image vertically or horizontally, lets you project from the ceiling down to a standard or rear projection screen.For all of these hits, there are some misses. Projecting on the ceiling is totally possible but with a caveat; the case is a cylinder and it is prone to rolling. Plus the IR sensor for the remote is on the back of the case so it is blocked. The focus control is a little touchy and can be hard to dial in. The remote comes with a clear plastic tab to prevent the battery from discharging during shipping and it is hard to remove and easy to overlook which would make the remote appear to not work.

Title: The picture quality is astounding given the size of this thing
Comment: The picture output on this device is really good.I can put it on my table in the middle of the room and it covers the entire wall.I am absolutely blown away by how well the image scales.I'm also impressed by the automatic keystone, and the focus wheel is easy to use.Plugging in a Chromecast adds a much needed feature -- at first I was disappointed that it doesn't have chromecast built in, but it makes more sense to have an HDMI input so I can plug in either a Chromecast or any other device I want.The remote control. Hmm. well, it's kind of terrible. It feels very cheap in the hand for one thing. And it uses a button cell battery. You have to be less than 5 feet from the projector and point the remote directly at the IR receiver on the back. It's like being back in the 1990s except my TV remote back then worked better... I seriously don't understand the decision to use an IR remote control on a device that came out in 2016. I guess they had to save money somewhere. Besides that, the remote control app is really good, so I guess that's where the funds went.The speakers... eh. But I didn't buy it for the speakers. It's trivial to hook up a bluetooth speaker that provides much better sound. So I consider myself lucky to have the built-in speaker (Yes, there's only one speaker -- it's mono sound despite the whole "360 degree sound" claim) in the event that I forget my bluetooth speaker or its battery goes. I wish there was a 3.5mm audio output. This device was made in 2016 before Apple's whole "we can't possibly fit an audio jack with all this goodness built in" decree wrecked audio on mobile devices for consumers. I gladly would have paid another 35 cents for that part.My next complaint: Why do I need to contact their technical support and get a special password to use the Play Store? It's already f****** built into the firmware, they've just disabled it... And they won't just give you the password. I've been arguing with their tech support via email for nearly a week now. You have to justify your use of their special password before they'll give you it. I'm being treated like an untrustworthy child just because I want to install apps from the Play Store.My phone doesn't support Miracast. It's a Google Pixel, so Google has disabled the Miracast functionality in the OS to force their customers to buy a Chromecast. You have to modify a significant amount of system files to restore Miracast functionality to a Pixel phone so the Chromecast is my only option for wireless screen mirroring.It's not that big a deal anyway because I can just hook up a chromecast and mirror my phone to the projector, but that adds more stuff I have to carry around and reduces the overall portability of the device.The executive summary: It's a great device if you have an "it is what it is" perspective. It is a really good projector. But nothing irritates me more than a company that I purchased an expensive product from treating me like a child.

Title: Almost perfect, but the best around.
Comment: Almost perfect portable projector. The battery life is great, the speaker is good, the brightness is unexpectedly good, and the android OS works well and streams nicely. It can't compare to a full size 1080p projector with 2000-3000 lumens, it is the perfect portable solution. watch a movie or show on any wall or ceiling in the house. You don't have to worry about battery life because it is over 4 hours of play. My daughter can't wait to invite a friend over and watch a movie on her wall at 80". I put it on the dinner table and at 30"-40" with the lights on we now have a tv in the kitchen. where ever you go if you have a spot on the wall you could have a smart tv.Playing MKV files with the adapter works great. With  Kodi installed you can play almost everything .The speaker is good, but not amazing. For casual streaming or light music it is great. With speakers size matters.it won't give you that epic sound with big base it is the size of a soda can. The remote is great, but is ir with the receiver on the back so it can be annoying. The remote control app is good. HDMI output works nicely. I hooked it up to my note 8 and Ipad, both worked great.wish list for the next model.1. Make it the size of the echo for even better sound.2. 2 full usb slots and a micro sd card3. 720p  or 1080p4. Android TV OS5. bluetooth remote6. bigger batteryThe projector is almost perfect, but might be the best on the market.UPDATE: I have now taken this little projector everywhere. with a flexible tripod you can put this little projector almost everywhere. I've Watched movies and shows on the ceiling and wall. I Bought a piece of white black out cloth that I use as a screen which works great. with such a portable projector a portable screen is a must. I drape it mine objects or use blue painters tap to hang it on the wall (hillbilly yes, but effective). The nebula capsule has become a must for any trip. I would be interested in trying the Nabula mars II to see how it compares, but the small form factor is great and l love this projector

Title: Best balance of image quality, audio quality and price
Comment: Received this as a gift and it has been fantastic.  Super portable with just the right amount of specs.  This thing is literally the size and weight of a soda can.  Image and audio quality is not top of the line, but for what you get in such a small package, it's perfect.  In a dark room, images are crisp and pleasing.  Even in a dimly lit room, images were clear enough to see.  Some powerpoint presentations may look washed out, but it depends on what you are presenting.  For movies, its good enough.  Audio is good, but doesn't have quite the range that would satisfy audiophiles.  Connect it to a bluetooth speaker though and you've got a great portable multimedia setup.  Customer service is top notch.  There was something wrong with the remote that I received and they sent out a new one immediately.  They also sent the code to update the firmware so that Google Play Services now runs off the device.  Sweet!  All in all, this device meets all of my needs, and I would suspect it would meet the needs of most people out there.

Title: Great portable gadget!
Comment: This was my 3rd pico projector bought and tested, and by far the best out of the 3. Easy to set up, great remote App, works great with my android, quality for the output, is quite decent (again for a portable pico). After loving this gadget, I realized I needed more of a at home/portable projector. so I returned the capsule, for the Mars II better for our family needs. again nothing wrong with the capsule, just depends on your personal needs are. for example if you need this for work/portability to project charts etc. Than get the capsule. for home (mainly) than get the Mars II. either way, both are great products, and a big plus the customer service very impressive and professional.

Title: After battery issues, great customer service
Comment: Picture, sound and OS work great. You're able to download apps like Amazon Prime, Netflix, Hulu, HBO, etc.I got this as a birthday gift last year, and had issues with keeping a battery charge -- even when plugged in. This spring, it stopped working entirely and wouldn't power on or charge. When I reached out to Nebula support, the response was quick, professional and easy. The warranty worked just as it should, no haggling about what the issue was -- just a simple replacement shipped within a few days after I mailed the defective projector back.The new one works even better than I'd hoped. Keeps battery charge for several hours, works great as a Bluetooth speaker and as a projector for indoor or outdoor movie nights. Especially during the pandemic, this has been a great day to have socially-distanced backyard get-togethers with friends and family.

Title: Great quality for the price.
Comment: I am a projector guy and Ive read some of the 2 and 1 star reviews and those people sound like they are not tech savy. Picked this up on Prime Day for $250. It's only been a day so we shall see if I need to update my review later, but right out of the box, it seemed well presented. Everything was there and more. I tested all the features and everything works as claimed. Picture quality is great, granted this is not an expensive projector. The people complaining about brightness in the day, it's the size of a soda can, what do you expect? Its decently bright, if you plan on using it in the day time, I recommend you dont make the screen size any bigger than 40 inches. Sound is comparable to an Amazon Echo or an old drive-in movie speaker. You can bluetooth it to better speakers so no big deal. I was surprized it had an automatic keystone for up and down, but can also be done manually. Apps worked well. The app controller is wonders! Screen mirroring a bit laggy, but I would only use that for things other than watching videos. A bit sad the Youtube app doesnt let you sign into your account. If I could be precise with my rating I'd say 4.5 stars. IMO, my expectations were low, but this came through and beat my expectations.

Title: Great portable cinema
Comment: This is an amazing product. I really expected to be slightly disappointed. Instead, I was really surprised at the overall quality of this product. We will use this in our RV.  One really nice unexpected feature is the ability to download movies and programs on Netflix and Amazon prime for offline playback. We will be able to download our favorite movies and have our own cinema while off grid.Sound quality is better than I expected but not cinema quality. But it can connect to another Bluetooth speaker to create a full blown home cinema system.Overall, I’m really pleased with this purchase. Two thumbs up, way up.

Title: Excelente producto!!!
Comment: Ya lo tengo un año y funciona perfecto, las características que ofrece por el precio supera a la competencia, el sonido es muy bueno para una sala pequeña o dormitorio, el ventilador casi no hace ruido, al menos a mi no me molesta en lo absoluto, lo uso con una pantalla de 60" y calidad del video es buena (obvio su resolución no es muy alta pero se ve bien), eso si necesita estar oscuro para verse bien, por su tamaño lo puedes llevar fácilmente a todos lados, la batería me dura unas 3 1/2 hrs y suelo conectarlo con un jbl clip 3 cuando quiero ver algún concierto, el control remoto es lo único que no me gusta, pero instalé la app en el celular y listo, hace unos días me contacté con el servicio al cliente (responden muy rápido) y les pregunté si había manera de instalar la store de google para no usar apptoide que viene por default, y me enviaron un código para instalar un beta del nuevo firmware y funcionó perfecto ahora ya tengo la app de youtube con mi cuenta y puedo actualizar las apps de inmediato (eso era un problema de apptoide que encuentras casi todas las apps pero no están las ultimas versiones).

Title: EXCELLENT, GREAT DESIGN. BEST IVE SEEN
Comment: This is a marvelous design and an excellent micro projector.  There are obviously compromises when bundling a projector,  battery, speaker,  and android streaming device in something the size of a soda can. However that said this is the best micro projector system I've seen. Great to carry in my computer bag for presentations and great for entertainment,  kids parties etc. Its not going to be a bright as a midrange projector,  the sound isn't as strong as a stand alone speaker but you have everything you need in your hand, pocket or bag

Title: OVERALL AMAZING PROJECTOR
Comment: PICTURE QUALITY AND BRIGHTNESS IS PRETTY GOOD IN A DARK ROOM. THE BUILT IN SOUND SYSTEM IS ALSO GREAT.I watched a 2.5H film and when it finished, there's still 55% battery power left. it's not a HD projector, but it's perfect for what I use it for :) also customer service is top notch and super friendly! as the other review metnioned, if you want full access to the google play store, you can contact them to ask to be a beta test user. I upgraded my firmware and it's been running very soothly so far. I found the iphone app much easier to use to control than the remote control it comes with.

Title: How cool is this!!
Comment: I love gadgets. My youngest son purchased this for me knowing I love gadgets and things I can use from my phone.But I thought wow how limited is this. Netflix and Amazon and what is this other stuff. THAT'S IT?!Well thanks to reading reviews from another Amazon purchasers I learned how to unlock the power of this product.The review was spot on! Got Google play store, mirrored my phone and even called the support line, Anker (800-988-7973 PST)and spoke with Kevin. Kevin walked me through the install for Google play store. I can get email from all the major outlets and watch anything I have downloaded to my phone. (Starting to ramble on).So here is the bottom line. This little projector is more than watching movies, great at that. Super clear, good sound. It does all kinds of stuff! I am looking forward to blasting big screen movies and checking email on walls around the house and grinning the whole time!!Highly recommend this product!Doc in Michigan

Title: Incredible piece of technology!
Comment: I am simply stunned at how much this little soda can sized projector can do!  The picture is impressive, sound volume is very decent, amd battery lasts 4 hours.  Plus, I love that I can watch Hulu live.  This brings TV to a new level.  Although it is capable of projecting a 100inch image, I have it on an 80 inch screen and find it to be a bit sharper.  Best part about it is that it can fit in my pocket, and when asked if I have a rocket in my pocket, I can proudly say I got a 100 inch TV in there!  Take a peek!

Title: YouTube TV Works !!! 😆😆😆
Comment: I bought the Nebula Capsule in hopes that it would support YouTube TV. At first it didn't; I would get a message stating that it didn't have the rights to stream the live content as well as other online streaming apps. I asked questions in forums and directly to the company. Then all of a sudden, "TODAY" I logged on to YouTube TV and after an update,  BAM!! IT WORKS!!!!!😃😃😃🤩🤩 THANK YOU SOOO MUCH!!

Title: Summer movie nights upgraded
Comment: Movie night will never be the same! Relatively easy to operate, but most apps require the remote app on a mobile device. We’re in the iOS so had some delay figuring out this devices App Store, once found - the streaming content seems endless plus the opportunity to connect with HDMI to our tablet/computer. Love this device.

Title: that they continue creating things like anker nebula and that they keep updating the version
Comment: I liked anker nebula this great just as I imagined it is perfect to watch a movie like in the cinema on a giant screen wherever I go / the only thing I don't like is that it won't let me do screen mirroring with my IPhone XR

Title: Decent Picture and GREAT Sound for a Pico Projector
Comment: Good picture & Great Sound for a pico projector with sharp focus all the way to the edges of the image (some projectors get blurry near the edges of the projected image). I posted 5 photos comparing the color and brightness to the Aaxa P300, Aaxa P700, Wowoto H8, DBPower T20 and the Ragu Z720 - check them out under "Customer Images".

Title: Fantastic product at a great price
Comment: The built in OS makes this device more usable than alternatives that require you to use your phone. I have a hard time going anywhere without it.Customer support at Anker is also fantastic. They were able to help me with a software issue and responded within hours.

Title: Perfect famaily gift, we loved buygin them mad a great christmas gift for my kids
Comment: The product is great we connected it and used it in a few minutes it came fully charged and kids went to game room and started watrching amazon prime moview they loved it.  Thanks Amazon great recommended gifts for family 2019.

Title: Awesome
Comment: We love it!  Use it to watch movies and games in the middle of the cul-de-sac with all out neighbors.  We use a photographer's frame and projector screen and it works perfect.

Title: Amazing!
Comment: This little thing is amazing, we have it for two days and already take It to the kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and living.Also, after the upgrade to the beta version with Google Play, I was able to install the apps I needed.Amazing little thing!

Title: Just what I was looking for
Comment: Works great in darker environments, and has great picture quality and sound.  The remote is a little hard to understand and use, but the app on your cell phone works great and is easy to use.  Overall we are really enjoying the product and the great support that we have received.

Title: Excellent purchase for kids
Comment: Excellent sound and picture.  Was skeptical but this is awesome.

Title: Outdoor movie time
Comment: I bought this as a gift for my son.  He loves it. They love it.

Title: Good
Comment: Good

Title: Perfect mini-projector balancing small size and features.
Comment: Performs just as expected for a mini-projector.  I keep it simple though, and only use it for Netflix, Amazon Prime and the HDMI connection.  I would buy this for work, but some of the HDMI cables are stiff enough, that when used with a laptop, it will move the projector.  Great size for family mobile use on a variety of walls.  The resolution is fine because I can't guarantee the quality of the wall or the lighting.

Title: Amazing little projector
Comment: This is a great projector for its size and price. The sound is better then I expected. I contacted support to get help with an app that was crashing that I really wanted to use. Support was very responsive and helpful. FYI can not screen share with a Google pixel phone. Only supports Miracast which Google does not.

Title: It is working wonderfully.
Comment: I love this projector! I bought it 2 years ago and it is working great!  It travels with me and during COVID Lockdown has been the cinema we missed.  Great customer service! I emailed them for information and they excelled.

Title: Incredible Projector with an Amazing customer service team to back it
Comment: All the great things about this projector are already mentioned in different reviews, test and posts. I would like to highlight that Nebula's customer service team is just incredible, very responsive and efficient. Special thanks to Helen from Customer Support team

Title: Convenient device. Great support
Comment: The Nebula Capsule is really convenient I like that I can carry it in the drink holder of my backpack. Having a builtin battery really increases the usability of the device, even though it's often near an outlet not having to be tethered to the wall is great.I needed some help with the Nebula and called anker support. The call was answered quickly and the support rep Kayla was great.

Title: Best projector
Comment: I love this product very much. The picture quality more than expectation from any projector that I have ever seen. Not sure for gaming but I wished I could log on to my YouTube Chanel. U can easily control it using the iPhone app if in case u can’t found the remote control.

Title: Easy to use and great picture size
Comment: Outside of the obvious small size and great color, most important the clarity of the projection and ease of use makes it a winner. This was and impulse gift to myself and I couldn’t be happier.  My only problem is trying to stop my boyfriend from borrowing it.

Title: This thing has blown use away easy to use and love how much adjustment the is ...

Title: Awesome projector! Totally replaced my TV.

Title: Great Product...amazing customer service.
Comment: Great little product for the price point with excellent customer service. I’m new to the world of projectors and wanted one that was compact that I could take on the go without breaking the bank.  A projector that could support AirPlay was a must. Having done exhaustive research, the Nebula Capsule checked all the boxes and I’m very please with the purchase so far. Very good picture quality for a portable compact projector.  The room does need to be very dark to get the most out of this projector which I assume is to be expected for this price point and size(I’ve seen $3000+ projectors struggle with lighting conditions for comparison).The built in audio speaker does the job when on the go but I like to link my portable Bluetooth speaker to maximize the audio experience.There are some streaming limitations with airplay due to DRM copyright restrictions certain apps like Netflix or Disney+ won’t work which is a bummer if your traveling and not tapped into a WiFi network.Solution to circumvent this is to buy the $50 Apple HDMI adaptor which works like a charm for connecting your phone to the Capsule. (Do not purchase the after market adaptors as you will still face the DRM restriction).Customer Service: The customer service I received from Nebula Support Team(shout out to Ada and Wendy) was next level. They went above and beyond all expectations I had by regularly following up with me to ensure I was satisfied. In my research I found out you can request Google Play firmware for an enhanced experience which they were able to fullfill as well as helping me install Disney+ given it had just launched. They made it a point to check in with me along the process to ensure I was up and running without issue.This product coupled with the customer experience received has sparked a new found interest in exploring Anker products for my electronic needs.

Title: Excellent customer service
Comment: First time i bought the projector it didn’t work (it doesn’t turn on) so, i texted support and immediately they changed the item (it was very fast, and they make an exception because I’m out of US) Very nice persons and excellent customer service 💛  the new projector works perfectly!! i won’t buy tv’s anymore only anker pryectors 🤞🏼

Title: SO SO GOOD.

THIS IS THE BEST PROJECTOR I HAVE EVER OWNED. I’ve owned maybe 17 in my lifetime and this one is by far the best. It’s so small yet more powerful than my larger ones. Very descreet, yet the 360 speaker volume is tremendous and it fills up the entire room with what appears to be surround sound. It’s so easy to use and is truly a portable soda can smart tv. So freaking good! Order now. Any bad reviews I’d treat with great incredulousness. This is the real deal.

Title: Awesome

Title: #Yep
Comment: We were stoked to get this and upon unboxing got very discouraged it wasn’t going to do what we wanted it to do. It wasn’t until we went through 2 updates of the software that all of a sudden it clicked! We got Disney+, Netflix and Amazon connected with relative ease. We put on Moana in the backyard for the kids and neighborhood kids and they were all entranced. Our kids asked the next morning if they could “watch a movie on the wall” 😂 The brightness at night/dusk, was great but you wouldn’t be able to see it during the day. The in app remote was much easier to use than the physical one provided. Overall, we’re very happy with this purchase and can’t wait to use it while camping! We will end up getting the recommended Apple cable to connect our phones to it though so we can watch movies and shows offline

Title: a really wonderful mini projector

It's perfect, very stylish.Picture is clear, color is correct (same as on my iPhone). Noise is low. I have watched a 2 hour movie, still has battery.Very convenient to use.The only thing I'm not happy is there is a small piece of plastic to insulate the battery, geez, it took me 10 minutes to take it out. It's actually got stuck to the battery.

Title: For what it is, it's amazing
Comment: I wavered between high quality and ease of use. I'm so glad I went with the capsule. I have an Optima HD that has all the awesomeness resolution and brightness. But our home doesn't have a dedicated screen space and the Nebula kicks the Optima's but in portability. It's small, it's wireless, it's streams directly from itself. It's awesome and I haven't used the Optima since we've bought this little thing.I toyed with the idea of spending double to get the new version. I just couldn't justify the cost. For the price, the first edition is perfect.

Title: So fun and easy to use!
Comment: This projector is the best, completely worth the money! We bought a different one here on Amazon that was cheaper and ended up returning it, just start with a good quality one like this. The picture quality is great and it’s so simple to use. There is an app that allows you to use your phone like a mouse on the screen and it easily connects to Bluetooth headphones.

Title: Awesome

Title: Powerful, yet in a small package
Comment: Totally exceeded my expectation! Brightness is awesome, you can see projection clearly even in a lit room. Connects to both my iPad and android tablets super quickly. Image correction makes sure that I don't need to tweak too much for rectangle projection. You will have some fan noise, but with speaker playing sounds it's barely noticeable. Chargeable with a power bank. Also, the support staff was super responsive, friendly and knowledgable! This is one very powerful projector jammed into a can-sized form factor. Only downside so far is that the remote only works when pointed towards the back 180 degrees of the unit. Overall strongly recommended!

Title: Great device. Super handy.
Comment: This thing is great. Small, good battery life, good app, and good picture quality. The device itself feels solid and well made. Well worth the money. My only complaint/suggestion to Anker is the round design makes it hard to prop up. Maybe use a hexagon/pentagon or something with sides. I got around this by sticking a Scosche metal plate to the bottom and mounting a Scosche dash mount to the plastic container I store my Nebula in. I can then just stick the Nebula onto the magnet mount and it holds it well enough to angle it however needed.

Title: Love it
Comment: I love this thing.  I've taken it out backpacking to watch a movie at night in my tent. It's awesome, I download stuff off Netflix and it works great.  Battery life does great but I still bring an external.  I use my cellphone as a mouse to guide through the device.  I tried the touchscreen android projectors but I've had to return them because they won't download or update certain TV apps. This has not been an issue with this projector.  The image is excellent and it gets very large.  Can fill up a wall and so look great.  Epic Device!

Title: Perfect and portable

Title: Perfect
Comment: This projector is completely cordless and amazing! I was looking for a projector that I could take camping without worrying about a mess of cords that would get in the way, and this is it! The fan is super silent and non noticeable and the projector is able to play at a decently loud volume if necessary! Super easy to set up and use. The battery life is exactly 4 hours so you can watch whatever movie you want and it charges incredibly fast! The picture and overall quality is amazing and I would 10/10 definitely recommend!

Title: Compared to the WOWOTO T8e, Nebula made a great set of compromises on a truly portable device
Comment: After comparison to the WOWOTO T8E: Bumping up one star.  I wish I could settle at say, 3.75 stars.  I really want a bit more ANSI lumens (200 would be solid); and 720P.  But Anker/Nebula clearly balanced a lot of choices in the design here.  Internal apps also need work, and we need Google Play Services stat.  I also think Netflix needs a tweak to support higher resolution streaming as it seems to settle on 480p and lower bitrate than I'd like and I find connecting my phone via HDMI results in a better Netflix experience.Overall I'm sticking with the Nebula Capsule over the T8e.  My reasons being:1) Fan noise on the T8e is way too annoying2) T8e has a terrible internal speaker, and using a BT speaker is a huge problem because of a .5s-1s audio delay3) No smartphone app for control - this is the the best part of the Nebula Capsule as the smartphone app is excellent.  I hated using the touchpad on the top of the T8e.4) <2 hours Battery life on the T8e means you will likely always need to plug in during a full length movie.5) While the T8e is fairly portable - it's not "toss in the pocket/bag" portable - and I certainly wouldn't count on the battery of the T8e to last long enoughThe T8e certainly provided a sharper, brighter, and overall better image - but also I found colors overly saturated and red.  I'm debating the WOWOTO H8 for a permanent setup and sticking with the capsule for portable needs.  The bottom line is that if you don't need a BATTERY powered portable device with a very capable internal speaker, there are better choices than the Nebula for image quality.  Anker/Nebula clearly focused on a truly capable stand-alone/no wires attached experience that can last well past a single full-length movie and provide a decent enough speaker to make sure a crowd can hear.  The addition of solid connectivity, and bluetooth that is lag free are huge capabilities.  And let's be straightforward, the fact it runs Android 7.0 already is a huge advantage to app updates moving forward.  A lot of companies (like WOWOTO) say they will upgrade, but I wouldn't hold your breath.I'm deducting 1 star in order to bring attention to an issue with Netflix.  I've noticed that Netflix seems to cap resolution/bitrate to a pretty low level when using the built in app on the Capsule.  I see lots of pixelation and compression artifacts that make the image quality severely reduced.  When I plug in an HDMI stream of the same movie/show on Netflix, the image is decidedly sharper with no compression artifacts and noticeable higher bitrate.  I've checked the youtube settings - but nothing in there other than for "high" quality downloads.  I'm really loving this toy, but find the built apps really lack across the board and often have to plug in something to HDMI to improve the situation.

Title: Very Satisified
Comment: When I first saw the Nebula Capsule, I knew I had to own one. All the specs seemed to be sufficient, so I figured I would give it a go. If you plan to use this to project on your ceiling, I suggest buying the tripod. Especially if you are using the HDMI from another device as your input source.Pros:Battery Life - This is sufficient for a long movie and additional usage. Along with being able to charge and play movies, even better!Picture Quality - For not having a dedicated screen, projecting on white walls have been fantastic. The quality isn't anything super HD, but it also isn't advertised as such.Built-In Android - I'm an iPhone person, so I wasn't sure what to expect out of the built in Android. The apps install and update very easily. Some of the apps don't function properly, but this could be due to the app creator and not the Nebula Capsule.Speaker - Sufficient for most areas, but you may need to use an external Bluetooth speaker depending on the ambient noise around you.Fan Noise - I had read some reviews that said the fan was loud, but my experience has been quite the opposite. Mine is very low and isn't noticeable.Cons:Lens - I would like to see a shutter or protector for the lens for when it's not in use.Apps - You can't sign into certain apps with the built in version of Android.Screen Mirroring - The screen mirroring from the iPhone is accomplished easy enough, but with some apps there seems to be a very noticeable delay. This being said, using the Apple lightning to HDMI adapter to the projector works great.

Title: From a filmmakers perspective.
Comment: What I love about this thing is that it brings the simple joy of movies and story’s back in a way that reminds me of when I was young. The ability to take a movie with you camping or at grandmas house, it’s just fun. It’s as small and cool as it seems.The bad. For my taste, I dont love the resolution. At 8 feet away I just found it a bit soft. More than that though, and this is something I’m not seeing many talk about, the frame rate seems to be lousy so a lot of shots were jerky or choppy, especially those big, sweeping landscape shots that are supposed to feel epic. Chop chop chop. Brightness is fine but treat it like a theater and turn off all the lights. I’d love 2-300 limes but it’s a coke can so I can’t complain.The software is “fine.”  Figure out how to get most of what you want through amazon or Netflix.Here’s the biggest takeaway. If you want a great picture, get the bigger one. If you want a fun little surprise you can toss in your bag and then surprise your family with. Something where you can sit around and just enjoy a good story, it’s terrific.That being said I’d happily spend $1-200 more on a new one if it had more punch.

Title: Great now that I have google play!
Comment: We had a rough beginning but I finally love it! I could not for the life of me get my note 9 to screencast, without a 3rd party app called "castto". The problem is, it froze so much. I use this to stream peloton workouts so it was super frustrating when it would freeze for a good 2-3 minutes, multiple times, during workouts. I was not sure if it was the casting app or the Nebula that was freezing. I finally got around to calling Nebula, to get the password to install google play, so I could just download the app I wanted instead of screen casting. Like the other reviewer said, to get google play you need to: Go to ABOUT in the settings menu and CLICK ON THE ANDROID VERSION 5 TIMES in a row. A password window comes up, input gmstest1221 (all lower case, no spaces) then click DONE and it'll let you install. The device will need to reboot.After I got google play, I took my workout class and experienced NO freezing. So it seems to be the casting app I was using. Nebula really should consider selling the device with google play already installed.The sound is GREAT imo but the remote sucks and is highly frustrating.  I love that this projector is so small. Easily portable. I do think it's too expensive for what it is.

Title: Wanted to love it, but it wouldn't love me...
Comment: I wanted to give this more stars, but it just falls short... I am sending this back because the unit I received has a defect, but I did test it (at least the features that were working) and here is what I got to say:Pros:---------------- Runs cool to the touch (Every time i turned it on it never got hot)- Feels really well built- Projector works well- Built in speaker holds its own....not better than most portable speakers but still a good speaker.Cons:------------------ Let's start with the biggest: The OS is buggy.... and I couldn't even successfully download apps from the store. Every time i tried it crashed.- This device is severely lacking inputs. Other models out there have more inputs- The remote control is absurdly finicky, you have to aim it right behind the projector and if you don't your input wont register....- No Google Play Store?!?!??! Why?!??!?! (to be fair they include Aptoide TV but it's a far cry from the play store).Conclusion: I really wanted to love this product. But after not being able to download apps because of crashing, I did a factory reset, and same problem kept occurring. Thinking it may have been an internet issue I tried to use it from a different Wifi and still no good. Unfortunately because mine wouldn't let me download apps I had to test it other ways (via HDMI).I know what you're thinking It sounds like I hate it, so why 3 stars? Well when it did work the projector was really good for the price. I am sure my unit was just defective, and if it did work I would have probably given it 4 stars. There are other reviews out there that talk about the OS....read them.... I should have paid more attention prior to purchase.UPDATE:Bumped 1 star because of customer service. Anker Customer service reached out to me and tried to make things right, however I had already returned the device. They had offered to replace my device with a brand new device at no charge. It was a really kind gesture and I think it was really cool that they reached out to me to try to make it right.

Title: Tested in home and outdoors for groups
Comment: I've used this to screen outdoor movies and it was plenty bright with good picture. You can get better picture quality from cheaper projectors, but the convenience factor is just too good. I went from watching a movie in on room to the other with no set up needed.  I just moved my tripod from one room to the other. If it wasn't so convenient, I'd never use it. Since it is, I use it constantly.The included software does the job, though some apps require you to use your phone as a remote.If the price is egregious to you but you still want portability, I would suggest investing in a cheaper projector but also get a stand and a mount. You're probably looking at spending about the same at that point.Cons:Sound - the speakers are loud enough, but they are tinny. It does NOT have aux hook up, so you'll have to rely on Bluetooth. I found there to be some lag with the bluetooth though. There is a way around this. Instead of connecting to the projector to the bluetooth speaker, connect the DEVICE to the bluetooth speaker.Example, watching a movie through your laptop via the HDMI cable - have the laptop connect to the bluetooth speaker. You won't get lag that way.Overall:Biggest complaint is lack of Aux cable. Other than that, this has been an incredibly smooth and easy product to use. Even at $300, I'm happy with it.

Title: Didn't Work with iPhone (updated)
Comment: We returned the item as it didn't work as we expected.  You can't set the system up without a phone app even though it looks like there are controls for it on the device.  The iPhone app interface is clumsy and the touch control doesn't work well.  The UI screen flow is incomprehensible.  We couldn't get the iPhone display to project and when we tried to download the device's Netflix, etc. apps to project shows that way; the installs always failed with "Unexpected error".  It even took quite a bit of playing to get the PC display to project.  I probably could have played with it, bought more cables and gotten everything to eventually work but this was a present for someone who is not technically savvy and gets frustrated getting techy stuff to work.  I've been in IT for decades and everything about the projector setup and operation felt like it was designed by a techie for a techies and not for a consumer.  When we did get a projected display, the display was OK.(update)  Anker contacted me about my review and the returned item.  They apologized for my experience with their product and sent a bluetooth speaker to me by way of compensation (I had already received a full refund).  I am impressed with the customer service response and appreciate the gesture so I've changed the rating from 2 to 4 stars though I guess that should really apply to the seller not the product.  Still, a company that reaches out to its unhappy customers deserves some credit.

Title: Nice hardware design but user experience is terrible
Comment: Bought this for it's portability and ease of use through WiFi and streaming applications. Was easy to set-up and the quality is good. However, the negative outweighs the positive for me. When streaming, it goes to sleep every 30 min or so. I have to remember to move the mouse which ruins the experience. If there's a setting to change this, I can't find it in all the menus I've sorted through. Searched online for a solution and nothing was helpful. Just opening a show on Netflix is a nightmare. Even using the Nebula Connect app is painful for scrolling. Usually need to close out the Netflix app completely and open it again. Would not recommend this.UPDATE: Anker customer support is really superb. They followed up to ensure my software and firmware were up to date to resolve my issue. The sleeping issue no longer happens, but I’m still experiencing some minor glitches. I’ve revised my rating to a 4.

Title: Amazing concept that could use a little tweaking
Comment: Our family decided to put on an outdoor movie in the backyard, so I started looking at buying a projector. I quickly realized we were going to need a lot of cords/connections to make it work. And then I ran across this handy product.Pros:- No extension cords needed, no connecting to a receiver/laptop for media content, and speakers already built in... AMAZING!! Plus, controlling it all from my own phone (or the provided remote if I want).- Has apps for streaming content, which basically makes it a portable smart TV- The speakers are great for most use, but for an outdoor movie with lots of people, we decided to connect it via bluetooth to our Sonos Move speaker. Brilliant built-in option, and again, no cords needed.- Setup was extremely easy.- Auto keystone correction feature is really handy. It senses the angle of tilt and adjusts the picture to match, so you don't end up with a weird trapezoid shape.- Has screw in feature at the bottom for a standard tripod.Cons:- Noticeably dim. This was the biggest disappointment for me. Even when it was completely dark outside and we were using a proper movie screen, I felt like the movie picture was just a little dark. There is an option in the settings to adjust to "max brightness", but it can only support 1.5 hrs of playtime, which makes it impractical for most movies.- No way to adjust tilt angle of the projection without physically moving the whole thing (or using a tripod). Not that this is usually an issue, but we tried once to project it on a slanted ceiling, and there was just no way to prop it up to the right angle to aim it at the ceiling without kind of leaning it against a pillow.- Downloading Google Play services is a pain. As others have said, you have to contact customer service and jump through some extra hoops to access this content. I wanted to watch Youtube TV app on it and it would not work until I ran the extra update they required.- Sometimes the provided remote does not work. Still can't figure out why.Overall we like it and hope to see some improvements in the next edition. If nothing else, it really impressed our friends. :)

Title: Great little projector
Comment: I bought this projector to use when camping and also for the occasional time when we want to watch TV in our bedroom (which does not have a TV). I have watched about 20 hours of content on this device so far, so feel like I am in a position to give it a fair review.Picture quality: Is excellent, as long as you are using it in the dark.Sound: Shockingly good for a device this small. As good as bluetooth speakers I have that cost 2x as much.Software: The one drawback, I've found, is the native software installed on this puppy. It is buggy and it certain streaming services are not available. We use it with a Roku attached to the HDMI port, and I'd say be prepared to connect an external device if you buy. I have had some luck mirroring my iphone but this is not a perfect solution as all content cannot be mirrored.In all, this is an excellent device for the price. It is not a replacement for a TV and could have better native software, but I'd still recommend it if you have an occasion for a pocket-sized projector.

Title: Works well, but has flaws
Comment: I really like this portable projector.PROS:It can display a large "screen".The sound is adequate for viewing.It's tiny.It has good battery life.HDMI input works with my Chromecast.CONS:Focus adjustment does not make easy fine adjustments.Does not use Google Play. App updates are iffy.Remote is IR not Bluetooth.  You have to point it at the sensor on the back.Not all apps support the inherent controls.Needs to be dark to see. I hear the newer version is brighter.

Title: It's so small and it does so much!
Comment: It's loud, the fans, if you are in a small room and have it replacing your tv. It sparks conversation among friends as it it super small and can expand so much and still look super clear. It could be brighter but hey it already does a LOT for its size. Sometimes on videos that are too saturated it will lag, like the ones from Kurzgesagt.... for some reason his videos always freeze and I'm not kidding. I never got it to connect to the air play or smart view, I had to get me an external hdmi smart view adaptor to make it work as such. You won't be able to turn a party with the speaker as it lacks base and loudness; however it works good on a small room to watch a movie. Overall if you want to get one for on the go and to surprise family and friends at parties this is your gadget. If you want something professional or robust they offer more options.

Title: Decent product
Comment: Update: this company really cares about their products and their service. From all my amazon experiences this company has one of the best customer service to address the problem you are facing at hand; hence I added one more star.For whopping 300 dollars not convinced whether this was all worth it. First the best feature: SPEAKERS. Honestly I don’t feel the need to attach any external speakers. Second best: Battery life. It’s pretty awesome you can watch a whole movie or two without having to worry about recharging. Everything else is nothing impressive; the light is pretty low, can’t see much as long as the sun is still hangs low in the sky, resolution is low that you can see the individual pixels at just about 30+ inches screen size(I cannot imagine the low quality it being projected for 50in). Design is cute and it is very portable. My return window closed while debating and I guess I am ok keeping it but not thrilled, hence 3 stars.

Title: Anker Customer Support is THE BEST
Comment: My first Capsule died unexpectedly and for no apparent reason. The return and replacement was simple, straight forward, and quick. I encountered and odd problem with the Capsule that "was NOT the fault of the Capsule." There is a software app (Nebula Connect) that is necessary to use certain Capsule features (like: YouTube, Netflix, Amazon Prime Video) and the app worked perfectly with my wife's Pixel 4A but would not work on my Pixel 4. Anker Customer Support spent several days debugging the issue and stuck with me until the problem was solved. Anker Customer Support provided some of the best customer support I have ever received.

Title: Love this little thing! Unbelievable value for what you get.
Comment: Set the bar the right height and you will love this thing. It's only 480p, yes.I will remind you that a few years ago that was high end DVD progressive scan quality! Inside of a projector the size of a coke can that also works off of a battery as well?! AND it will stream via Wifi and connect to Plex, Netflix, Hulu etc? Are you kidding me?Incredible value. Being in the Audio Visual industry I was skeptical and expected this thing to be going back after I played with it for a few hours. Pleasantly surprised. Keeping this little guy. Have used in bedroom and in the back yard and been happy. good stuff.

Title: Excellent little piece of hardware with serious software flaws
Comment: We’ve been talking ourselves out of returning this in favor of a cheaper option but the convenience is just so worth it. It’s tiny, it comes with decent sound (think mid-range Bluetooth speaker), and it can run without cables.The downsides are there. I gave up on the onboard apps. The remote doesn’t work with any streaming service and requires you to use the Nebula app. And even then, you have to change it to “mouse mode” in order to make it work. Highly recommend connecting it to an Apple TV or hooking up a fire stick to keep the bulk down.That being said, I connected the Xbox and ran with that.Automatic keystone adjustment is hit or miss. In ideal settings I’m sure it works well. But on an RV it’s basically point it and the brightest surface in the room you’re in so it’s hard to get the keystone levels dialed in. Eventually you accept it the way it is. So, the portability makes it worth it. The tiny fan sounds like static so it can be a little annoying if it’s close to you.

Title: Great little projector, and it really is about the size of a soda can
Comment: This isn't the projector you'd want for a permanent home theater, but it's perfect for watching movies in the backyard or some other fun special occasion. The image isn't really HD, and it isn't especially bright, but in a dark room, it's great; the closer it is to the screen, the brighter the image, but we watched Endgame on a 100" screen the other night, and it was fine. It comes with a handful of streaming apps, including Amazon Prime Video and some other big ones, so you don't have to connect to a laptop or Blu-ray player to watch movies. The built-in speaker is fine -- not spectacular, but definitely good enough. And it really is about the size of a soda can, and, so far, the battery has lasted me about 4 hours per charge, which is plenty of time to watch most movies. I also like the automatic keystoning; the software automatically adjusts and squares up the image, so the top isn't bigger than the bottom. The remote is fine, it works, but some streaming apps work best if you download the Nebula app onto your phone and use it, instead. Plus, there's a thing in the bottom, so you can screw it into a tripod, which is nice. Also, I had no trouble connecting it to my home WiFi. TL;DR: A great little projector that's really all you need to have movie night.

Title: Small, convenient projector! Awesome for bedroom setting
Comment: We bought this with the plan to use it in our bedroom without the need to install a wall mounted platform or having cables around the bed. This small projector works perfectly the way we wanted it to be. It's small with a loud speaker, and the image quality is great on our wall (light grey in color). We are using it on a small laptop desk on our bed and we can enjoy the shows all night. We see ourselves using it at our patio or the living room as well.There were compatibility issues with Amazon Prime Videos and Peacock TV at the begin, but all were resolved very quickly after contacting the technical staff at Nebula. They were very responsive and helpful. This projector, at this moment, does not support HD viewing on Netflix though (a block from Netflix' side). So now we are watching Netflix with our regular TV, which is fine. We are very happy with our purchase!

Title: My first experience was not good but my second attempt worked well
Comment: 5/22 update: I am updating to 4 stars based on the stellar customer support received after my first experience. Upon initially returning the nebula, Anker reached out asking about my experience. Long story short, I agreed to give them a second chance as it seems the nebula I had initially received was defective. Anker agreed to honor the “deal of the day” price of my initial purchase and work with me to get me a replacement before upcoming travel. I received the new nebula today and this time setup went as expected. While it is still early to say, so far I am happy with how the device is working.———I am puzzled about all the good reviews. Maybe I just got the lemon. I connected everything according to instructions from an iPhone 7+. Upon setting up wifi and bluetooth, and downloading the app, everything was sync'd fine. However, when opening the apps (youtube, amazon, netflix) I consistently got a network error message. I tried projecting from HDMI and got an error saying no hdmi signal. I tried rebooting, and recovering to no avail. Bottom line: I was never able to project anything.  This should be an easy out of the box setup experience for a new phone like an iPhone 7+. Not sure if this is an incompatibility between their Android system or what--I am very frustrated and sending back for a refund.

Title: My family loves it!
Comment: First of all, this thing is small! Compared to the other projectors I’ve seen. It’s the size of a soda can. My guests would get so amaze whe they see it. How convenient! So easy to store and put away and bring along. We use it for outdoor movie night in our backyard and in my kids’ room for a tv night before bed. We just project the shows/movie on their wall while they watch it on their bed. The picture quality is great. The reason for only 4 stars is it’s not loud enough for outdoor movie night. I have a big backyard and I project the movie to our fence. So it’s not loud enough when outside in a big space. But it is loud enough indoors. But overall I’m very happy with this projector!

Title: Easy to set up, plug and play.
Comment: This is a great, little and extremely portable projector to use.  It was plug and play using my eye phone.  I didn’t have to fiddle with any settings.  I used an HDMI cable into the projector as recommended in the instruction sheet to an HDMI to iPhone connector.  Very easy.  The picture quality was very good.  The only thing to be aware of is to achieve the best picture quality you really need it to be dark.  I used the projector outside at night and had great results.  I tried again at sunset and had to wait until the sun went down and it got dark.  It doesn’t come with a remote but you can focus using the built in focus dial.  For the price, the size and its capability it an amazing little projector.  The internal speaker is very good, but keep in mind it’s not going to produce Dolby digital sound.  Given the limitation of needing to be dark it’s a great value, very to easy set up, plug and play and allowed me to entertain a group of campers with movies from my iPhone in the evening.

Title: Great little projector that gives an enjoyable experience.
Comment: This little projector I bought about 2 or 3 years ago and still going strong. The brightness is good for a dark room and very dimly lit room. Personally the brightness was not to bad because I enjoy a darker ambience. Battery life is about 3-5 hours for me depending on the lighting mode you choose. There are three modes. Auto, Bright and Balanced. Bright is great for brighter lit rooms and balance will definitely extend your battery life. Only con for me is the remote being Infrared and the sensor being on the back of the Capsule. A bluetooth air-mouse or touchpad remote would have been a lot more useful removing the restrictions of the IR. The workaround which definitely resolves the issue it the Nebula app that allows you to use your phone as a remote. This is the saving grace for me to navigate the interface.

Title: Very portable and easy to use
Comment: This product is very portable and easy to use. The remote control leaves a lot to be desired but at least it works. When mine arrived the remote was cracked and didn't work. Thankfully, Evans from customer support was about to get me a replacement as well as getting me the code so that I could install Google Play. Google play makes all the difference with this projector, it is an absolutely must! I do wish it had an auto focus option.::edit:: the remote is terrible and makes navigating this device almost impossible if you dont have the phone app.... which shouldn't be the case. The remote that comes with it should be able to work with the device

Title: Great projector for inside use, not so great outside.
Comment: If you’re going to use this model in a dark room inside your house this is a great item. The sound is surprisingly great for 1 single speaker. However if you’re thinking of bringing it outside (even with the use of a screen) it is going to be very hard to see the picture. That is unless you live out in the boonies. I live about an hour away from any major metropolitan area/airport and it isn’t dark enough but maybe it is pitch black outside where you live it may work. Also it is not HD if you care but has a good pic quality when you focus it manually. If you have YouTube, Netflix etc you can stream direct.

Title: For an Anker product, I feel it lacks its' usual user friendliness and high performance.
Comment: I haven't had a chance to try out all it's extras but I like it so far (not in love with it though). I downloaded the phone app to use a mouse and controller but the bluetooth connection is very spotty. When it works, it's pretty handy vs the controller it comes with. The picture is a bit blurry even with the ability to adjust the clarity. I've only tried it on walls and doors not a projector screen. I do like Anker products so I am kinda disappointed with this products lack of user friendly controls and high performance but I will have to play with it a bit more to find all the little goodies it might hold. Also, I might be rating it a bit higher because I was able to buy this for a bit cheaper than it's current listed price. I brought this to try & replace a TV but I might still buy a TV in the end. Oh wells! If I find something else to report, I will update the review. Overall, I'm 50-50 about recommending it. I did read several other reviews saying there are better comparable products but being an Anker fan and for it's portability (battery life), I went with this one.

Title: Great lil' product with some room to improve
Comment: Pros: Aesthetics are sexy; surprisingly great sound quality (can also be used as a bluetooth speak for music); picture quality is goodCons: Could be brighter, picture quality doesn't seem quite 720p despite claim. Remote controls are always clunky for digital navigation.Overall: I like this product a lot. I find certain light, despite being the same 'brightness', makes it more difficult to see. Particularly if the scenes are already dark, it can get washed out. The darker the room, the better. Also, despite having the projector on a flat surface, there seems to be a slight tilt to the picture. Not sure if that's a device issue or not but I noted it on a couple different surfaces. But I knew what the limits were and it's an impressive little device!

Title: Nice, portable display/projection unit with excellent quality
Comment: very good picture quality, although not 4K/HD.  I think the difference is negligible.  Brightness is a relative term.  "How dark is your operating environment" is the key factor.  The darker, the better.  Night time or low ambient lighting - great.  Remote control via your phone is far superior to the handheld remote supplied with the unit.  The unit is portable, light weight and easy to set up.  I often forget that I have it in my backpack.  Good investment for the price

Title: Good for a couple!
Comment: I really wanted something compact, and easy to use for camping. The picture is clear and it's easy to stream off of it.* Phone mirror using app* USB for files* HDMI for DVD players.It's a solid buy and I recommend this for someone looking for a casual small group projector. This is best for solo use or with a small group of friends. As a teacher, I wouldn't recommend this for a larger size group as the picture wont be big enough and the audio isnt loud enough.The remote feels sturdy and feels like most amazon stick remotes. My issue is it only works for select things on the projector. Sometimes you are forced to use the mouse pad function on it, which is a pain.

Title: Gifted This. Seemed to be a good product from the reviews.
Comment: I first got this in an open box, clearly someone had gotten and opened this projector and then returned it before me. I will say I exchanged it for a brand new one an it came quickly. But if I am going to spend this kind of money, I shouldn't have had to deal with this in the first place.I purchased this for a gift for someone. They were very ecstatic for the gift. They said it was a perfect present.I would buy this again.

Title: You get what you pay for.
Comment: You get a small projector that produces a big screen. You loose a long battery life, maybe 2.5 hours max.  Big picture that projects to any screen or wall, I don’t use a screen, still works fine.  The remote is light weight, non-responsive from a distance, seems cheap...but so is the projector.  This is great for people who want a projector in their life but are not looking to put the money into getting the best of the best.  Good solid machine here. Get it on sale, pay less then 300 and you come away a winner.

Title: awesome mini projector for home
Comment: This is a good pic and decent sound projector for the size, I work a lot with projectors for work and hoped this would stand up to my current one I have that is bigger and heavier.. it does not. You must be in a dark room as the brightness is not adjustable, it is very portable and easy to connect once you find the sweet spot for the remote to work. The app is super helpful for the controlling of the functions for the Nebula and it does connect to wifi and has many apps avail to watch shows and play games.was torn on sending back but decided to keep it for personal use when a hotel room TV is just to small to watch movies on.

Title: Good customer service!!! Very helpful!!!
Comment: I have re- wrote this review, it has now been a couple of months since i bought it, and after the best customer  service rep, they won me over, and i did not return it, also my husband seems to love how easy it is to use,in  day time the colors are faded but if you have the right curtains or a dark room, and do not exceed the screening size it will give you good color and brightness, it is very handy, volume is good, only reason i gave it 4 stars is because of app and because battery has 4 hr life, size is amazingly small, cool tech toy, kids love it,

Title: Much better as soon as you can install apps from Play
Comment: Updated:The situation changes dramatically as soon as get update to the beta version of firmware and now can install near-arbitrary app from Google Play. Such as VLC Player or Google Keyboard.Previously:Being 'portable' doesn't make it _mobile_, you can't project from a phone (latest Android), neither Bluetooth nor Chromecast, until your phone supports Miracast (mine doesn't). You can't login to YouTube to watch paid movies. Installing language other than English is prohibitively complex. But the worse it doesn't support modern video formats from USB, neither HDrip no BDrip. Nor you can choose sound channel, if file contains multiple.

Title: Great for what it is
Comment: You gotta appreciate what you're working with here, the size of it is literally the size of a coke can and in that you're squeezing so much, so yeah, it's not the brightest projector and will need a fairly dark room to pick up on nuances of the image, but that's fine, it does surprisingly well in average lighting, better than expected.Also, if you think of a Bluetooth speaker half the size of a coke can, yeah, it's not going to be as loud or basey but the tinny edge isn't too bad. One thing I would've liked would be the newer bluetooth specification as although this device supports linking a bluetooth speaker or headphones with better audio quality, the audio is delayed (newer bluetooth spec. accounts for this, I have it on my PC). There's also no (obvious anyway) way to delay the audio in say Youtube or Netflix so it makes the bluetooth audio pretty pointless.I used to have a no-name cheap chinese pocket projector (about the size of two phones atop each other) and this is brighter, better battery and has a speaker (the other does not) however the other had a 1.3mm audio out which is useful (especially as the bluetooth audio here isn't) and it also had a microsd card slot, which again is handy to load content and works around the limitations of the onboard memory (which is only 8GB to start with and most of that is taken by the OS and apps).Having an android OS onboard though is great and something the cheap chinese model didn't have, it just makes things so much easier having it native to the device, rather than trying to mirror netflix from my phone.All in, it's definitely been worth the upgrade from the previous model, but does have a couple of niggles I hope they work out in either an update (bluetooth spec) or future revision (ports).You can see on the image about an 100" screen on my studio flat's wall, filling the room from the desk across it when I was in the midst of moving out, the TV and most fittings gone the day before, this was a good cover until I followed them! (or when I'm travelling with work)

Title: So far it's meeting expectations
Comment: Just got this and overall it matches the reviews and online comments elsewhere. The daytime brightness is impressive, or my expectation was low. It seems operating on Android system. You won't need iphone if you want to watch Youtube or Amazon (if you trust your pw with them).Iphone mirroring works, though the image is limited to a portrait view, rather than landscape. Battery seems just ok. Watching 80 minutes of Youtube seems to consume 40%.The 4-star is due to the high price.

Title: Looks much better than one would expect
Comment: Love the build quality, size, and display brightness.What I didn't like was the IR remote control. I've come to expect RF remotes. My original Amazon Echo remote, from the original amazon beta is only on its 3rd set of batteries, and that one even transmits voice wirelessly.So, yeah. I didn't see that called out explicitly, and it was a deal-breaker for me.I have a friend who travels even more than I do, and he *loves* it. So if you don't mind an IR remote, give it a shot!

Title: Easy to use! Good video quality and decent volume.
Comment: This projector has good quality video, I wish I was able to focus a little better at larger sizes, but otherwise it is good quality for the price. Likewise, the volume and sound quality for the price is good, but I usually use my Bluetooth Bose headphones or JBL portable Bluetooth speaker to get better sound quality. I really LOVE that I can continue watching videos while charging the projector, this means I have the option to watch 24/7 as long as I have it plugged into a power source. I was bit worried about navigating with the device menu when I first purchased this Nebula Capsule, but it has been SO easy and the app you can download on your phone makes it so you don't even have to keep track of a remote!

Title: Awesome device for the money
Comment: Hardware: solid Anker quality (I also have wall charger, portable speaker, battery pack from Anker and they've all been quality products).  The only thing I wish it had was autofocus, but its not a huge deal.  I love gadgets, game on full-size projectors, and really appreciate the thought that went into this projector.Remote: There is a learning curve, but give it some time to learn where the main buttons are and it's easy to operate.  There's also the phone app, and you can get some more features.. the remote is usually just fineSoftware - overall: It is a trimmed down Android OS, but for most users it'll do everything you need.  You can get access to the full Play store fairly easily.Software - specifics:-RetroArch: This will run fine with a paired controller, only tested 2600 and some NES so far-Steam link: Some issues with the app, looks like resolution and clipping.. not officially supported so it would just be a bonus if this was usable one day-RCN2go: I'll know by the end of the week if this worksThis thing is great for camping, spontaneous movie night, gaming, etc etc etc :)UPDATE: the best way to stream video to this is by having a network drive (or USB drive connected to router).  For a portable option, the SanDisk Connect devices (inexpensive USB drives with WiFi & battery built-in) work easily with the Nebula

Title: Nice Product
Comment: I like it, and that's for sure, but the inability to stream directly to it, difficulty getting Prime and Hulu set up and the battery life leave it with some left to be desired...

Title: Item worked fine out of the box
Comment: Item has some pros and cons, first for the pros, I like the size and compact size that you can bring anywhere with ease. The item has a good battery life, watch 4 episodes of the flash before the battery drop to 15% which is still very good. The brightness is ok, not the best but if you are watching with a lamp or you have any light source turned on, the picture gets washout. For the con, so far if your watching a dark scene movie or show, it's very hard to see the characters/actors .

Title: Great performance from a little projector
Comment: Was looking for a good option to use for quarantine family movie nights and this little projector has been great for the most part.  While the picture is not true HD or 4K, it’s very clear, even when it’s projected at 75 - 80” on a smooth surface (once it’s good and dark outside). We have used both a Blu-ray player and an Apple TV via the HDMI connection and both look very good. The built in apps (Netflix and Prime, for example) work well generally, but we’ve occasionally had some lag and buffering. Although I don’t use the remote or the Nebula iOS app too often, I think they could both be improved. The remote could really use a backlight for the buttons - tough to navigate in the dark. We typically set the Nebula up on top of a tripod and show it on a portable screen. The volume and sound quality from the Nebula’s speaker are more than sufficient. Overall, it’s a great option.

Title: Awesome Projector when it worked properly
Comment: Update - Feb 18 2019Bumping up the rating to 4/4.5 based on the very helpful and proactive Customer Support team they have. I was very happy to hear from them based on my earlier feedback. They offered to provide a replacement, which was not feasible as I have moved out of US. But was pleasantly surprised by the level of customer service and support by Anker.Will definitely recommend Anker products for quality and customer support.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The projector is pretty awesome, works well for a portable device and has been an excellent addition to home and part entertainment. Picture and sound quality is pretty good for a Pico Projector. Very easy to set up. Have enjoyed plenty of games and movies on it till very recently when I started facing battery issues.I would have given it 4+ stars except that the device would not charge at all. The in-built battery does charge and needs to be connected to a power source for it to work. Tried using with a power bank, but it shuts down after 2 minutes.Pretty frustrating that its lost its portability and requires a power source for it to work.

Title: GA release doesn’t support YouTube TV
Comment: Okay for what it is. A pocket-sized projector. But don’t expect miracles. The corner of the image blurs, you have to use the remote to control it, and while some apps are available in the store, they don’t all work. Like YouTube TV. If you just need something to show kids shows for travel, this might be a good option.Edit: Since submitting this, Anker support reached out to me and provided me access to a beta test of GSM and a public APK if YouTube TV that worked. The beta isn’t quite projector-friendly yet, but it’s functional. Support has been very responsive and helpful. Definitely turned my experience around.

Title: Packs quite a punch for such a tiny device
Comment: Great, portable projector, built-in wireless connection to stream Netflix, amazon, etc. Excellent picture quality, indistinguishable from my much larger standard digital projector, which is amazing for a device the size of a soda can. Sound quality is good but not great, but can be augmented by a Bluetooth-enabled sound system (I have not yet tried this). Screen mirroring enables viewing content from other devices, but please note that streaming services like Netflix or Amazon Prime will not work with screen mirroring, even when using an HDMI cable. downloaded movies or CD’s, however, can be viewed either by screen mirroring or directly using the HDMI connector. Overall, a great buy!

Title: Awesome little toy!
Comment: Great little gadget to have. I was really surprised how well this little unit does. The portability is fantastic, picture is really decent, sound is great for what it is. My only suggestion for manufacturers is this.  You take so much pride in the speaker and sound of this little unit as you should, however you have hobbled the capabilities by not having the capability of an audio out option for your customers. It's great that it has it's own sound and that is a selling point, but what if I want to run it through a sound bar or more capable sound machine when I'm not out and about. You are so proud of the sound that this puts out that you felt that you had to force it on consumers instead of giving more options and functionality. For that, it only gets 4 stars, otherwise I feel it is a gem for the money.

Title: Great for a budget projector
Comment: First and foremost, I like this product a lot for what it is: a portable budget projector that happens to run Android. But it’s not without its flaws, mainly being that the remote doesn’t work (despite following all the instructions in the manual and on their support forum) and to unlock its full potential you need to join their beta program for google services.Those two items aside, the projector is quite bright for its size and does well in a moderately dark room. The sound from the onboard speaker is what you would expect from a mobile device, so if you want better quality, you should pair it with speakers.Does this replace a full sized projector? No. But it’s great to have if you’re projecting against a wall in your home for like a movie night or some streaming.

Title: Great portable speaker with all the bells and whistles.
Comment: This is a great little projector to take into many situations.  We got this mainly to replace a micro projector we were using in the kid's treehouse to watch movies.  We also use it as an additional to in the house if we need one, and we take it to share videos as part of the Sunday School class we teach.  The larger you project, the darker the room needs to be, but I think anything under about 50 inches does pretty well in a half-lit room.It's well built and the embedded Android system makes it extremely useable, but I highly recommend contacting Anker and getting the beta firmware with Google Store.  Otherwise the apps will be limited.  I couldn't sign into Vudu or Movies Anywhere until I upgraded to the beta firmware.
