Now, every platform works great, and I am able to download several movies to the projector so I can watch them offline.This would be great for camping, small business meetings and everything in between.The focus wheel isn't as precise as I would like it to be, but because you can move the projector, you still get the sharpest picture possible.I really like the speaker, it's plenty loud for a good sized room.  And I also like it's completely self contained quality.  It comes with a pouch, but I bought an inexpensive case that has a slot for the charger and remote.  It's still small and compact.

Title: Great budget projector for watching tv and movies
Comment: Works great for apps like Netflix and Hulu, app is very clumsy to use with YouTube, doesn’t work with Peacock and other smaller services yet The picture is great, so is sound quality. We made a “base” by cutting a slot in a toothpaste box to stabilize it when lying on its side so we can project the image on the ceiling.

Title: Nice for the price
Comment: If you're looking for tv or movie quality image I'm not sure this your device.  The image is definitely better in a dark or in low light room.  Even so on a white wall with an overhead light on the picture isn't that bad.  I like it because it's portable.  I can use it in the bedroom or my craft room or my office.  Sound is way better than I expected.

Title: Not a bad projector hopefully they fix the issues
Comment: The controls are a bit janky and hard to get use to. It can cast and I’ve gotten it to work for YouTube. But apps are pretty limited. I still like it for a mobile movie and tv system. And plugging my phone in is pretty simple or a laptop. But why they block casting Netflix and other apps is beyond me. If I can cast to my tv I should be able to legally cast to this or mirror.

Title: Great image in small package
Comment: The picture quality and brightness are great for such a small projector. The software is minimal so I have chosen to use an HDMI connection and it works as expected. We had trouble with the remote that was sent with the capsule, but customer service immediately shipped us a new remote and it worked perfectly.

Title: Imperfect but awesome
Comment: I love this little device! It's not perfect, but I think Nebula made the right set of tradeoffs to enable a self-contained, easily portable, and enjoyable entertainment experience.The picture is sharper and brighter than I was expecting, but my standards may be more relaxed than those of others. Is it as bright and sharp as a modern HDTV? Of course not. Will it hurt your eyes or detract from the content you are viewing? Not at all in my experience.The sound is solid - loud and good enough in quality. I'm not bowled over by it, but - again - it serves its purpose nicely.The software is okay out of the box, and made much better if you qualify to beta test a version with Google Play Services (which allows you to install apps from the Google Play Store and sign in with your Google account to, e.g., YouTube). If you buy this, I highly recommend contacting Nebula Support and asking to be a beta tester.The remote is nice but more or less useless, since apps like Netflix require the Capsule Control app, and because you have to be behind the projector for the remote to work. Thankfully, the Capsule Control app works great, and I'm thinking about repurposing an old Android phone as a dedicated remote. Navigation can be somewhat fiddly in mouse mode, but nothing unusable.It would be nice if Anker added a retractable lens cover. They do provide a bag, but it would be nice to just throw the device in an overnight bag as-is; I wouldn't do this without a lens cover though.I haven't run it down to zero, but battery life seems roughly in line with expectations. 1-2 hours of viewing has run it down to somewhere in the 60-70% range.I have not tested it with HDMI or USB content yet, only with the built-in software.Overall, I think Nebula succeeded in what they were trying to do here. There are some rough edges (software, lens cover), but none of them make me question the purchase. It does not replace a home theater setup, but, if you are buying this with the right use case in mind (portable, self-contained entertainment), you will not be disappointed!

Title: Good for the price. Great support.
Comment: *Disclosure*Anker asked me to write a review after an exchange with customer support.*Disclosure*I bought the Nebula Capsule as a gift for my dad. He occasionally gives presentations in different offices and community centers and this looked like an easy way to have a consistent and reliable way to put up visual aids. The projector is surprisingly small and well built. It can be a little hard to find the best focus at first with the necessarily tiny dial, but it's pretty easy once you're used to it. The resolution is pretty good for a pico projector at this price and colors are good too. The one knock on image quality is how easily overpowered the image can be under certain lights and on certain backgrounds, but when you're working with such a small form factor it's expected.As for software, I was disappointed to see that there wasn't out of the box support for the Google Play store. The included app store has a poor selection of business and utility apps so if you're hoping to project Google Slides or PowerPoints without using the full size HDMI port, be prepared to do some creative problem solving for now. I contacted Anker support about this and they did state it's a work in progress and offered the $30 carrying case as a way to make up for it not meeting that specific need and they were very kind about it. They even answered outside of the operating hours their auto-reply mentioned and didn't make things difficult. If it wasn't for their great support I would have given the Capsule 3/5 but with the promise of continued updates and very helpful support, I'm hoping it'll soon deserve a 5.

Title: Compact & Simple to Operate
Comment: I bought one of these for work as I give a lot of presentations and courses in a variety of locations, and I just bought 3 more for everyone else in my office.  I love that it's as small as a soda can and super lightweight.  The picture and audio are surprisingly good for a relatively inexpensive projector.  I love that it's wireless and rechargeable - I used to have to carry an extension cord and other connections for the laptop.I would give this thing 5 stars except for a couple of things.  First, short battery life - I get about 2 hours maximum per charge, which doesn't impact me much as most of my presentations are shorter than that.  Second, stability - due to it's size, it has a small footprint and can be easily knocked over and it doesn't do well on anything but totally horizontal surfaces.Bottom line is that this thing is a good value for the money.

Title: Very close to 5 stars
Comment: Anker did a very good job for this projector but there are few things missing, otherwise it would be 5 stars for me.Pro:1. Sound is loud enough comparing to the other one i have.2. Auto keystone works very well. (I am projecting it to the ceiling with a 45 degree)3. UI is very good that has amazon prime video, youtube, etc... (you can download other apps)4. UI is fast and responsive.5. Phone as remote is a very good touch.Cons:1. Not bright enough comparing to my other portable projector, i have to turn off all the light to get a good picture.2. Did not come with a tripod like other ones, ANKER tripod is overpriced.3. Remote should have used AAA battery instead.4. When projecting to the ceiling, due to the brightness, the bottom will be blurry.5. Resolution could be higher.Overall very happy with this portable projector.

Title: Don't buy Used - Like New - Item will come in original packaging. Packaging will be damaged.
Comment: The projector had a little dent, the input was broken and had to be changed before I charged it for the first time. It even had the name of a person registered as a user. It totally feels used and not like new.I didn't return it as it was shipped over to South America and it would have been too expensive for me.The projector works as expected but I was hoping to be able to use it in a non totally dark room.I thought the evaluation "like new" meant that it really was an item that looked like new but now I know that it is not the case at Amazon.

Title: Great Device With a Slight Flaw in Software
Comment: I've had this handy device for a couple weeks and overall I've happy with it but I do have a few gripes.  The first problem is the lack of Google Play apps which is a substantial issue as a majority of the apps I want to use on it aren't available in their incredibly limited selection. I can plug a secondary device into the HDMI port to run what I want but that defeats the purpose of the mobility of the Capsule.  The other issue is with their remote app because it constantly disconnects mid use and I have to wait for the device to reconnect then hope it doesn't disconnect again before I do what I'm trying to do.Otherwise the Capsule definitely comes as advertised.  It's got a great picture for what it is and the speaker quality is much better than I expected it to be.  I currently have it set up in my basement with an 80" screen and that has been working great.  I have also tested it outside at night for movie nights this summer and it works for that as well.TL;DR:  This is a great portable projector and I would highly recommend it to anyone with the understanding that it's not HD, it has an incredibly limited app selection & the companion app has connectivity issues

Title: Looks good for what it is, but the resolution is pretty bad.
Comment: Bought this to add more color to my DJ streams, does the job well.Room has to be super dark and 480p at that picture size isn't super enjoyable.Other than that, works well enough. Haven't tried it on battery. Packaging is nice and the tripod mount is amazing.Wish the Nebula 2 was cheaper.

Title: Value for money
Comment: I purchased during Black Friday with deal. It is solid portable device. Good to watch in low lighting as it’s only 100 ANSI. Android tv 7.1 has limited app. I use YouTub mostly so it’s fine. I’ve installed Samsung browser to see video on the webpage. Has limited input source only hdmi. It would be nice if they added micro sd slot. Still trying to figure out how to watch video from usb

Title: Fantastic self contained portable projector
Comment: Revised review 4/4/19My recommendation:  If you are looking for an anywhere, everywhere projection device, Nebula is great. Good design and build quality. Netflix and Amazon Video are built-in. If that is all you do then Nebula is a neat package. Definitely download the controller app as the remote is cumbersome to use and to must have a clear line of sight with the receiver in the back.

Title: Satisfied:)
Comment: I’m satisfied!! This can-size projector+speaker is exactly what I wanted. It works perfectly with my Apple products (for both mirror screening and HDMI) and I installed plenty apps on it for music and video streaming. (You can download APK apps first on your hard drive and plug it in to the projector to install them.) The picture quality, though not perfect, is good enough for movie nights with family and friends (picture quality is way better in darker rooms or at night.) The speaker is awesome and professional, and could even compare to my B&O speaker. The battery lasts about 3.5 hours on a full charge, the cord is too short so I cannot charge and watch at the same time. Overall, I’d give it 4 stars.

Title: Great little projector!
Comment: Got this for my bedroom because I didn’t want to get a tv. Picture overall is good. The speaker is adequate but don’t expect a home theater sound. You can pair it with Bluetooth speakers but there is a little latency that happens between the screen and the sound.Overall this little projector does the job for me. I would recommend it.

Title: I miss the lens cap/switch on its big brother
Comment: Great little unit.  Super portable.  Surprisingly good sound.  Decent Battery life.  I had the larger version up until recently, and that was a really handy unit also.  I dropped one star because this little projector doesn't have the "Lens Cap Switch" the larger one has.  There is nothing to protect the lens from smudges.

Title: User friendly except YouTube sign.
Comment: This project is amazing last night we watched a double feature off one charge including YouTube music before dark. How ever the YouTube app did not allow me to sign in even after reloading the app. Not being able to sign in was disappointing because I pay for no commercial. The commercial free YouTube would allow me to mingle with my family and friends before the movie starts. I really wanted to give this product a 5 star let's hope it's user error if so I'll update my review.

Title: Nebula Casule: A fun, solid portable projector
Comment: So far so good. The form factor is very good, construction is solid, and packaging is very well thought out, with most of the things you need to get started right away.I checked for software updates out of the box and it needed an updating, which happened smoothly and easily.Some concerns:The  app remote works better than the physical remote, although I haven’t tried to pair it over cell service yet.The onboard app versions of Netflix and Amazon video need the remote control app to be in controller mode to scroll, and mouse mode to select. That’s just inefficient.Mirroring of your iPhone will allow access to photos, music, etc — but the Bluetooth connection makes playing videos from your phone library frustrating. There’s quite a bit of lag which leads to jumpy streaming.I’ve read in other reviews that this Bluetooth lag issue throws video and audio out of sync when using a Bluetooth speaker for sound reinforcement. I haven’t tested that yet. The sound from the Capule itself is fine for a small- or medium-sized rooms, although the bass is lacking. Eventually I’ll want to improve the experience with a Bluetooth speaker, which may lead to the same problems other reviewers had. For now, it’s ok on its own.The image is not as bright as you might get from other units. In general, though, for its size, features, build quality and battery life, it seems like a good option for throwing into a bag for traveling.At this price, it may be steep for some users. I suggest doing a little checking on the Internet to see whether there are any promotional coupon codes that can be applied to bring down the cost of the unit. I’ve seen several this year that drop the cost by $50 to $70, which takes the sting out of the purchase a little.

Title: A good buy!
Comment: My favorite thing about this projector is how small and compact it is, so it’s really easy to lug around and bring to places. The projector does it’s job quite well. The projection is pretty HD and I have no complaints. Sound is pretty good as well. Setting it up was easy too. It has Netflix and other streaming apps built into it as well if you don’t have an HDMI cord to plug into another device. A few cons however is its short battery life and the fan is kind of loud but it’s not too bad to the point where it’s overpowering.

Title: This thing is pretty awesome
Comment: Great product at a great bargain. It had a couple small glitches that keep it from5 starts but has very good picture and sound quality. I can watch my TV shows anywhere now. There are a couple instances the auto picture keystone feature is not perfect when used on none vertical surfaces and the remote control doesn't seem to work all the time and you need to position it to work.  Overall though no regrets in buying this projector. It was even pretty great for setting up for music videos to run during parties while doing a good job with sound quality.

Title: High quality. Meh Value
Comment: All around a super nice product. Size of a can and projects well in a pony dark room and white wall. But the value is just not as good as I hoped. I feel it’s a bit overpriced so maybe a sale would be a good time to get it. I still use it often but just could be brighter so the room wouldn’t have to be black to work.

Title: Amazing purchase
Comment: I bought this for myself on Prime Day and honestly, overall, I love this thing. The pros absolutely outweigh the cons, all the way around. I use it to stream YouTube, Netflix, Hulu and Twitch about 99% of the time as a TV in my bedroom. I’ll either hang the screen I purchased from the hooks on the back of my closet doors opposite my bed, or I’ll lay in bed with it laying next to me and watch it on the ceiling - both of which are amazing.  My ONLY complaint at ALL about this item is the clarity during darker scenes of a show. The brightness is decent when it’s a dark environment, but even in a dark environment, if you’re watching a show with a low light scene, it’s sometimes a bit too dark for my tastes and hard to see parts of the scene. But again, overall, this is an amazing purchase and highly recommended.

Title: Cool gadget, no brightness adjustment
Comment: Really awesome little product that is very innovative. No brightness adjustment however made it to where it was too bright to be used in close proximity to yourself to wind down the end of the day before bed eg. Projecting on bedroom ceiling or wall of a tent. You would think such a simple feature would be included

Title: Es una gran opción para el hogar
Comment: La calidad de la imagen es muy buena para lo que lo utilizo, ver películas y videos. Lo puse en una habitación obscura y trabaja perfecto. Me hace falta el que tenga una base para poderlo colgar del techo, la opción de tripode es buena, pero para tenerlo permanentemente talvez valga la pena un mejor soporte. Trabaja muy bien con el celular como control remoto, sin esto, sería un problema ya que el control con el que viene no ofrece muchas facilidades.Para mi es perfecto para el uso en mi sala de entrenimiento.

Title: Impressed
Comment: Only had for a week, but really impressed. As other reviewers have said, the remote and app controls are a bit frustrating, but they do work. I have been getting 3.5 + hrs of battery life, especially if viewing while offline. I was able to download a total of 9 standard length movies and 3 30 minute episodes between Prime and Netflix. Looks great and super portable.

Title: Great for home!
Comment: So close to a 5 star.  I use it for work to do presentations and also for movie night at home.  Only problem is the resolution is OK.  If you need to do presentations this should not be what you use because it gets grainy  when trying to show details on the screen.  Overall it is still pretty cool and perfect for traveling.

Title: all around solid performer!
Comment: Although this is the basic model, with limited apps that are compatible (peacock is not for example...) for the services it offers and using the android app as a controller I am very happy with this whole set up. Sound is good enough standalone and the picture is great. Enjoyed watching several episodes and movies so far. Battery life is somewhat exaggerated as usual for all products (I'd love to see one realistic assessment of battery life somewhere!!)

Title: Love it and the customer service i got was great!!
Comment: So i got this for my bday 12.11 and i forgot to write my review... I live my nebula projector! Only thing is aggy is the screen adjuster on the side but hey. I love the soda can size. I carry it just about everywhere so many ppl gave seen me with it i tell them the name and price *anker should hire me cuz living in nyc i can go door to door with these i swearr* i did have trouble with it at first but i had the greatest customer service and my Google play is on it now. The customer service lady was the nicest omg i feel bad i didnt write this sooner cuz if it wasnt for her i wpuld have sent it back.

Title: Good but a little sus
Comment: Just opened for Christmas so a bit early to tell but the image looks great and the design is super sleek!Kind of spooky that when I tried to log into YouTube it was logged into someone else’s account as well with the Netflix app which even had their credit card information...not sure what that’s about but other wise the product seems great lol

Title: Great little projector!!
Comment: Excellent little projector. Really can't beat it for the money. Battery lasts through 2 full movies. Picture is great (not 4k but neither is the price). Bluetoothed to my block rocker rechargeable speaker flawlessly. User interface is nice and easy. Had a great time camping in the middle of nowhere watching movies with the kids.  Paired with the 120" non-wrinkle foldable screen. Awesome.

Title: Don’t let the battery run out
Comment: Overall, I’m happy with it.  It is easy to use and the picture/sound quality is great for what I’m looking for.  The only drawback I have found is that when we let the battery run out I can’t get it to recharge without resetting the projector and it isn’t always easy to do.  Since I bought it for use when camping I can’t keep it plugged into a power source every time.

Title: For what it is it's amazing but some improvements could be made
Comment: this unit is a great portable projector battery last a long time and can also be connected to a long USB for chat times when you are near a power source. Picture is pretty good but needs a little darkness in the room. Operating system is great but sometimes a little laggy. As a package this is definitely a great item just with some small improvements to be made.

Title: Pretty good product but can be better
Comment: This product is overall pretty solid. the only issue is 720p tense to be still challenging sometimes to watch as a bigger screen. The price should be more adjustable comparing to the quality. However, I am still giving 4 stars since I anticipated these issues and the fact that Ankers was trying something new.

Title: Great little projector
Comment: Great "smart" projector so far.  Great support team if yiu need help with a specific question.  Happy I purchased.Keep in mind that for the specs and price this is an awesome projector.  If u need more brightness go for it's bigger brother.  The tech put in this thing is awesome for the size and picture great for a dark room, /night time.  Having Netflix integrated is awesome too!

Title: Almost perfect
Comment: Love it but the battery goes out faster than I thought. The remote control u couldn't use it. Had to download the app and use with my phone. Other than that I LOVE IT.

Title: YouTube runs this device's music, deleats it, washes playlists, DO NOT GET UTUBE UPGRADES....
Comment: Neb locked up, YouTube deleated  all saved videos, shut down unit.... Not your fault.  Unit has operated fine and is a blast, WELL MADE..."EXCEPT", for the remote is hostel to the operator ALWAYS DISFUNTIONAL.

Title: Great portability
Comment: I have to say this projector is amazing, portability and  image quality.  However it is designed to work better with galaxy or Samsung products.  You could connect your Mac or iPhone to it but it posse a great deal of challenge.

Title: Happy, not blown away.
Comment: I’m liking this product. It’s great for outdoor movies and shows. Bought a $20 projector screen and backyard is now functional for fun even during covid/social distancing. 4 stars because the internal speaker isn’t that great and when you sync a Bluetooth device you get delays in audio from whatever you’re watching.

Title: Picture quality is very good
Comment: I got the projector and at first I was not happy with the quality. I then realized I did not adjust the focus after that it was great. It works well in the light as long as it is not super bright and at any distance you can re adjust the focus and it looks pretty nice. The speaker on it is also very good. I brought it camping and I watched 3 movies on it so I was very happy with it.

Title: Picture Great, Sound not so great
Comment: Picture is Great, but sound not as good as I expected. Connection was spotty, mirroring with Apple device only works if you have wifi unless you use HDMI cable which you have to buy extra. Want to know if I can connect other Bluetooth speaker at same time as projector or not - have not been able to find out how. I-pad does not pair with both at the same time.

Title: Update: (Almost) The Perfect Portable Projector.  Original Title: Received used item.
Comment: Update: So just to start I do have to say Anker's customer service really has been outstanding. They've kept in timely communication with me from the time of my original review to see how they could assist. They have more than apologized and informed me that they have taken steps that it doesn't occur again.In regards to the customer service I would give this a 5 but for the moment I will be giving the actual product 4 stars. To start I was nervous about the sub hd quality of the screen it was projecting but it honestly looks pretty good. I've primarily experimented projecting 50-60 inches and everything has looked good and subtitles are more than clear. The hardware overall is extremely nice and feels polished. Starts up fast and once up and running didn't experience slowdowns. I originally was worried the fan was loud because of a different review. With no sound and it sitting next to me I could absolutely hear it but it wasn't loud per say. With it set up on a tripod and it's speaker going during a movie though I could not hear the fan at all.Like others have mentioned software is lacking a bit still unfortunately. Netflix works how you'd expect and really didn't have any issues with it. Vudu is in the provided App Store and although I was able to sign in, I could not get it to scroll down to my library to view my movies. I had to already know what I was looking for and search for it to watch it from this app. Amazon Prime is available and worked pretty well, a bit hard to see sometimes where the "cursor" was but could log in and start up my movies with ease. Youtube works but is a bit barebones. Search works just fine and I didn't run into issues getting any particular video to play. It doesn't appear you can log into your profile so for those that have Youtube Red or utilize Youtube to access their google play library it doesn't appear possible at this present moment. Hulu for now looks to be absent. I did try to airplay it and interestingly enough it plays the ads but then once the movie/show starts the screen goes black and only the sound plays. They did warn in their description that copyrighted material can't be mirrored but I really wanted to get Hulu going. Speaking of mirroring it really doesn't work well. Though delayed it's by no means severely behind and though I wouldn't try to mirror an FPS game to it, something like Jackbox Party Pack would be feasible and fun.Original: I got mine today but at the moment I'm not thrilled. It came in a crushed box that looked like it already had been opened. When I powered it on it also already had predownloaded apps that had been logged into. I've generally had good experiences with Anker in the past but I'm surprised they would try to pass it off as new. I've already started the process to replace it with Amazon but I'm skeptical now.

Title: Thank you
Comment: Now I can enjoy watching with my kid. But the remote has some issue. I can’t put entire type through my phone. Trying to reach customer service. The live chat doesn’t work

Title: Great portable device
Comment: Love this product, it's super portable and doubles as a speaker. I loved it so much I bought the bigger and stronger Nebula 2. Love that one as well. The software can be lacking a bit, but their awesome support can help you.

Title: Amazing little projector!!
Comment: This is an amazing little portable projector that comes handy for kids sleepover parties, binge watching on a bigger screen in the backyard, etc., i wish it had a slot for USB or Micro SD card which would have made it much more useful. Image quality is not on par with the other high-end projectors but it serves the purpose.

Title: HAPPY WITH UPDATE
Comment: Update changing to 4 stars because Morpheus tv was added. Also my shield works great.Need to do an update so the (Best)apps (FreeFlix) can work. Amazon app is garbageUtube, can’t use my Red Acct. & no way will I pay for Netflix. Mobdro is ok when it isn’t freezing, but that’s mobdro anyway

Title: Love it over all
Comment: Love it but the fan is really loud. Returning to try the MAX. It’s still worth the price just figured I’d give the max a try to see if the fan is better.

Title: Super Easy Interface!
Comment: Very easy to setup and use! Perfect for backyard movie nights with our son. My only complaint is that it's not that loud unless it's an action packed Transformers type movie. Also it's not super bright but good enough for what we were looking for!

Title: Decent image, awkward remote
Comment: The picture is a bit dim, but I knew that would probably be the case. The remote is the bigger irritant. You must be directly behind the projector for it to work. If you are doing a presentation,  that means your back is probably to the audience.

Title: Nebula
Comment: This product is nice. I like how it’s portable and small like a soda can,but there was a couple things I didn’t like.There isn’t a way to turn up brightness movies that focuses on dark scenes  aren’t so great.Airplay or mirror is very laggy so if you connect your laptop or phone it won’t do so well.The remote isn’t sensitive enough which why they recommend downloads the app that converts your phone to a controllerOther then that it’s a great projector and it has all the apps included so no need for a fire stick or device

Title: Fun to use but fiddly.
Comment: The built in apps are akward, you can't even log into the YouTube app to get at your subscriptions, but there's a third party YouTube app in the store that works. I run it as an HDMI projector for a Chromecast most of the time, which you can run off the internal battery using the included otg cable but it won't go very long. I bounce it off the ceiling with a photo tripod. Resolution is low but you don't notice too much.

Title: Good quality mini projector
Comment: Easy to set up and use projector. Brightness leaves some to be desired but it is serviceable. Good enough to enjoy a movie outside at night with the family. Sound is good and you don’t need an external speaker.

Title: Love, but a couple of issues
Comment: So I love this little projector , but on day two have two issues...1. After about 20 minutes on Netflix it pauses, black screen-like it goes to sleep. I have to press power and it comes back on in the place where it left off just paused and 2. I wish the volume were louder. I was playing a Spotify playlist and had it almost all the way up for medium vol. that was disappointing. Going to check w support.

Title: Nice projector
Comment: I love this projector.  We use it inside and out.  It needs to be actually dark out to use outside.  Closing the blinds is sufficient for inside use.  It's also been really great for workout videos.  The speaker is great and the picture is clear.  The battery doesn't last very long but you can also plug it in while you watch.  My one complaint it that it is annoying to type and find what you want to watch.

Title: Wish it was brighter
Comment: It's a great product I just wish I would have got the upgrade instead

Title: Mediocre for price
Comment: Can’t get certain apps like spectrum. Have to hook up to external input. Can’t log in to your youtube account

Title: Only use hdmi
Comment: It’s okSome connectivity issues, App Store is trash. Bluetooth is hot garbage

Title: nice and cute one
Comment: nice and cute one. i love it but need to return because it doesn't play movies on USB. better to buy a cheap $84 but can run movies from USB

Title: Best one out there
Comment: Although the interface can use some work, I very much love the Nebula Capsule. I would love for it to be as fluid as an Apple TV or a Fire TV. It needs work, but I would buy this product again- and I do recommend it to people frequently.

Title: i might be dense - but this doesnt seem to ...
Comment: i might be dense - but this doesnt seem to allow projecting from HBO go and or iTunes... any DRM content from an external device is not permitted??

Title: Good for the size, not for the prize...VERY LIMITED
Comment: Picture quality isn’t great, very dim for dramas and dark tones. However the size is amazing. The App Store system is really bad, is missing most of the apps you want... HBO max doesn’t work, Disney plus acts very weirdly, Netflix quality gets worse for some reason, the only good working app is Amazon prime video.

Title: App problems.
Comment: I love the product.It works as advertised.The problem I have is with the Capsule Control app.I cannot get it to locate my device when I use the scan option.I am using an Android tablet but no luck.I also have Amazon Fire tablets but the app is not even available for them.Amazon is a featured seller for this product.Why is there no app for their tablets??? The flimsy remote that is included gives me worries.If it quits the unit cannot be controlled.I would give five stars except for the problem with the app.

Title: Good projector, bad remote manufacturing
Comment: I love the projector, but the remote was pretty flimsy.When i pulled out the plastic tab from the battery cover (as instructed), a piece off of the battery cover broke, so it no longer screws in. This isn't a huge deal since you can control it with your phone, but it was definitely a little scary when the first thing I touched broke. Hoping the projector holds up better than the remote.

Title: Well worth its value
Comment: Picture quality and brightness are great battery has actually lasted longer than stated. Sound quality has a little to be desired no very crisp, but for what I use it for ( camping) has worked out great!

Title: Great little gadget!
Comment: This little gadget is so much fun!!! I was really happy with the picture quality and the ease of use. Once I linked it to my WiFi and my cell phone I didn’t even have to keep putting in my password for the apps. It could be a little louder, but all in all it’s great. I even ordered a second as a gift.

Title: Great projector for a small price!
Comment: Great brightness and picture quality for such a small projector. Speaker is great too. The customer service is even better and very quick to reply to emails. Definitely worth the purchase.

Title: All in one package
Comment: I like this projector a lot, it’s clear and plenty bright at night filling an 80” pull down screen in the backyard sitting about 9 feet away.  App control is nice.  480p is good enough.  60 FPS would’ve been better, but it only appears to be only 30.What sets it apart is android TV.  I have NVIDIA Shields in every room using Kodi as my local media client, HDHomerun serving my cable tv signal all through a Synology NAS.  These apps all function the same in the projector.My gripes about this projector:It has dual band WiFi, but at 2.4GHz I get about 30Mbps down, while my iPhone right next to it gets about 130 down.  On 5GHz band, the projector is getting about 45Mbps down, while my phone next to it gets 300.The speaker isn’t that great, it’s pretty tinny sounding.  I just connect a JBL charge 3 to it through Bluetooth for better audio, but AV sync is a little lagged.Last complaint is more of my OCD, but I can’t get rid of the stupid TED app placeholder.  It’s the first one in line and it’ll never get used.Those are minor gripes I think, the WiFi issue hasn’t resulted in any video choppiness. I’ve used it at most about 3 hours straight so the battery life hasn’t been an issue.  I can attach a battery pack if needed.  I’m happy with my purchase.

Title: Easy to set up, but the Netflix experience could be improved
Comment: Comes with Netflix and a store app (not Google Play) that gives you easy access to other android TV apps. Netflix doesn't support the remote control, thus I will take a star off. To navigate in Netflix using the remote control you need to put it in mouse 🖱 mode, which is painful. Mouse mode from the phone using the Capsule Control app is better, but I think this mode should not be needed in the first place.

Title: Almost
Comment: Good picture, great portability and connectivity but sadly just wasn't bright enough as well as stopped working after just a few days. Customer service is great and worked to resolve the issue until I just returned through Amazon.

Title: Good projector for the price.
Comment: I've enjoyed using it.  Speaker is pretty good.  Works well with Netflix.  I wish the picture was brighter and a little more clear but its a projector and for the price I think it does a pretty good job.

Title: Very fun little projector
Comment: I use this projector all the time watching movies on the ceiling in the dorms at college. Its very easy to set up and works great with an hdmi. The remote and interface is a little cumbersome, but that is no different than any other smart tv or roku box.

Title: Neat
Comment: Its not as clear as a tv but the screen gets so huge i would rather use it. I only use it at night.

Title: Portability and Built In OS = PARTY TIME!!
Comment: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07D8NT2ZK/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o05_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Is the 3rd Party Travel Case I purchased.https://www.amazon.com/Nebula-Customized-Projector-Splash-Resistance-Protection/dp/B077JQ4WQV/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1537223401&sr=8-4&keywords=nebula+case  This is the official Anker Case.https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00XN1P9QI/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1 Tripod used with projectorThis is a review of my experiences with the Capsule and two cases for the Capsule. The Eisman and the Anker branded Official Capsule case, which I got when I purchased the Capsule via a limited promotion Anker was running. Long story short, I prefer the Eisman case vs the official Capsule case.  The Anker case is softer and does not protect as well.  The outer shell is more of a sturdy cardboard, and does flex if stressed. The Eisman case barley gives, it's sturdy. I can place the capsule in my backpack and not worry when using the Eisman case. Not only is this case is more sturdy, but it's a smaller form factor. I'd travel with the Eisman case over the official. With the Eisman case, you sacrifice some storage space for form factor though, as it's just a bit smaller. With the Eisman case, the compartment that actually holds the projector is too small for the projector. The compartment stretches and bows when the projector is inserted, but does hold it very snugly. See pics. The official case has a larger  dedicated space for the remote and projector.  There isn't any space for cables in either case. I bought a telescoping tripod (see above links) to use with the capsule and it's okay, make sure to get a wider tripod base, as the one it ships with is small, and the Capsule topples over easily when dialing in the viewing angle of the image. But hey, I can say the capsule is sturdy.  As a whole, it does take a lickin' and keep on tickin'! An iPhone X would have shattered into a million pieces long ago.I love this projector. I use it everywhere, but especially in my room/bed, projecting onto the wall or ceiling. The combination of the Android OS and HDMI input make it very functional. I connect a Chromecast to the HDMI input and I'm able to stream everything...sling, HBO now, etc. I wish there was a more fully fledged YouTube app, as you can't log into your account, so no playlists, subscriptions, etc. Installing Kodi is straightforward and works well. While Hulu warns you that the app isn't compatible, it works well on the Capsule in my experience. The focus on the Capsule isn't great. I'm exaggerating a little, but if you blow on the focus knob it'll fall out of focus. It's very sensitive and very difficult to actually get a sharp focus. I like the auto sleep feature...if I fall asleep watching Netflix, the projector doesn't stay on burning the bulb all-night, it turns itself off. I'm not sure when, but it turns itself off at some point.  The projector image is not bright during the day, its not amazing at night either, but not bad at all. Brighter when plugged into power.  Battery life is good.  You'll get through a 2 hour movie, and then a little bit.  I haven't needed to tax the battery so much, I just use Anker power bricks to keep the party going lol.  The audio from the built in speaker is meh...good enough. It's great for my 'Netflix in bed' purposes so far. At halfway, its plenty loud (for properly mastered material...movies, etc).  As far as the audio fidelity, don't expect full bandwidth, wall of sound type of output.  It's a tinny miniscule speaker built into a projector, so it sounds as such, but its very easy to connect a bluetooth speaker, if you'd like.  Overall, I'm happy with the purchase, and can't wait to use the projector in more places besides my home!

Title: Nice; still learning to use it
Comment: I like the soda-can size, the streaming features that it offers, and the really great sound! I did look forward to an audio-out plug, but that feature did not make it into the final product. Still learning my way around it. One issue I had was to not be able to read my USB thumb drive via a connected cable. Still trying to figure that one out.

Title: very nice product....
Comment: The picture quality & sound is good. It's handy and the only concern is web browsing is not easy...

Title: Cool in theory
Comment: Cool in theoryFan is incredibly loud in small spaces.

Title: Portable, easy to use
Comment: I wish you could link extra speakers for a surround sound effect, the speaker is not load enough for outside.

Title: Great gadget
Comment: Pretty cool gadget. Really small and runs well on battery.Image quality isn't the best though, but I guess it's expected for such a small projector. I really wish there would be a zoom/positioning option.There's not a lot of apps, Netflix and YouTube is there but no HBO go and the other premium channels apps.The remote doesn't work well, the app is better for control on Android. That being said my 3yo daughter really loves this thing!

Title: Awesome picture and sound quality
Comment: The projector itself is great and both the picture and the sound are awesome. We did have an issue with our power cord that came with the Nebula but we use a cell phone charger and it works with that charger

Title: Blurry picture
Comment: This item is good on picture quality and battery life. But for some reason, if you are watching a movie with dancing, the images will start to blur.

Title: Satisfied purchase
Comment: So glad I made this purchase. Well worth the money. I have to invest in a tripod so that islt can sit anywhere. I reccomend.

Title: Audio has me frustrated
Comment: I’m having an issue connecting it to my Apple TV. I bought a very good hdmi cable and I ran it from my Apple TV to the projector. The visual came out great but the audio sounds like and old school projector that just ran out of film (if that makes any sense). Any suggestions would be great. I messed around with the settings and it’s the same thing.

Title: Small package but still good
Comment: Not a great projector or speaker, but to fit all the features into something the size of a sofa can is great! The next version is double the brightness which would make it 5* but for 2x the price I’m not sure I would go that route? Ultra portable though and respectable picture and sound.

Title: Really i love the product
Comment: This projector is great, mini and portable, great ease of use, color and brightness. We have used it indoors and outdoors with no issues, my kids love the ability to play movies/shows anywhere we want. I definitely recommend this to everyone.

Title: So-so battery
Comment: Remote only works form certain angles.4 hour battery life may be true while using blue tooth speaker mod ever it’s certainly never lasted for 4 hours while playing videos.

Title: Good not great
Comment: I use this as a quick tv on the fly in my bedroom. It works well, as long as it's dark. I wish it had a centering image on load so I could ensure I have a proper alignment. I spend more time adjusting it than anything else.

Title: Cant log in to my Account on YouTube
Comment: Everything is ok except for YouTube... I can't get to log in to my account to get ad free YouTube

Title: Great portable projector with main weaknesses being the remote controls
Comment: Great little portable projector. Bought it for use with my Nintendo Switch setup. Runs android 7.1 but lacks google play store but Anker says its coming. Projection quality is great for its size although not bright enough for using indoors during a sunny day without curtains or outside except after dark. My Switch looks great projecting at about 100" on my wall. The sound from its speaker is the best out of the mini pico projector class although in bluetooth mode it doesn't get very loud.Comes with remote that is good but has the weakness of having the IR sensor in the back of the projector instead of the front. Would have been better if it was an RF based remote instead of IR. The smart phone control app is good when it works. It constantly disconnects from the projector about every 45 seconds and takes it about 20 seconds to reconnect. This repeats indefinitely.

Title: Excellent customer service
Comment: Pleased with this product.  Very easy to use.  Also pleased with customer service.  Lost our remote control a few weeks after we purchased projector.  Customer support was efficient and friendly, and we were able to easily purchase a new remote, which arrived in a few days.  Would not hesitate to contact them again.

Title: Great small projector!
Comment: Works quite well. Decent battery life and picture quality.Update:Although the warranty period for this product has expired, Anker was kind enough to send a replacement remote for this product! Excellent customer service!

Title: Happy but not
Comment: Really good product. Android-based so it has a lot of UX issues. Very few apps available for downloads.

Title: Great unit, could be brighter but still good overall especially for the price
Comment: Love everything about it. Only criticism is that it could be brighter. Speaker works great and sounds awesome. Internal storage is a big plus.

Title: its good but could be better
Comment: I like that its nice and portable only thing I'm not like about it is you can't have a usb device plugged into and while charging it

Title: 4 out of 5
Comment: I’m loving it so far. However it was a pain to setup today. Customer service was awesome with the help though. I’m still not completely setup the Andropov Tv setup not working

Title: Seriously impressive
Comment: Don’t be fooled by how it is only 720p you really can’t tell. It’s oerfect for sitting on your headboard and protecting onto the wall in front of your bed. Sounds good too.The only problem is the software. It’s clunky at best. Hopefully this can be fixed through a patch. Other than that it really is an amazing device! Would love to see roku or amazon tv built in

Title: Great projector
Comment: I really like this projector.  Really easy to use.  Only complaint is it needs to be pretty dark to see it but that is with most projectors.  The picture on it is amazing.  I would highly recommend

Title: Pretty, pretty good
Comment: I like this more than I expected to; it's the projector I've been waiting for. Video quality is great and 400 lumens seems sufficient with the blinds closed during daylight. It's super in a dark room. My only complaint is that Bluetooth is the only option for audio out. Bluetooth lag, especially experienced when using the HDMI line in or a media player app for local files, and intermittent with other apps, leaves me wishing for a phono connection for wired output. Maybe in the next version...

Title: 不太明亮
Comment: It's not too bright, but it's okay.

Title: Multi-vitamin capsule
Comment: I usually don’t write reviews on Amazon but I had to in this case. This capsule is indeed one multivitamin capsule. It packs a punch with some excellent hardware and Android combo. The remote sensitivity can be improved though

Title: Needs easier control
Comment: This would be a 5 star item if it was easier to control from both the projector and the remote.

Title: Impressive for size and price
Comment: Packs a lot of punch for a small guy and nice price. Better suited for dark indoor rooms vs. outdoor movie nights.

Title: Good product
Comment: This little thing packs a punch, wish it had higher brightness and 1080 quality besides that it’s great

Title: Investment
Comment: Great product only down side is the App Store isn’t the greatest but I have the apps I use most on here just wish I had more options but it’s the programmers fault not the product.

Title: Satisfaction delivered
Comment: So far I am not disappointed with my purchase. This projector has been everything I expected and more. Easy to set up, speakers are loud, colors are vibrant, and on top of all this it has it's own operating system!!!! I love my new gadget

Title: Can not do airplay mirroring if you use a wifi with multiple channels
Comment: I like this product. This is easy to move. You can take it when you are traveling. Pictures are good. YouTube works well. I live in a dorm. So I can not use the airplay mirroring when I use wifi from my school. If you have any problems. The have live chat in their app. So you can chat with Ashley in Nebula chat to figure those out.

Title: very portable...
Comment: After contact costumer service.. they help me to fix some issues.. great image and nice sound.. my daughter love it....

Title: Great little projector.
Comment: I like this item. The battery life is good. I recommend an Bluetooth speaker if you are using this outside.

Title: Great for outdoor casual viewing on a wall or screen.
Comment: A bit challenging to set up well but works great once you've got it right.  Fairly dim, needs a dark environment.

Title: Easy to use
Comment: Good quality!!

Title: Overall I really like it.
Comment: Remote I don’t really like,, maybe if it functioned similar to the app control. If only it can last longer than 4 hours it would be great.

Title: Average quality
Comment: Great build quality, but this isn't for people who need a perfect projector feel. Better to go with higher models I believe, but again, for it's size it does the best. If you are looking for average projector as small in size as possible then go for it.

Title: Most: quality of picture, opportunity to view on ...
Comment: Most:  quality of picture, opportunity to view on big “screen,”Least:  some confusion about set up.

Title: If this were HD it would be perfect, that's why one star is missing
Comment: If this were HD it would be perfect, that's why one star is missing. The rest is close to perfection.

Title: Protibale and Cheap
Comment: I liked it. Only problem was the sound quality. everything else was outstanding.

Title: Worth the money
Comment: Picture quality is good, brightness weak need to be in the dark , forget about watching something During the day in the living room .Sound is good , the remote has limitations , better to use the app remote .

Title: Battery is slow charging and fast to die
Comment: Battery doesn’t last long or charge fast

Title: Not the easiest to use, but effective.
Comment: The power button on the remote wouldn't power the device on. The app is clunky and difficult to navigate, but the picture is clear and works for the intended purpose.

Title: None of the apps work. Youtube, Netflix, ...
Comment: EDIT: None of the apps worked originally. Youtube, Netflix, AppStore said that the device was not connected to internet, I was very frustrated. But that turned out to be a temporary problem with Anker server. All apps work fine now. Anker guys sent me a nebula case, apologizing for the problem on their side. I feel that it is a great buy for $250 (lightning sale price). Just note that casting from Android phones doesn't work. If you really need casting, you will have to connect a chromecast to it using HDMI.

Title: Nice item
Comment: Love portability

Title: Received
Comment: Product is great but the remote you have to point it towards the device.

Title: Functionality with ease of use
Comment: This product combines convenience with excellence. You definitely need a darker room to reap the benefits of the product, but the sound quality is excellent, and the ease of use is refreshing. Also, my remote did not work, but after a couple moments on the phone with a representative named Christian, I have another coming in the mail. Well done!

Title: Hardware’s good software needs work
Comment: The quality of video is superb, but downloading updates is a pain, and I haven’t been able to connect the device to my google play account.

Title: Easy to use and great picture
Comment: We have use a few times since getting a week ago and it was easy to set up. The picture has been great quality. We love the portability. The only thing I wish would be different is if you could move the picture up or down. We had to use multiple crates or boxes even when op top of a table to get the picture high enough to see where we wanting to point it. Overall we LOVE IT!

Title: So close. Needs 1080p and then I'll definitely be back!
Comment: UPDATE: the people at Anker clearly take customer satisfaction seriously. I've had plenty of follow up emails trying to 'make it right', not that anything was really ever wrong. This product just didn't fit my very specific needs. In a sea of shady vendors out there, Anker is definitely a company I am happy to buy products from again. Thanks.This product has just about everything you would need...they've really thought it through and it's a solid really product. 100 lumens isn't really bright enough BUT the real downside is the picture quality. They have to get this up to 1080p; it was near impossible to use for gaming in the basement, just couldn't make out some of the key details when needed.

Title: Great product
Comment: This a great projector for outings like the beach or camping. It's light weight and very easy to set up. For the price very worth it.👍🏼

Title: A great product
Comment: Love my Nebula, Small and powerful. The support team is also always there to help.

Title: A very good projector

Title: Small but mighty
Comment: Can be in close

Title: Buen Producto
Comment: Super portátil y buena calidad de imagen. Capacidad de emparejar con parlantes via Bluetooth es excelente.

Title: Fun product

Title: Surprised how good for size and price.

Title: Excelent for Netflix
Comment: Excelent projector works great with Netflis  but hard to communicate with apple smart phones.Very difficult to project pictures ore files from your apple divises.

Title: Great buy

Title: Impressed
Comment: Once we figured it could be used like Apple TV it was a breeze. Using it for projecting iphone & MacBook screens for brainstorming sessions & work presentations at home

Title: Unique
Comment: What a neat item.  About the size of a soda can.

Title: Works well
Comment: Not bad for the money

Title: Perfect for tv replacement in bedroom

Title: For the price it's well worth it

Title: Good quality

Title: So far so good
Comment: So far excellent experiencePicture quality could be better as some lines appear in some backgrounds

Title: Lackluster battery after 3 years.
Comment: Great projector. After 3 years however the battery gives out after only 30 mins of use, so its in no way feasible to watch any movies anymore.Is it possible to get a replacement battery at all? Would love to hear from support.

Title: Great Projector/Need Better UI and App Support
Comment: Out of the box it is amazing little projector.  For the price the image quality and sound were great.  Much better than I expected for the price.  I am looking forward to warm weather to get outside and start watching movies in the backyard or next to the pool.  I love the fact that it is all in one projector that does not require me to have a cell phone connected, a separate power or extension cord or a Bluetooth speaker.  It is all in one unit.  All I need is the projector, included remote and a white wall.I would have given in 5 stars if the user interface and app selection were better.  I find the User Interface to be clunky and not intuitive.  This is manageable once you get used to it.  There is not a lot of customization options such as how the apps are ordered and displayed on the Home Screen.The biggest fault is that it is running a stripped down version of Android Nougat.  The Android software is not running "Google Play Services".  The lack of Google Play Services does not allow you to run certain apps like NBC, NBC Sports and FoxNow.  Ultimately, with access to Amazon Video and Netflix I can cover 95% of my TV/Movie watching needs but it would be nice to have access to the other services.  I am not sure what "Google Play Services" does so I do have some concerns about future inoperability  if Netflix or Amazon Video require the use of"Google Play Services" to run those apps.Also there was a lack of available Music Apps such as Amazon Music and Pandora.  You can use the projector as a Bluetooth speaker and stream these services from your phone but not a lot of option if you want to play music directly through the projector.  I did find that Spotify was an available app.I am going to try using an old Roku Stick connected to the HDMI port to get better access to the TV/Movie/Music Services.  As I said above if this projector has a better User Interface and App selection (like Roku) it would be absolutely amazing.

Title: This device is amazing
Comment: We live in the future. The end... Actually no. I have updated the review at the bottom.This device is amazing, and is exactly what I was looking for! I've been on a hunt for this for years and it didn't yet exist. I had a Sony pico projector in the past but the software was so limiting, connections were limited, this one supports just about any kind of connection you'd like to make.Both on the same wifi network? Got it.Stand Alone connection to wifi, with no PC or secondary device to provide the content? Yes!Screen mirroring for iOS? Yes! And Mac!Screen mirroring for Android and Miracast? Yes!I as able to set the device up and start using it within just a couple minutes of unboxing. Everything is intuitive. My intent for this device is as an ultra portable projector for work, and it will do that perfectly. I was shocked at how far away I could be from the wall and how large the screen could be and everything was still okay. In the dark you can project to almost an entire wall at a quality that most family movie night goers would be pleased with.The stand alone app for your smart phone helps immensely for setting up applications and entering logins & passwords.The built in speaker is surprisingly clear and loud. This thing is literally the size of a can of soda pop. Unreal.The fan is very quiet and doesn't seem to surge up/down as some projectors can, at least so far during my use.I can only imagine that things can get  better from here-- more apps in the app store (It has a built in app store specifically for it's use! Netflix, Amazon video worked well for me. I couldn't get Hulu to work... yet)The menus are very easy to navigate, it has a file explorer which means theoretically if you have regular videos or content that you wanted to play without an internet connection you could do so. I could imagine great uses for mobile road warriors, sales teams, etc.I have spent so many months trying to find a device like this and it just didn't exist.  There were a couple attempts from other companies but the reviews just didn't cut it. The Sony I had was expensive and far more limited than this.We live in the future, and I'm very happy that we do. I love this device! I'll continue to try it with additional computer mirroring and use the physical HDMI connection and update the review if there are any surprises.[UPDATE]While I can't take back the excitement and love above, I realized that the consumer strength being what it is on the entertainment side, I had a couple gaps on the business side that made the value proposition difficult for me over time. I ended up returning the unit.I couldn't' figure out a way to cast from Chromebook, which is an important thing for the future where I work. Second, I had some resolution challenges for Windows 10 screen mirroring even from older laptops. It would make everything so "big" that I couldn't display enough on the projection to be as productive as I hoped to be.My original desire with this device was to do wireless projections from computers for town halls, impromptu sit down meetings, all work related. While it does a lot of great stuff, I needed those two things to be top of the list and the long term performance on those didn't quite make it for me.I'll be keeping my eyes open for the next iteration of this device, as it's well made and does a ton of great stuff. Just not quite well enough on the business use cases.

Title: Very good  (not perfect)
Comment: This thing is awesome. Great picture.I have a few complaints:I'd prefer it if the picture were just a little brighterUpdate: they have a beta version with Google Play support now. It works well. The only downside is that you can't add shortcuts for Google and Google play store apps to the home screens. So a ceasing those is a bit of a pain.The delighters:the form factor is greatthe battery last really long for a device this size. two movies, easythe picture is sharpthe control app for your smart phone is greatthe customer service is super responsive (they changed the controller app, and made it worse. I sent them an email, and they undid the bad change within a week. I lost my charger, they are sending a replacement, they added me to the Google play beta without fuss)I installed the projector on my ceiling and am projecting on a screen on the wall. It's a nice setup. The sound is remarkably adequate with this setup. And the best thing is the size of the projector. We don't own a TV, and this thing is great for the occasional movie.I came to this projector after a somewhat long journey that led me from multiple cheaply made projectors to this quality projector by Anker (an actual reputable brand).There are a bunch of cheap projectors on amazon that all follow a similar pattern: The same device is being sold with different brand names. There are no websites for the brands, or if there are, then the websites seem to have been translated into English with Google Translate. The reviews on amazon seem to be planted by the company, and again, Google Translate seems to have been used. Stay away from those products. You'll be playing the return game. I must have sent 7 projectors back to Amazon, wanting to believe that one of them was good. Ultimately a reputable brand, like Anker, was the win. It is much more expensive ($350 vs. sub $100 to $268), but it is worth it. Because the product is great, support is great, and updates are released regularly. Just research your product through google before you buy it. You'll see.

Title: Pleasantly Surprised - Typical Anker Quality
Comment: I am one of those people that is fussy about video quality.  So I picked this up on a lightening deal, not sure if I would ultimately even want to keep it.  I took a gamble, in large part because I've had good luck with Anker products in the past.This gadget does not disappoint.  The picture quality of this little thing is considerably better than I expected it to be.  In a fully dark room, the contrast is better than I expected it to be, and so is the color saturation.  It is also considerably sharper than I thought it would be given the resolution isn't even 720p.  But apparently the resolution calculus with a projector is a bit different, given that you are likely going to be sitting much farther away from the screen.Here is my experience: I set it up in a dark room, and just pointed it at a blank wall 6 feet away, no special projector screen.  That yielded a picture about 80" measured diagonally.  If you sit behind the projector at about 10 feet away from the wall, that 80" picture looks far better than it has any right to be.  It is an image you can comfortably watch all evening, without once thinking "geez, I really should have bought a 'real' projector."  That is frankly an amazing accomplishment for something as small as this.So what about if you want that big picture but want to sit closer?  The short answer is you probably need to spend a whole lot more money and get something that isn't portable.At about 6 feet from the wall, you start to see that DLP screen door effect with an 80" image.  It is not horrible, but to my eyes, you don't want to be closer than about 8 feet away from the 80" image.  I think it is no accident that the remote control receiver is on the back of the unit, as you will probably want to sit behind this projector if you are using it for movie nights or that kind of thing with a very large image.  I would definitely move the unit closer and make the image smaller than 80" if I had to sit closer than about 8 feet away.  So how happy you are with the image is going to depend a lot on your specific viewing situation.  Big room + Big image = Cool.  Small room + Big Image = Meh.I also tried the "Netflix on the ceiling" thing in bed.  In a dark room the brightness is good, and the resulting image is perfectly watchable and nicely sized.  You will get a slight screen door effect because you are a lot closer to the image.  I didn't find it terribly bad or distracting.  What I did notice is that you really have to use your phone to control the device in this mode, because the remote sensor is going to be covered up.  If you don't have the phone handy, you will have to set up whatever you are watching by holding the device up closer to the ceiling so you can get at the remote sensor, then lay it back on the pillow once the program is running.  Not a huge deal, but you are definitely not channel surfing in this mode without your phone.As for commercial use: if the room isn't completely dark, you can still get a watchable image, but you will probably need to shrink it down by moving the projector closer.  This is not a projector you want to use in a big, well-lit conference room where you also need a large image.  But in a smaller, more dimly lit room, it has enough zip to likely get by.  I will say I think it looks better watching movies than displaying static text.  You kind of notice the resolution limitations a little more when reading things off the screen vs. watching video.  Unless you really need portability over everything else, there are probably better, brighter choices out there for commercial use or in places where you can't get the room dark.Sound quality is a good notch better than I expected it to be given the size.  It can get pretty loud, loud enough to fill the room.  Yes, there isn't much bass, but that is to be expected.  Again, if you are just casually watching a movie or some YouTube video, it is fine.  And you can output to an external bluetooth speaker or headphones if you want better sound quality or need to watch silently.The device seems nicely built, with typical Anker-level attention to quality.  There is nothing cheap or chintzy about how this operates or is put together.  It feels and operates like a premium product.  The interface and software seem to work well. The iPhone app that turns your iPhone into a remote control for it seems to work well, and the included remote has a "mouse" mode that allows you to work with apps that require it if you don't have your phone connected to it.I did the screen mirroring thing with my iPhone and that worked generally pretty well too.  You CAN watch non-copy protected video stored on your iPhone by wirelessly mirroring your screen to the Capsule.  The connection seems pretty stable and it generally worked fine.  It does send audio out to the speaker on the Capsule as well, and the sound is properly in sync with the video.  However, there is noticeable screen lag when mirroring wirelessly from the phone, so don't expect to do anything like gaming or whatever using the mirrored phone image.I also plugged a USB thumb drive into it using the included adapter.  That also generally worked fine, assuming you have video encoded in a modern, recent format.  It choked on some older DIVX and AVI files, but smoothly played even higher resolution, modern files using VLC.  So if you are planning to play a lot of files off a thumb drive, you will want to confirm the format you are using is one it can handle.Of particular interest for a device like this, the device has a few gigs of included storage, allowing you to download from Amazon Prime or Netflix (Netflix has download available only on some titles), and then store the files on the device for later viewing off line.  So you can put a few things on the device itself without having to rely on the external USB connection.  You aren't going to put a whole library of stuff on the device, but there is room for a few movies.  That is going to be a very handy feature for traveling, given the sketchy WiFi in most hotelsYes there is a fan, and yes you can hear it if you sit close to the projector.  I didn't find it overly loud and intrusive, and it didn't bother me.  I also like the fact that you can attach a tripod to the bottom, that will likely come in handy.What don't I like?The lack of a physical headphone jack.  Bluetooth audio streaming is all you get here.  That is annoying on a phone, but really kind of inexcusable on a device that is so much larger.  When your bluetooth headphones die, if you aren't somewhere where you can play the audio through the speakers, movie time is over.  You WILL be annoyed by this at some point, it is practically guaranteed.No hard case included.  This product is expensive, and it comes in a very fancy cardboard box with a magnetic closure and LOTS of foam to protect the device in transit.  Take the money spent on the fancy box everyone is just going to throw away, and give me a hard-sided, padded case to help protect this while traveling.  There is no protective cover for the lens, and the little fabric case it comes with is inadequate.  This is not a $50 battery bank, it really should come with a proper travel case.You cannot charge the device or keep it plugged in while streaming off of a USB drive, there is only one USB port.Overall:  This is a pretty good casual entertainment/traveling device.  It is not going to replace a $2,000 projector that is about as portable as a cinder block, but it isn't trying to.  Instead, it is a small, convenient projector you can take almost anywhere, and will give you surprisingly good performance for its size.  It could even get by in less demanding commercial applications.  Unlike a lot of these projectors on Amazon that are sold by some random company you've never heard of, Anker has a built a reputation for putting out quality stuff, and this projector is no exception.

Title: Portable Projector/Speaker the size of a soda can with Built in Apps.
Comment: I've been using the Nebula Capsule for about a week and so far, I'm pretty happy with it.  I'll get the things I don't like about it out of the way:1. Could be brighter (but hey, it's the size of a soda can and you get 4 hours of playtime).2. It's only 480p. (wish it was 720p or higher but again it's the size of a can and the battery life is pretty good). 480p is "DVD quality"3. Apps - App store is decent (Netflix, YouTube, Amazon Video, etc.)  but would be even better if it had access to the Google Play store (more on that later).4. Unable to log into my YouTube account (more on that later)5. Focus is a mixed bag. If you adjust the focus to have a sharp picture for things that are in the center of the screen, stuff that's near the edges will be a bit blurry. You'll need to spend some time tweaking the focus and settle for a happy medium.Now for what I like/love1. The size and build quality. Nice metal construction and again it's the size of a soda can.2. Speaker. While it's not super loud, it gets the job done. It has 360 sound and does fill a room. It's nice that if you want, you can pair it with a bluetooth speaker or even bluetooth headphones.3. It can be used as a stand alone bluetooth speaker.4. HDMI port - This device will take just about anything that uses HDMI. I tried it with my cable box, Nintendo Switch and even a Firestick. Everything worked great.5. Anker Support!!! I reached out to Anker because I wanted to know if there's a way to be able to sign into my YouTube account (which would allow me to watch my purchased movies).  Not only did they help with this but they walked me through downloading an updated version of Android which not only allowed me to sign into YouTube but also allowed me to have access to the Google Play store, Google Movies, Chrome, etc.  This made the device even better. I now have access to all my owned digital movies and tons of apps.6. Internal Storage - You have about 8 gigs of internal storage so you can save a few movies directly to the device and watch them if you don't have wi-fi access.Do I wish it was brighter and had a sharper picture? Sure but if you accept it for what it is and appreciate what it can do based on it's size and portability, it's pretty awesome.I've tested it inside and outside. I've gotten it to display up to 100+ inches. Watched videos on the ceiling, on the garage, out on the deck, etc.  This may not be for everyone but it's nice to have such a small device that allows you to have portable entertainment whenever and wherever you want.I've included 3 photo's - One to show the size, one indoor (watching The Dark Knight via Amazon Instant Video) and one playing Fortnite outside on the deck (100 inches) on a white sheet.

Title: Surprisingly great little projector!
Comment: Surprisingly good for such a small projector. I like having apps like Amazon Prime Video built into the device, and I like the 4-hour battery and built-in speaker. It’s so convenient. It’s a lot better than having to connect a laptop or Blu-ray player and a speaker to a projector. Only complaints: The image is a little dim (which is to be expected from a projector that really is about the size of a soda can), and the built-in App Store is a bit limited. It isn’t powerful enough for a home theater setup, but it’s perfect for movies in the backyard or watching a big game.

Title: Portable high-quality bright and loud projector with good battery, fast Android (no GMS yet). Picture quality is mediocre though
Comment: The projector is indeed compact (although not tiny), well-made, with fast interface, relatively bright, good sounding (for its size and price), having good battery life, and overall appealing. Its main weakness for me, even thought more or less expected, is actual picture quality - which is rather mediocre. I was expecting this from a small projector, but it's too far from desired to be a serious thing. I consider this as a "toy" therefore (compact and fancy), but it can't be ever traded for "real" powerful projector in viewing experience.In a nutshell, the projector met my expectations after reading several reviews and forums beforehand. I still wish it had better resolution and more contrast. But if you read available information, you will have pretty much accurate impression with no surprises.Advantages:- Device quality is very good to my mind, it's well built, nice-looking, made of pleasant materials, even packaging is high-quality. It's compact, not feather-light but still easy to handle. Using standard micro USB charger is a convenience. I wish it was USB Type C though, it's already 2018.- Outlook is quite pretty. Somewhat asymmetric placement of lens hollow is weird, though.- Image brightness is rather above expectation. It's quite visible even in partly lit room on a cloudy day (not in bright conditions, obviously), and normally visible in gloomy conditions, not only in complete darkness. I could get bright-enough picture of about 100" in dark room. No complaints for its size.- Battery life is sufficient for my "normal" needs, e.g. I could easily watch 2 hours movie with sound and battery not dying still. I could also plug it into power bank while keep it playing, which is extremely convenient. One note - you can't easily find battery level rather then going to home screen. I wish device had some level of indication on itself, e.g. several LED marks (grade) in contrast to just semi-useless "nebula" word lightning on top.- Having remote control is a plus. It's very light and small. I wish it had at least play / pause dedicated button and surprised it's not there. It's also working very directly, I have to aim it at the back side of Capsule, otherwise it won't work.- Capsule Control mobile application helps a lot with text input, but I wouldn't call it convenient in navigation. You have to look at projected image while dragging finger over the phone. I wish it rather used phone gyroscope and LG Magic Remotes like pointer navigation with movement, rather than blind interaction.- Sound quality is more then needed from this portable small device. It's very loud by itself (e.g. when playing YouTube by built-in app). Same time, projecting via Miracast (both from phone or laptop) reduces sound volume very significantly (like 5 times lower, I first thought it's not working).- Android is very fast, zero lags. Custom interface is straightforward and clean. Don't know exactly what benefits Android 7.1.2 brings here, as interface is completely custom and there is no Google Play; still nice it's not outdated 4.4 Kitkat.- Screen mirroring - works as expected, didn't notice any problems for casting videos (didn't check for lags specifically). Tried from Android phone and Windows 10 laptop, all worked fine. Minor usability aspect - Screen Mirroring menu item, which is required to initiate casting, is for some reason "hidden" under Settings -> General and not on the main screen. Also, dedicated remote button for like Source selection would be beneficial.- Having standard full-size HDMI port is a plus. Luckily, you don't have to select HDMI input menu item for it to work (although it's present), it starts automatically. Sound volume is also much lower in this case, comparing to using built-in applications.Major points / wishes:- Picture quality - I wish resolution was higher, as 854x480 is too small, even for watching videos. Picture is not crisp, and not contrast enough for pleasant experience. It reminds me of old days with CRT TVs (in terms of quality and not size, obviously). Contrast is especially insufficient for dark-themed movies, e.g. Peaky Blinders style. Again, this is absolutely known and not a surprise at all, but beware.- Fan sound is higher then anticipated, considering the unit is not too powerful. Fan is very well audible, subjectively similar to fans of a powerful laptop under heavy load. Not an expert here, I was expecting it to be calmer considering claimed power consumption under 10W for everything: speaker, CPU and projector itself, and 15W LED E27 bulbs not require any active cooling (this is a very amateur view, obviously).- I would expect it to have some sort of lens cover, especially because it's portable.
