Device is overall metal, but unprotected lens glass requires very careful handling.- Still expecting Google Services to be available, as having limited app store and inability to login is a significant inconvenience. It doesn't even store YouTube history so I always need to start searching from scratch (am I doing something wrong?)- I wish focus setup would be automatic, as tuning it manually with tiny sensitive knob is not convenient (and remember, this thing is portable and therefore not sits in one place). Or being a laser projector, they say no focus tuning is needed then.- (minor point) it always loses Wi-Fi network after leaving stand-by mode, so I lose my video viewing position.

Title: Terrible product with many fake reviews (updated)
Comment: My first question: Are you kidding me?  We received the package at 6:30 pm.  Opened it up right away.  Unable to connect to our phones.  Huawei and Pixel 3 (latest model).  For the record, we aren't technology dumb dumbs.  We spent 1+ hours messing with this thing and absolutely no way to connect Bluetooth and airplay (cast).  In less than 2 hours, the projector is going back in the box for return.  What a waste of time!Update (Dec 19th, 2018):  Our review was a bit harsh because we were extremely frustrated.  However, Anker contacted us and we worked things out.  So, I changed the 1 star to 4.  Great customer service. Will for sure do business again.

Title: Great Customer Service and Follow through
Comment: I must say that I was skeptical at first when I order it on Indiegogo. It seemed unlikely that something so small could give such a big impact in the projector world with the sound quality it gives. I had some issues with the physical remote and the app. So I reached out to Anker and they help me resolve the issues I was having. First by replacing my remote without question and then by helping figure out how best to configure the app, so it works properly with the device. I felt that Angela in particular came through, followed up and stayed on top of the situation until it was resolved. Thank you Angela!!! Great customer support and experience.

Title: Almost perfect
Comment: I purchased this product July of last year for $350 and I love it!  I have used this product as a backyard projector along with a screen which I purchased from Elite (which is amazing btw). The Nebula is terrific for what it is.  Size, portability, and quality are great.  I have one issue that made me not give it 5 stars.  The remote does not work unless you are sitting directly behind the projector.  An inconvenient design flaw when you position the Nebula behind you or beside you.  You have to get up, stand behind it and point for it to work. This is annoying if you need to adjust the volume or pause or simply surf for content.  Although you can circumvent this with the app on your phone, you then have the light from the phone to deal with.  This could have been improved. Overall it is a fun projector and does what it promises.  I really like the unit.  Take advantage of the $249 Cyber Monday price.  You won't be disappointed.

Title: I had to write this review after the incredible support I recieved.
Comment: I purchased the Nebula Capsule to use mainly when I go camping. It works surprisingly well and was easy to set up. I had been using it about 6 weeks when I had an issue with it. The network antennae was not allowing it to connect to the wifi signal. I was worried until I called Nebula and spoke with Adam K. a Customer Support Engineer. This had to be the best experience dealing with an issue that I have ever had. They emailed me a return label next day postage paid and I had a new unit in hand within 5 days. This is how a company takes care of their valued customers. The Capsule is a really cool unit. The size and portability sets it apart from it's competition. Battery life is as stated. Thanks Nebula for renewing my faith that there are still companies that take care of their customers.Mark Haizlip

Title: Cool device, software is limiting, but their support really cares
Comment: I bought the capsule for travel & outdoor movies, and thus far it has been great.  It is portable, has really good battery life and the picture and sound are great for what I need.  The reason I took a star off is because the software on the device is limiting, in terms of apps that can be added to the device, content that can be AirPlayed to the device and the Netflix library in the app on the device.  Capsule support was great in helping out with some of these, they really went above and beyond and followed up with me on their own (unheard of!), but I worry that it shouldn't take an exchange with support to get the device really cooking.If they took the 2 part setup process now and got it to be the out of the box experience, this would be a 5 star product.  I really hope they do.

Title: A not too bad buy.
Comment: Sufficient brightness to view indoor during the day. Given that it is more expensive than many of the peers, a Higher contrast ratio will be nice. Having a tilt for the projector will be my request as very often I have to put the projector on the floor. Regular tripod doesn’t work since it is quite heavy. Connecting to hotel wifi is a challenge since the browser page doesn’t load. Now just hope it is durable and doesn’t breakdown after a few movies or so.

Title: remote control location
Comment: You can ONLY control the nebula from behind it,  with the controller and limited apps. That a biggie for me and that why it doesn't get perfect rating. . It's is such a spectacular product in every other way why not those features.

Title: Good hardware, software could use some work
Comment: Pros:hardware is well designedcapsule control app works well for interfacingpreinstalled apps (netflix, amazon video etc) work wellCons:1. limited pre-installed app store. They are working on this. To get stuff like HBO you'll have to email Nebula Support <support@seenebula.com> and tell them your firmware number and ask for a beta for the google play store. The customer service responded within 1 day and I am now able to download additional apps.2. The fan is a little on the loud side

Title: Sound’s good and responsive customer service
Comment: So far I streamed via a Roku stick that I powered via a portable battery. The picture quality and sound were good and all I need. The battery recharges quickly and lasts much longer than with other portable projectors. I love that the speakers are integrated into the unit. I found the inbuilt software lacking but must admit that  I did not spend much time on tweaking it for my needs. I was impressed with the responsiveness of the customer service.

Title: Great Compact projector
Comment: Use this projector for training presentations at many different sites. Compact, easy to travel with. Suggest adding a quality bluetooth speaker for videos when used in bigger rooms. Nebula speaker doesn't get very loud. My remote for the projector went bad after a couple months but customer service was great and had my remote replaced within a few days.

Title: Great product but tough to use in a bright room. Would not recommend for office.
Comment: This is an awesome product. Super easy to use. Would love it to have a longer battery life. Would also like the picture to be brighter. But awesome to use in a dark room. Or on a dark night outside!!!

Title: Good quality
Comment: Really great quality, definitely worth the price. The only thing I do not like is the controller on the app. Other than that it was a great purchase.

Title: Almost perfect
Comment: Great projector! only thing that I don't necessarily like is that the image is pretty dark and blurry if the image is more than 70in. Just something to keep in mind if you plan on mounting it to a wall.

Title: A great little projector
Comment: Great sound considering the majority of the projector is a speaker, but for real sound quality get speakers. Picture could be a little brighter but no projector out there is bright as a tv. The quality is good but again no projector is going to compete with a tv and have 4K HD quality. Still, overall this is a great little projector to have on the good when you want a big screen to watch in decent quality with pretty good sound for a projector this small. One other thing I really like is whenever you move the projector to a different angle or surface, it automatically adjusts the screen to fill the space so that's pretty convenient without having to move the projector back and forth to get the right size on the surface.

Title: Worth It
Comment: Bought other brands before, but end up getting this one. WiFi connect, and clear. But one thing is when you use the remote, you have to point exactly to the connected spot, otherwise it won’t work. But after all, great product(one thing that really need to pay attention is that IT CAN’T BE CHARGE BY OTHER CABLE BESIDE THE ONE COMES WITH ITSELF, even though they are all type-c…）

Title: Great for minimalists - but auto-screen adjustment is counterproductive
Comment: Pros:compactness and ease of use,Volume is loudOn the fence:Picture quality - especially in the daytime can improveAuto adjusts screen size depending on how close/far you are from a wall*** but this was the downside for me*** the sides of the screen would spill into my doorway or other walls - if it had manual adjustment I would have kept

Title: Small compact
Comment: Its 1080P , and you need very dark room to see the projected video,  good thing is you can use your smartphone to control it.

Title: Nice little Projector-
Comment: Speaker volume is medium. Plus side is you can Bluetooth connect to a larger speaker!  My daughter plays it in her room and loves it.  The portability is nice.  The price is a little High!

Title: it is working but not precisely~~
Comment: i used this at my bedroom.  it works at night without any room light.if you use any room light bulb with this projector then the picture is not that clear.also remote coverage is not great so that you have to aim it to projector all the time.....

Title: Read their Privacy Policy. They’re intrusive!
Comment: Have you checked out their ‘Privacy Policy’?They can (will?):“Collect and store” information on “your search queries, IP addresses, hardware settings, browser type, browser language, the date and time of your request, referral URL, and certain cookies that identify your browser or Account.”Imbedded web beacons allow their servers certain types of information from your Phone/computer/tablet and to read “when you opened an email message”Their cookies “May contain information about Device (Device is your phone/computer/tablet) , including “user settings, browsing history, and activities conducted while using the Services.”And, if you live in California like me they also “do not commit to honoring "Do Not Track" signals in your browser.”Their definition of Content means any “information, text, graphics, written posts, executive files..,” and “other information matetials generated, provided, uploaded, downloaded, appearing or otherwise accessible on or through Nebula”.  So, everything?Their Privacy Policy also contradicts their Terms in places.Their Terms indicate:They’ll collect “the counts of opening certain application”. Not theirs, ‘certain’.They’ll collect information on your phone/computer/tablet such as hardware and software versions and ‘so on’”.  So on?It’s s great product - super cool packaging, great display, solid interface.  But I’m going to return it.  It’s like getting a manicure and them rifling through my purse while they do it.  Ultimately, it doesn’t matter how sparkly my nails turn out...

Title: Great hardware, but software doesn't work.  Do not buy unless you want to project from HDMI source only.
Comment: I very rarely write reviews on Amazon, but I feel compelled to write a review for this product because there is relatively little public information online about it.  From an engineering perspective, the device is amazing - it's small and powerful, with good brightness for its size.  And if all you want to do is plug in an HDMI cable and project, you'll be happy.  However, to me, the real promise of this device was that it runs Android and should be able to operate entirely wirelessly via apps or casting, and these functions simply do not work.  Here's the deal:The Nebula Capsule does indeed run Android, but it doesn't have Google Play and most apps that you'd want to use are either not available or do not work.  For example, I was trying to watch the Olympics and the NBC Olympics app wouldn't install because Play Services aren't available.  NBC Sports installs ok but doesn't work because it needs the user to log in via a web browser and the Nebula doesn't have a browser.  The story was pretty much the same for all other apps I tried - they are either unavailable in the limited app store provided by the Nebula, they are available but won't install, or they install but don't work.Now, in theory you shouldn't have to install any apps on the Nebula because you should be able to cast from your smartphone to the Nebula.  However, casting is simply not functional from an Android phone - the Nebula doesn't show up in the casting options.  Nebula support says this is because the App isn't yet verified by Google Play, but I'm skeptical because the Nebula does show up in casting options from an iPhone but the casting is super-flaky.  Over the course of about three weeks with the device, I've tried to cast roughly 50 times.  Roughly 50% of the time it simply doesn't cast, and the app on my iPhone just goes blank while the Nebule is also blank.  The other 50% of the time it casts for a random interval of 1-10 minutes and then fails for no obvious reason.Overall, the hardware on this device is amazing, but the software is simply not ready for prime time.  I'll try buying one again in a few months, maybe.

Title: I’m keeping it, but...
Comment: The stripped-down version of Android is a real bummer, I must say. Kills the potential of this projector. It’s still better than all the other mini models, but it also costs a lot more, too, so I was hoping for more.The good:* Picture is bright enough in a dim room and great in a dark room. My walls are beige, not white, and it performs fine without a screen. I’m getting a screen soon, so I’ll update when I do. It’s still a mini projector, and portability is going to come with compromise.* I like the form factor. It fits nicely in a case made for the Amazon Tap speaker; it’s shorter than the speaker but about the same width, so I got that case and put in a bit of springy foam as support. There’s room for the power cord, also, though not the remote. (This $7 hack was better than the $40 case made for the Nebula.)* Sound is impressive for a small speaker that’s more than a speaker. It’s as loud as my Anker SoundCore, which is loud enough for my needs. Won’t fill a large room, but is perfectly serviceable for a few people watching a movie.* The interface is fine. It’s what you would expect from any non-standard Android iteration.* The two apps I tested which support downloads on other mobile devices also support downloads here (Netflix and Amazon). So I can conceivably download a season of whatever old show I’m bingeing at the moment and not require any additional devices.* The iOS app which accompanies the device is great. A much smoother experience than remote only, although the remote is perfectly useable as well. I like that there are two modes - mouse and “control”, which each serve a specific purpose to navigate most effectively. And there’s a full touch keyboard which helpfully allows you to skip the whole painful hunt and peck process which the remote requires.* Battery life claims seem about right, based on one usage period.And now the bad:* No Google Play store, meaning no access to the apps I want. I bought this mainly for one specific app, which I cannot install. Streaming from another device works, but the whole reason I opted for an Android-enabled device was to have access to apps. Granted, my app isn’t top ten most popular Play Store fare, but it shouldn’t matter. This is an Android device. That’s deeply disappointing. I nearly returned it because of that (except that the other options which do allow me to install my app perform at a much lower level in general).* Light is within acceptable limits for a mini projector, but based on price and design, I don’t see why they couldn’t have packed a bit more brightness in this thing.* The Netflix app requires the iOS app to function. It doesn’t support the remote control. What??? Why?* Controls on the device itself are minimal, and do not allow it to function without the remote. If you lose the remote, you may lose the ability to operate your device. The app probably mitigates that issue, except that already twice I’ve encountered some interface struggles that I could only resolve using the back button on the remote (not in the app).  So maybe it doesn’t. Don’t lose your remote.* No USB ports. There’s a microUSB to USB dongle which allows for a USB connection of a thumb drive or whatever, but it’s a dongle. I hate dongles. One more thing to forget/lose.  Would it have been so hard to add a single USB port??...Overall it’s a good device. Certainly better than other mini projectors I’ve tried. If you’re satisfied with the apps their stripped-down OS seems worthy of download, you’ll be happy with the device. I’m keeping it even with my complaints simply because the speaker is great, it isn’t super buggy like other devices in the same genre, and I’m not going to find a better option than this. But there’s just no good reason I can see to omit Play Store.

Title: Lies
Comment: Who reviewed this POS and gave it 5 stars?1. Bluetooth doesn’t stay pair to outside speakers.2. Sound quality without the speaker is crap.3. Remote control works when it feels like it.4. App doesn’t work as expected.5 Does not fully charge, I had to charge the capsule for 12 hours just so it can be 92%.6. Apps keep force closing.7. No option to resize the screen.This machine would have been great if it worked.

Title: It doesn’t work on most formats.
Comment: The projector will play Netflix off it’s native application using your phone as a hotspot.The projector will work with a direct line HDMI to a gaming console or disc player. The end.It implies that it will mirror different devices. That is true: VIA WiFi! It will not mirror via Bluetooth or direct line HDMI. It does not have common video applications like Hulu.Bottom Line:Are you buying it so you can pack your gaming console but not your TV? => BuyAre you buying it so you can watch Netflix (and only Netflix) on a larger screen utilizing your hotspot enabled smartphone? => BuyAre you hoping it will save you from packing a work monitor for you computer through the HDMI port? => Do not buy. It will not, it is not a monitor.Any other reason? => Do not buy; It won’t work.

Title: Needs to be brighter
Comment: I got this projector due to being compact and having built in speaker.  The con is that you can only use in pitch black room, as it isn’t very bright.  I tried in room with blinds and the light from blinds just allows too much light.

Title: 2 weeks, 7 etc support calls and  $76 worth of hdmi cables and connectors but still doesn’t work.
Comment: Mine had a ton of problems. I called customer support about 5 times and ultimately couldn’t get it to work. When I clicked on Netflix on the home screen it would neither download Netflix nor play Netflix. So I called and they gave me a work around, a google play password to download the google store. I did that only to find that there was no enter button. Not on the remote or on the iPhone nebula connect app. So I called again and they told me to hold down the mouse button on the remote until I got a pointing hand cursor which I could use my remote arrows to navigate around. Finally I could scroll down enough to get to the enter button. Success!  Google play store finally downloaded. A series of steps was completed and I restarted after the install. Now I went to try to download Netflix. I typed netflix in the search window but Netflix didn’t appear. So I couldn’t download the app. Giving up on that, I tried to download amazon prime from the google play app because that’s the other way I watch movies. Well I found amazon prime app and I downloaded it, but when I tried to log in I kept getting stuck at the Captcha. Again and again and again and again I’d enter my very long password with that cumbersome remote. And then when I’d enter the captcha it would say there was an error. This was supposed to be plug n play. Open the capsule. Click Netflix from the home screen. Log in and watch my Netflix!!! By now it’s 2 weeks and about 7 phone calls to customer service in and I still can’t play a movie from my projector. What can I do?  I can project my photos using screen mirroring. But that’s kinda boring. And o can’t screen mirror movies From Amazon prime or Netflix because it is copyrighted and it won’t screen mirror.So next customer service tells Me that I should try hardwiring my phone to the projector. That way if I am playing Netflix or Amazon prime on my phone it will go through the HDMI cable and directly into the Nebula and will project! This is not the point and shoot I was hoping for but I was excited to try it. After spending $56 on an Apple proprietary lightning cable to HDMI set up, and another $18 on an HDMI to HDMI cable, I was ready to watch a movie!  But no.  I connected my phone the other cables to the Nebula and no matter what I did the Nebula just did not see the HDMI input. Even though I bought the fancy made for iPhone proprietary cable connectors. So now I’ve spent $300 on the Nebula and I’ve spent $76 on cables and the thing just doesn’t work. They have advanced my customer service to a higher level of tech-support and no one can help me so I am returning it. I am going to have them send me another a capsule. Maybe this one was defective? Nothing should be so hard.  If I can’t get this one working with ease I’ll just give up.

Title: A Good Attempt but Needs Improvement
Comment: I purchased the Nebula Capsule Smart Mini Projector as a gift so I can not review it for long term use.I inspected the projector to ensure it works because it is going to family overseas and can not easily be exchanged if needed.  I am happy I did this because there was a small problem with the remote.  The battery door was broken and would not stay in place.  Anker contacted me directly via email to ask about the purchase and when I informed them of the problem they had a new remote to me in 3 days.  I am always impressed with Anker's customer service.I attached the Nebula Capsule to a camera tripod and found it fit perfectly.It powered on with an almost full charge out of the box.  The one I purchased is black and it has a slick look.  As described it is similar in size and weight to a can of soda.The material quality is top-notch.  The casing feels like it is built to last, mostly of metal.The size makes it very portable.  I paired it with a hard-shell travel case for safer transportation.It comes with a wall charger and cable.  If you wish to use it while  charging I would recommend purchasing a longer cable as the included one is short.I was not impressed with the app interface.  Using the included remote is clunky and for using my phone as a remote I am forced to have both the bluetooth and location turned on even when connected to the same wifi router.The Nebula Capsule has an app store of sorts but many of the more popular services did not work. No Hulu. No Prime. Netflix worked but the interface is poor;  namely it would freeze while searching and then scrolls up or down for no reason.  YouTube is available but it did not have an option for me to sign into my account.The sound quality is not great.  It does get loud but loud does not equal clear audio.  It is not in stero and I did not see a way to connect to external speakers.  There may be a way but I was only testing the basics.The picture quality is not full HD but good for a portable projector in this price range. The room needs to be almost completely dark.I think it would work well for a basement room or any room with no windows. Otherwise I can not see it working well without blackout curtains or waiting for night fall.The portability is nice and I can see the four hour play time working well for (night time) outdoor use while camping or just enjoy a nice night outside.For the price I would recommend it but barely.  There is a lot of room for improvement for any future models Anker may produce.

Title: Lovely outside, but the guts on this unit leaves something to be desired.
Comment: Out of the box the unit itself is a solid piece of hardware, well constructed, metal grill over the speakers and a thick chasis that looks like it can take a fall or two without hurting the unit itself, the lens is recessed far enough that it won't get scratched easily but for that extra layer of protection a small bag is included with the packaging.So that's the good... what about the bad?The operating system being Android 7.1 is fine but even with the basic apps (youtube, netflix, opera browser) I've already taken up over half of the built in memory. That doesn't leave much room for videos etc. While the usb port may be used for expanded memory (although one raises the issue on how you would charge the unit) the fact that you don't have a micro sd slot seems like a poor design decision.As far as apps are concerned Youtube is problematic because I can't seem to login to my youtube account despite me pressing the "login" button many times it just doesn't respond. Netflix responded ok so that's a big plus.The remote control app that I downloaded on my phone is fine although it can get a bit sluggish and swapping back and forth from keyboard and mouse can get frustrating.Framerate wise this projector can get choppy so please keep that in mind especially if you are a gamer...To summarize..The GoodBuild qualityPortabilityKeystoning is a breeze and the focus is greatBrightness if you don't need 100 inches or more and you are in a dark room, for me this unit is fine for the netflix ceiling projector binge watching.The BadDespite this being an Android system your app store is limited as it's not linked to Google PlayOnboard ram/rom is not sufficient for a smooth experienceYoutube app is buggyRemote control app seems buggyAirplay for me had quite a bit of lag and framerate lossTo sum things up, I got this on sale so I'm not angry about the purchase. Will this replace my TV? No. Not at all. Is this a handy little thing to have to bring out at parties, camping trips, or on the road? Definitely in fact that's where this unit shines the best. If you want a portable all in one that you can take anywhere to watch something in the dark this is fine, if you want more than that? I recommend searching elsewhere.

Title: No Longevity. Sporadic functionality
Comment: It's been about a month since purchase. My intent with this device was for long usages. Not just a one movie and done. I've kept it plugged in the entire time, we aren't talking about battery issues.The first few weeks it was amazing and stayed on as long as I needed it as long as it was plugged in.Now. Going on week 6, I try to play one movie and it just shuts off randomly. I don't know why. Overheating? The only way to fix the issue is to reboot the system.Getting fed up with an item that was multiple hundreds of dollars to fail so spectacularly.Pertinent details: I use the hdmi port to a chromecast and keep the projector plugged in the entire time. Battery shows 100%Yet it'll just go black to no display and just audio unless I reboot the thing.

Title: It must be unlocked...
Comment: It is locked so none of the apps work. You can not even sign into Youtube. Lol!  You can not even screen share and run apps through your phone the device detects it and crashes your connection in order to stop you from using apps. What is the point of buying this pricey thing?You actually have to jail break it to make it worth while. I'm not going to do that! Just thought I would save you all the time.

Title: Almost love it. Not worth the price.
Comment: This was so expensive, $300. So I was hoping it would be everything I was hoping for. i mean, its decent, but for the price? It has some shortcomings.The sound is not good, and they brag so about it. You’ll want to hook a Bluetooth speaker up.The fan inside is super loud. So the poor sound quality struggles to overpower it. Hook that Bluetooth speaker up.The remote control sucks. You have to be pointing directly at the back of the nebula in order for it to register, which is extremely inconvenient.The app that lets you control the nebula from your phone, yeah, that sucks too. Connective issues, frustrating controls that don’t always work.Apps are limited and outdated through their own Apptoid Store. Annoying.Some apps have issues, and can’t be used with the remote control, like Netflix. You HAVE to use the crappy phone app.The battery life only lasts one movie. But you can use it while it’s plug in. Get a portable charger.(Might at well get a bigger projector with better sound and battery life.)You’re not able to adjust screen size or angle on your own. Sometimes it corrects angle on its own, sometimes it doesn’t. Annoying. Screen size can only be adjusted by physically moving the nebula closer or farther away from the screen. So sometimes you are just not able to get the size you need or want. It can be difficult or impossible in some of the spaces you will be in. And you will have to watch your movie on a screen that is either entirely too small or too big.It’s a decent projector, but is not worth what they are charging when it has so many short comings. I’m sure there are more, and I will add them as I notice and remember.

Title: Terrible Software and Barely Usable!!
Comment: I was really excited for this to show up with the NFL Championship games coming up this weekend. I have AT&T TV for live television which is available on my Roku, Amazon Fire and pretty much every other device. The Nebula loaded software is just flat out terrible!! AT&T TV is not available and cannot be projected via Airplay. I know I can use an HDMI from my iPhone but for me that completely defeats the purpose of buying an expensive PORTABLE projector.Netflix and Disney+ using the AppToid software requires the Nebula app vs the provided remote. I prefer a remote, Roku and Fire TV UI work well with their remotes and that is the experience I am looking for.Sound is great, video is more than good enough but not full HD. However, the UI is so bad I am going to return it!My recommendation is if this can be upgraded to Android TV 9.x than its worth it, if you not and you are stuck with AppToid than I would say "Do not buy!'

Title: Mala resolucion en salas iluminadas
Comment: Mala resolucion en salas iluminadasLa resolucion en salas iluminadas es mala, no se ve practicamente nada en ninguno de los modos. Solo funciona en salas oscuras

Title: It doesn't work
Comment: Horrible product. Doesn't connect to Netflix. It started out playing Netflix and was great, then suddenly stopped. Won't connect,and when it does, it'll start playing something for 30seconds then stop with an error code. Try to play it again and it won't. If I try another movie it won't connect at all. Mirror image is garbage, only good for pics nothing else. Half the time it doesn't work at all. I tried everything, cleared data, rebooted, uninstalled reinstalled, nothing works. It's a paperweight

Title: Does not work well with Airplay for iPad
Comment: I bought this projector because I wanted to use it in my classroom to airplay from my iPad. I thought it was perfect because it was small, wireless (no cords!!!!!), and I could easily move it around my room. Once I got it and began using it, however, I realized that airplay from the projector to my iPad is very slow, sometimes unresponsive, and now won't even connect. The other issue is that it's really not very bright unless you have a very dark room. This is an issue for my classroom because my students still need enough light to write their notes. I had such high hopes for this projector. I will say that I liked the fact that it has the remote app (super convenient). The only thing I would recommend this projector for is to watch Netflix. Besides that, not worth it. I'm really underwhelmed, especially for the price.

Title: Not what you think
Comment: If you’re a teacher or a businessman then this will be just fineBut if you just want to connect to a projector via Bluetooth and play YouTube videos on your wall or ceiling...this is far from the right productIt needs WiFi because it is its own device and in that sense you can use YouTube or even NetflixBut this is the type of purchase that involves several more purchases afterwards if you want to utilize the productSince I can’t do anything with it I just use it as a speakerMaybe one day I’ll get the type of projector that works with a phone in a simple mannerAnd maybe one day I’ll get to use this as intended..but it is literally not possible right now

Title: Was probably a great purchase in 2018, but there are better options for price in 2021
Comment: This projector is really cool looking. It's really easy to use and connect via HDMI or the app. It's compact size makes it easy to take with you, where ever you go, and the speaker is powerful enough that people in the room can hear everything they need to hear.BUT- the video quality is a bit dated at this point. Low ANSI Lumen number and non HD video playback makes this projector a relic of the past that has been bypassed by technology of newer items.Customer support was great to work with, and offered up a few great things to try and make this work better to fit my needs. Getting to be a beta tester and access the play store was HUGE....but it still left me wanting more from a video quality standpoint.Simply put- I don't think it's worth the price when compared to other similar projectors on the market in 2021.

Title: Just ok not great
Comment: I wanted to like this mini projector so much but i just can't. So first of all you can't mirror movies from your tablet even if you paid for the movie. It's great that the hulu and Netflix apps let you pre download them if you decide to use this camping but i wanted to use my tablet considering i have over 200 movies and 7 tv shows on it. Also the projector doesn't come with the google play store even though it's powered by Android. They also have a bug when connecting your phone to it because it disconnects every 20 seconds or so. I decided to give the hdmi cable option a try but the sound is about a second behind so it's a little annoying. They really need to update the software if they are going to charge as much as they do

Title: Not worth the money
Comment: 1. They’ve lowered the price on this item the day I received it in the mail. Since Amazon won’t do a price adjustment, I would have to return this item and purchase a new one at the lowered price. This is insane considering that prime isn’t prime anymore, I’d have to wait another 3 weeks for this to process.2. The apps available are weak and a waste of space so you have to stream or mirror your other device.3. Since you can’t adjust the zoom or angle of this projector. You have to invest more money in a tripod.So unhappy with this.

Title: Look elsewhere not very bright and blurry edges
Comment: The picture is horrible at 100 inches. You either get clean edges and horrible center picture or horrible edges and decent center pictures. For 300 you can find better options out there. It’s not even 720p it’s like vga video quality. The speaker is horrible. It says you can use it as a Bluetooth speaker. My iPhone’s speaker is better than this thing. Will also just randomly shut off on you. For this price, i would expect better. This is going back. Will try something else.

Title: Disappointed and underwhelmed
Comment: I wanted to like it and keep it, I really did. I kept trying to convince myself that the picture quality wasn’t bad (it’s merely okay), that I wasn’t bothered by how poor the speaker is (it’s so bad), and I’m sad this was not the TV replacement I was hoping for.My apartment is pretty dark for most of the day compared to most places I’ve lived and it still wasn’t dark enough until night for the projector to show nicely. The speaker is honestly really terrible when compared with…anything else. I connected my UE Boom via Bluetooth in an attempt to solve that issue but the projector wasn’t smart enough to correct for the lag. The difference in audio quality between my external speaker and the projector was the final straw—the audio should not be a selling point.The app that you use to navigate the projector with is a little glitchy but I figured it out and navigation became a breeze, which I appreciated. I mounted it on a tripod and was impressed at how small the device is.I watched hours of shows hoping that I could get used to the giant pixels, audio, and lag. I wasn’t expecting top tier stuff, but I’d even prefer to watch things on an iPad compared to on the projector. It’s going back.

Title: Expensive, Bad Navigation, No Display Resizing.
Comment: It’s packaged and looks great. However, the remote navigation (or app) is horrible. For the price we paid I would have rather purchased an Apple TV and a projector. In all fairness I’m a big Apple product fan. The other issue is you can’t resize the display. You have to physically move the device. I really feel like I was sold something pretty. The wife uses it and likes it, but she has the same complaints as me. Too lazy to return this and it is functional at the very least. Maybe their more expensive models solve some of these problems? Try them first.

Title: over priced and poor quality
Comment: It has its pros and cons. I like the portable easy to use feel. Easy charging. It works well. I was able to watch a movie even at 2% but the quality suffers.  Could be brighter and more clear I guess it really depends on the screen too. The apps need improvement. It says you can stream from them and it was really hard to do so. I ended up just connecting my firestick and no sound came out The auto keystone is ok. But you’ll want to use the manual option because the auto is lacking. I don’t like it. It’s not worth the 300$ I’m still looking for a decent projector for less.

Title: Great small projector
Comment: I don’t even know where to start. I’ve read a lot of reviews in this and other products like it. Some people’s expectations of any product are outrageous. But I think those that don’t find this projector meets their needs, should spend more money on a higher quality projector. But if you are looking for small, portable, good quality for an affordable price, then this should fit your needs. I’m in the military and deploy/TDY a lot. I couldn’t ask for a better versatile product. Not to mention when I’m home, the kids love using it. The sound quality is great, the resolution is better than I expected for such a small product.Update 6/17/2020: for some unknown reason the sound is now distorted when playing a video no matter what platform I use. When going through the different apps it seems fine. Makes the normal click sounds. Ran update and still doing it. Pretty bummed since I made sure to take care and store it properly. It’s now rendered useless.

Title: Utter disappointment and waste of money, buy a cheap one this one runs like it
Comment: Spent nearly $300 hoping for a smart protector with Bluetooth capabilities that can play streaming services, received a glorified soda can with a lens in it. Not a single application worked and some said they needed to be updated via google play store which is not available on this device… other apps simply refused to work giving no other explanation. Got it today will be returning it today

Title: Brightness and Windows Projection Not Great
Comment: I bought this last year more as a gadget at a reasonable price than a real need.  Form factor, operating system, and sound are very good.  However, when testing it for projection purposes at my kids' school, I found that connecting via my MacBook and iOS/Android, worked great.  I was not able to do Windows without using the HDMI connection. (I could have been doing something wrong but it certainly didn't "just work" like other operating systems)I then tried to use it during a school meeting and quickly realized the brightness just didn't work unless the room was completely dark.  The newer model has twice the brightness, but at its' current cost, I'd definitely research other options.

Title: NO AUDIO OUT!!!
Comment: This is the nicest picture I’ve ever seen from a small projector. Virtually everything about its functionality is awesome BUT because there is no way to amplify the audio any louder it can basically only be used indoors in a small room. Virtually every projector I’ve ever seen has an audio out so you could run the audio through a louder sound system with this huge screen but this does not. So, a movie by the pool on a summer night it’s just not gonna work.

Title: Youtube sign in tip/trick
Comment: I was absolutely shocked at the top tier quality of this product. The fact that I can use this in a well lit room is mind blowing!One major issue though. The apps. Specifically YouTube. Upon initial attempts the app continues to crash and unfortunately this has been mentioned in prior reviews multiple times and it doesn’t appear as though Anker isn’t too vested in resolving this. Nonetheless I found a slight lifehack for this Nebula!“Watch on tv”If you’re signed into YouTube on your phone and you have a playlist you’d like to access or if you PAY for no commercials .. this is the simplest method of having YouTube recognize your account while projected.1. Go to settings (within YouTube) on the Nebula (you MAY have to select “more settings”)2. Scroll down to “Link with TV code”  2a. Once the code generates go to step 33. Open YouTube up in your mobile app and go to settings4. Select “watch on tv” it should then ask you to enter the code you will see projected via Nebula.Keep in mind this will only have specified videos you select on YouTube via your phone be played and recognized but not your entire YouTube profile.Option 2Signing in.This app crashes ALL the time when you hit “sign in” in the top right corner of YouTube. After many different techy methods I was able to get signed in. I’ll be honest I will provide steps to the best of my recollection (again I tried like 101 ways)1. Expand the navigation pane on the left side and scroll down to subscriptions or library2. Once the sign in option generates sign in .. now it should allow you to enter your username and password.3. The app will then crash lol now generally speaking I’ve the next few YouTube app launches it will sometimes recognized you as signed in already and other times it will not.THE BIGGEST THING TO HELP SECURE THE LOGIN IS TO WAIT ABOUT 3 MINS AFTER NEBULA LAUNCHES BEFORE YOU SELECT TO OPEN ANY APP ESPECIALLY YOUTUBE!I now give my nebula that 3 min window and each time I’ve launched YouTube it has signed me in! Ideally it’d be nice to have Anker not have customers paying $200-$300+ for a faulty app software BUT I guess we can’t expect too much. Would be 5 stars if we didn’t have to pay SO MUCH for an expensive SLIGHTLY faulty software.

Title: DO NOT DO IT, misleading reviews
Comment: Its honesty so bad. I never leave reviews but I am so bothered by the amount of good reviews I had to tell the troughWhere do I start.....1, Terrible battery life2, it is not bright3, you can’t adjust the sizing4, literally majority of the apps are not available in the US ( silly I know)5, you literally can’t airplay anything6, IT IS SOOOO LOUDDDDDI’m so upset I purchased this I’m. I threw out the box by accident is the only reason I can’t refund it. Waste of money. Dont do it

Title: Video isn't that sharp, 420p, but rest is good
Comment: Things I dislike about it1. The video isn't that sharp - this is probably the main reason why I wouldn't recommend it to someone2. The remote control buttons don't always work. Sometimes I have to press a button multiple times for it to register even though I'm pointing right at the projector.Things I like:1. It's really small and portable2. You can install Netflix, Amazon Video and Youtube.3. You can mirror your smartphone or computer4. 4 hour battery life is pretty good5. I can connect to my bluetooth headphones, so I can watch it at night without disturbing my roommate.People said the noise from the projector is too loud. I don't find that an issue since the noise will be covered by the sound from your movie. I don't even notice the sound when I'm playing a show.In summary, if you're not too picky about the image quality, this projector is pretty good. It's a bit expensive, but very portable.

Title: Does the job, but was expecting more
Comment: I don't know, but for the money I spent on this unit was expecting more. My main complain is the sound is not loud enough. A group of 4-5 people need to be really quite and strain themselves to hear the movie or whatever is being projected. Keep in mind, that if you are outdoors, it may be impossible.Setting it up is relatively easy. But there doesn't seem to be way to beam from your phone. So, I suspect the apps on the unit will turn pretty stale in a couple of years - like they do on the (not so) smart TVs. And then, this unit will be obsolete.Otherwise, we have been using it in our backyard, so it does its job, I guess

Title: Compared to others at the same price point, disappointed.
Comment: I had high hopes for this as it is such a cool concept. But the brightness and the clarity is not worth the price. I've tried other no-name brand projectors that were less expensive and unfortunately they were brighter and clearer. This was a gift to my son, so he enjoys it and cannot tell the difference. But having tried others, I say the price is not worth it. And it is missing an audio jack for external speakers. The Phillips picopix nano projector is a cheaper much better option and the sharpness and brightness is comparable.

Title: Doesn't really screen mirror.
Comment: I cant screen mirror anything....its so dumb, I can watch it on my phone becasue I have netflix, Amazon, nfl ect but the sevice has a built in block to prevent me from using it for what I want, which is to stream and project.....i can use a bunch of cables but it's not so portable and easy then. Sort of self defeating when it's the most useful purpose for such a device.... I dont get it, I pay for these services to watch them so I dont see what its protecting really, just disfunctional really.I also have to agree with some other people here as far as privacy that they are kind of being offensive to their customers with the violations. I dont know about anyone else, but when I pay a lot of money for a piece of tech I would want the company I'm buying it from to care about their customers and treat them with respect.

Title: Many many reasons to move on - this sucks
Comment: This totally sucks.1) it’s dim as heck2) you can’t opt to leave the cord in charging - you have to unplug it every time you turn it back on to use it - how stupid is that!  Do a firmware update to let us leave the power cord in if we want.  No way could you have made such a terrible hardware choice, make a firmware update it’s been a long time!  Fix that!  Let us choose to keep it plugged in what a pain!3) way way overpriced for these issues4) sucker isn’t clear, super pixelated low quality image for the price5) leaves you witn a bigtime “I got ripped off feeling”

Title: Be prepared to never actually watch anything on it.
Comment: Be prepared to never be able to watch anything on it. As a device it’s awesome; quiet, portable etc. But to actually watch something on it is nearly impossible.At home with stable WiFi works ok but the operating system is not good.To do something on the go is very difficult. Getting something from your phone or computer on to the device is nearly impossible. Using an hdmi cable from the computer to the nebula is all that seems to work in a no- internet situation.It’s primary function for me is in no internet situations. Kinda what it was designed for if you ask me.

Title: Awful device that does not work
Comment: This is a complete waste of money. If I could return it I would.The sound quality is awful, but I cannot get it to connect with bluetooth speakers to avoid using the speakers on the device. The picture quality is not great and it is hard to focus the image.Worst of all the apps that you download in the device barely work. They are impossible to navigate with the remote and I am unable to even scroll and search through movies in Netflix. Using airplay to stream movies then doesn't work because all of the apps protect their content and don't allow you to stream with airplay.This is really the worst projector I have ever used, it is literally a piece of crap.

Title: Low quality item. Died after 22 months with very light usage.
Comment: It was great while it lasted but clearly not a quality item as it shouldn't have stopped working in less than 2 years. My original order said that the "support window" was only 6 months. Pretty awful for a $350 product. It wasn't used anything close to every day. On average less than once per week. Buyer beware. Couldn't even find a way to contact the company on my order page.

Title: More looks than longevity, buy the extended warranty
Comment: I had and was well entertained by this projector for 1 yr 8 months, then it went haywire it stays on when turned off on the unit and the only way to get it to turn off is to unplug it so it’s out of commission. At the price I would have expected it to last up to 3 years but looking online it’s pretty typical that it gives out about now. Unfortunately I didn’t know so I didn’t buy the extended warranty and am out of luck except to send it back and pay $139 to receive a refurbished one. There is also no known way to just replace the battery of the unit itself. I have purchased a lower price projector and will see how that stacks up. I hook it up to my Roku so I’m not doing to much, I will say when I tried to use the apps on this about every 10-15 minutes it would close out so I wouldn’t use that as a selling point.Remote - it stopped being useful a little over a year and changing the battery is a task, the manufacturer battery is lined to fit the shape so an off the shelf Duracell doesn’t fit properly.It is very portable and a cute product design.

Title: Great video but very disappointing
Comment: At first this little projector impressed me so much. It has android built into so you can stream Netflix, Hulu, Amazon video, etc. Video looks great. The but is that it drops WiFi all the time. I can’t watch a full show without it having some sort of issue with the “network.” And now it asks me to download the amazon AppStore to be able to use the Hulu app which I shouldn’t need to but I tried and it doesn’t let me. So I can’t use the Hulu app. The only way to actually watch anything is to connect something with an hdmi cable which I was trying to avoid to not have a bunch of cables everywhere.

Title: The product picture quality is bad
Comment: The sound quality is good but The picture quality is very bad as the images projected images are not clear even within a 4 foot distanceI wanted to use it to teach some presentation slides my residents but I was really disappointed by the picture quality. In fact some of my residents were laughing wondering why I bought the productI wanted a replacement but I am afraid it will be the same thing. I do not think the product is defective I believe this is the best picture you can get

Title: Expensive toy. Not much application for it.
Comment: It's not a terrible product, but for the price, I just feel like it's a waste of money. The image that get's projected is big and about what you would expect. It didn't blow me away with quality or leave me devastated. It is bright in a dark room, but like most projectors seems useless if you don't have blackout curtains. The issue I had was the price you pay versus what you get. I wouldn't purchase again. The app was a bit clunky. You can't use Netflix with it, but Youtube videos worked fine. I just don't see many applications for this.It collects dust in my closet.

Title: A complete mess filled with issues, not worth price.
Comment: Product has a ton of issues. Many of the apps on the store have a lot of bugs & issues that are never addressed such as: VLC, NordVPN, Netflix, YouTube etc.For some reason, out of the box the remote did not work at all...? I instead had to use my phone as a remote. Which is inconvenient since I also wanted to use the device to mirror my phone.It freezes really bad sometimes whenever you plug in a storage device into it to play something. And instantly reboots and disconnects from phone.It mirrors phones fine and at the core of this device it gets the job done... but many of the features and apps are not optimized or ever looked at.The device is convenient, at the cost of it being extremely inconvenient in many other ways. Would recommend saving and looking for a product more high quality.

Title: Disappointed by selling used item
Comment: I will be returning this item. Although i love ankers products, they sent me a refurbished or used one.  When i set it up, had someone else’s profile installed already. Very dissatisfied i paid for new product only to be sold used.  Ankers i hope you do better cause i do enjoy your products.

Title: Well manufactured, disappointing audio
Comment: The Capsule is an impressive product straight out of the box, in fact the packaging is very impressive.  The product is clearly well manufactured and made from quality materials.  The size and the portability make it a compelling product, and quick to set up.  The image is quality is good for a projector its size.  It is a impressively designed product.I would be willing to live with the image quality if the sound worked.  I got rid of my TV and planned to use Capsule to project from my Apple TV.  Unfortunately, there was a noticeable lag between the image and the sound, could be bearable if it were not my primary viewing device.  Then Airplay does not work for popular apps like Netflix, Amazon Prime, and HBO GO because of an issue with streaming copyright content.  The native apps within the Capsule work well but also have limited functionality; Amazon Prime only worked view browser.  This product could benefit from an audio out port.I think that Anker is on to something, and would be interested in Capsule 2 as it is anticipated to include more ports and hopefully can address the sound lag issues.

Title: I got original version and not the Capsule II
Comment: I was expecting the Nebula Capsule II since I ordered it January 2019. What I got is the original version - still Micro-USBHad so much difficulty downloading the update as well as the apps. It says there was an error downloading. My WiFi is fast and consistent.

Title: Apple compatibility lacking
Comment: Bought and read the reviews dating is android based but really hoped for more.Can access some apps directly from the device but is seem to have to enter my log in details every time. Cannot stream from certain apps even when connected directly.Focus isn’t great like really wanted to like this, but don’t. Almost returned - just didn’t due to covid and restrictions

Title: Dont Buy This Product
Comment: Do not buy this. You will not get what is showcased in the ad. In my case 3 items were missing and the remote is not working with a dead battery and lid broken. Projector doesnt charge fully.

Title: Cool idea, great design, bad execution.
Comment: We debated keeping the device, it looked cool, solid, great design, picture quality was great but the interface was too sluggish and the version of Android OS was old and not very functional. For instance we couldn’t log into our Ytube account on the app. That was the deciding factor to return. Who wants to watch commercials? Also the bluetooth speaker needs some improvement. Disappointed but think a few tweaks would make this product a must have!

Title: Garbage.
Comment: I will be returning this tomorrow. It’s bad enough that it is too dim to watch outside at dusk, and that it is not HD quality. But what really seals the deal is having to ditch the remote that comes with it for a phone app in order to use Netflix or Amazon Prime. If that was not bad enough it does not actually give you access to the google play store. Major streaming services such as HBO Max are not available without emailing support and having to enter a unique password in order to get some of test build on the capsule. I’m sorry but if your product doesn’t let you use the full functionality out of the box. It’s garbage.

Title: Great size, terrible software and connection ports lacking
Comment: This seems like the perfect projector size and price, but the software bus terrible. You end up having to plug a laptop or dongle as the software is no good. It has no usb so even an amazon stick requires an additional power source cable. The lure of it's size is what got me untill I came across all these issues. Returned and got the Mars Rover Pro 2. A bit more $ but so much better.

Title: Send me my money back please
Comment: It was cool...did everything I needed until it didnt. Delivered to me on March 18th, stopped working on March 30th.Also I supposedly bought a new device??Its supposed to come pre-loaded with netflix youtube and amazon.But when I opened those apps, they were already signed in to someone else's netflix (shoutout to laurie & melanie) AND someone else's Amazon account. I read a review about intrusive Terms of Conditions before I bought it so it looks to be some truth to that. Thankfully I never signed in using my info.

Title: Save your money. DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK
Comment: I like the item itself but the one huge problem for me is the same that many users complained about and it's the fan noise.  It ruins everything for me because it's so damned loud.  I don't listen to movies loud because I have roommates but at regular sound that fan noise drives me crazy.New Update after having it for some time now.  I've lowered my rating to 1 star and I wish I could give it zero. All it's good for anymore is Netflix.  It doesnt work with my HULU or YOUTUBE, it doesnt do direct connect with mirror image.  It's a freaking black soda can!!!!! DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE ITS WORTHLESS

Title: Not as described
Comment: I bought this product because for a outside viewing of movies for my kids and there friends. the screen in the advertisement shows the size to be much bigger than it actually is. The remote is garbage. only good to turn the volume up and down. The app doesn't help much either. Takes forever. cant scroll up and down to look at titles in apps such as Netflix. so you better know what to type in when looking for a movie. and everything has to be downloaded. I was under the impression if if was on your phone you could watch it right on your projector. Nope.

Title: It’s is a toy
Comment: Think of this more a novelty toy. I bought this for my basement and even in the pitch black the image is pretty dim and grainy(and very low resolution!) and the speaker is pretty bad. Thankfully you can Bluetooth to another speaker quite easily. But it is fun for taking out and using in places you might not be able to have a screen- ie we did karaoke in out backyard. The pictures are pretty deceptive on how well it actually preforms

Title: Very dim
Comment: Some pros:- built in wifi and smart functions- variety of options- auto keystone (only vertical thou.)The big con:The brightness is a lot dimmer than I expected. I keep my room fairly dark. Only light sources in my room are: a desk lamp and reflected LED light from bookcase. And I could not see the image clearly. It was heavily faded even in the stated condition above.Unless you're willing to use this only in a complete dark room, this is not it. Keep looking.

Title: Stops working after about a year
Comment: Worked fine for about a year, but started getting power issues until it just kept turning off and didn't turn on at all. Contacted company and cause it was over a year old they won't help in replacing or  getting a discount to get a new one...save your money. Not worth it.

Title: Not very bright, but good in dark room
Comment: I was a little disappointed in this projector, but I will keep it.Cons:1) Picture isn't very bright. It's really only viewable in a dark room.2) No ability to change picture size. It's completely dependent on the distance between the projector and the screen.3) Haven't been able to get Hulu app to work on projector.Pros1) Nice little form factor2) Decent (but not awesome) sound.3) Very cool to have apps directly on the projector (like netflix)4) Can run plugged in or on batteries.

Title: High hopes, but disappointed. Limiting hardware and software.
Comment: What’s the point of “portable” if you need wifi to watch Netflix? I was hoping to take it camping, far away from wifi.Airplay works, but is very limited,  streaming from mobile device is simply not allowed when watching “copyrighted content”. Again, what’s  the point of having airplay without the ability to cast from Netflix, Hulu, etc.Speaker quality is sub par. If you pair it with another speaker via Bluetooth, there’s a judge lag. Not worth it.Returning it.

Title: Not good enough
Comment: - Remote control doesn’t work.- The software is uber clunky.- Arrived already opened, battery and lense protectors had been removed.- The focus adjustment wheel has 5% helpful area of movement, and the other 95% range of motion is useless. You essentially cannot fine tune the focus of the image.

Title: Solid performance, limited apps
Comment: Limited options in terms of apps. Projector performs well, but it would it would be better if it supported a wider range of streaming apps. If you want to rent movies, you're mainly stuck with Amazon. It would be great to be able to have HBO Max and Vudu. I also could not get Youtube TV to work.Picture could be brighter, otherwise good.

Title: Limited capabilities
Comment: I can't get it to connect to any HDMI I plug into it. I really want to use it for my Switch. I knew it would be a long shot to use HDMI to USB C for my phone, which also won't cast the screen to it. There are comments/reviews that I say I need to contact Anker and get the code to upgrade to full Android, but can find that. Netflix, YouTube, and Amazon all work for video though.

Title: Not Happy
Comment: Couple things:1. This is NOT bright enough to be used outside.2. I cannot get the APP to work on my phone.3. The remote included doesn't work with all included APPs such as Netflix.and4. I saw this on Prime Day Deal for $237, down 32% from the List of $349; however, I previously bought it for $249. It is a false deal. Disappointed.

Title: Okay...but photos are deceiving
Comment: So we tried the Nebula Capsule...first off, the picture on the box shows the projector being used on a rug.  When you read the instructions, it tells you NOT to put it on a rug!  The quality is okay...it definitely needs to be very dark, and the screen quality is meh.  Sound is okay, but not great.  The nice thing is that it's not super loud like normal projectors.  Because we won't be using it much and the quality was okay, we returned it.

Title: Bad picture quality, not bright, grainy at times
Comment: The only thing this gets to stars for is the size it literally is the size of a soda can. The remote will physically not work when this is connected to your iPhone so i deem it useless.The brightness does not deliver even when a room is pitch black, The picture is grainy, sometimes a few large pixels appears but disappear on its own. Outdated apps. Also, this is advertised as 200 ANSI lumen, but it’s probably really in 100 - maybe 140 if I’m being generous. And the fan sound is very loud.Worth the value for the quality? Absolutely not. Will be returning.

Title: Really expensive for what it does...plus no way to fix a crooked projection.
Comment: I liked the convenience of this device, but I think it's pretty pricey for something that I have to use an HDMI cord and adapter to project Power Point presentations from my Macbook.  I really hoped it had a more "streamlined" (ie. wireless) ability to do this, but it appears there isn't.  It's cool that you can use it like a smart TV or Firestick with apps, etc., but that's not why I bought it.  ALSO the projection is crooked and there is NO way to fix this except to prop it up with some paper or a few tissues!  So frustrating!  Overall, I'm glad I bought it, but I'm not entirely happy with the ease or quality of the product.

Title: It’s perfect and Disappointing
Comment: Quality is great, but screen play does not work. Screen mirror does not work. And the hdmi adapter does not work with phones. So you can only plug it into a tv. I wish it worked with the cords. Remote control does not work. You need to use your phone, and I live off grid, I don’t have my phone charged to use the remote. Smh

Title: Picture function and small size is impressive
Comment: Loved the size and quality of the picture.  I wanted to massively like this projector but the remote and need to activate Netflix and other apps via my phone was a very poor experience.  It seemed like I would need to spend 10 minutes to get it up and running every time we wanted to use it.  Not an easy click it on and watch device.  I finally returned it to Amazon.  I would seriously be interested in the future if they fine tune this interface issue.  Unless you are really good with gadgets, which half my family is not, this is not a good choice at this time.

Title: Mediocre purchase
Comment: I like it so far. Surprised it auto adjusted when the angle changed. Hard remote didnt work for Netflix though.Update 2019 06 02Netflix phone remote is trash, most likely gonna return this after I move.Update 2019 06 10Figured out how to use the phone controller app. Still sorta annoying, hoping they will come up with an update to fix the remote that comes with the projector.

Title: the advertising page was misleading
Comment: According to the advertising pages, this device should be able to be a wireless display for a Windows PC.  No, it cannot.  It can work as a AirPlay display for iPhone/iPad/Mac or as a screencast display for Android devices.  It is not a wireless display for PC.

Title: Limited Streaming
Comment: It's... ok. I wasn't looking for just ok, though. The portability is great, but that is the best part. The app allowing you to control the projector from your smartphone is also pretty cool, and the device is just sort of cool. Those are the pros.My problem with the Nebula Capsule is that the streaming options are disappointingly limited. All I want to do is stream my desktop, for example, and there is no way to do this wirelessly. I had thought there would be. Thus, my expectations were defeated. I had a vision for how I would be able to conduct presentations for customers, and now I have this HDMI trip wire tethered to my brand new laptop, constantly under foot and in the way.Additionally, the "app store" is loaded up with useless, third-rate garbage apps. Tons of garbage. Nothing I personally want to use. Sorry, I don't need Romanian soccer streaming, nor do I need a YouTube app that feels like Soviet bloc  YouTubeski.I'll make it work, and it will be fine for me. But compared to what it could be - and thinking that it probably isn't that far away from what it could be, yet just isn't there - it's just not.

Title: It’s shocking what a mess this is
Comment: I will update and list the ways in which this thing is terrible but most of all the nebular app is usable but also the key to using Netflix Amazon etc. just logging into Netflix and Amazon was a 45 minute chore. And you can’t  sign into YouTube. You get some generic version of the “best of YouTube“

Title: Terrible for Netflix!
Comment: I bought this thing for netflix and was very disappointed you cannot screen mirror with anything except youtube.  The netflix program on the the unit itself is extremely slow when trying to navigate.  I gave up waiting for the iphone remote (required) to even respond on down scrolling.Buyer beware if u want this for any video service streaming!

Title: Poor quality, broken in four months.
Comment: Within the first month of use, whenever a darker scene was being displayed, the picture went black with just a few blue highlights on some of the picture so that you could maybe make out a face or something moving on screen. Then within four months the speaker blew and now crackles. Without an audio output it has rendered the projector useless. I would have expected a bit better quality for the money. The remote is also awkward and for streaming, you must use an app on your phone to navigate. Not all apps are available through wifi. You must use an hdmi cable to get several streaming services through a phone or other device.

Title: Just okay better spend little more buy good one
Comment: The quality of picture is just okay/not bad ( i am not saying it is good). The brightness is bad. But i think this is what one would get for this price.Good part - It is really small and can take and project anywhere indoor. Preinstalled movie apps good.

Title: Time To Return This Junk- Not iPHONE Friendly
Comment: What good is it to list out the Pros and Cons, if the #1 reason why I purchased the Capsule was to wirelessly stream photos/videos from my iPhone. I tried for 3 days, upgraded software, researched online, and still cannot connect wirelessly. Nice try, Anker.

Title: It is not bright enough for use
Comment: This product does not live up to its hype. They have changed the description concerning the lumens to be a little more truthful. It is not bright enough for any of the uses we bought it for and when I tried to return it, they rejected my request saying it was over 30 days from date of purchase. I guess they go by the date purchased, not the date delivered. I am very unhappy with this company.

Title: Me gusta pero...
Comment: Me gusta bastante, tiene buena calidad la proyección, buen volumen del parlante incorporado, pero la batería no es buena, y pese a que se lo tenga conectado igual se descarga y apaga... con batería al 100% y conectado no paso de 4 horas antes que se apague

Title: Seriously?
Comment: It’s awesome that it’s small and has built in speakers...But it won’t support any apps- not even Netflix. Says have to use Airplay if you have an iPad or iPhone- fine...Won’t play copyrighted content unless you’re hardwired.This made it sound super easy but it seems really out of date with a lot of extra steps. Not the convenience I wanted in a travel projector.

Title: Great idea but not carried out to its fullest potential by far!
Comment: I was very excited to finally get this product because I expected to be able to use it more easily than my larger projectors. I am quite satisfied as to how fast the pairing and setup went.  It is bright enough for most of my needs and of course small enough to take with me. I must say that up to the present I have been disappointed in the Youtube app.  I cannot "sign in" with my account apparently and thus cannot use my play lists. Therefore it becomes a burden to have to key in every video individually when I am trying to run a smooth program without stops.  Also the mirroring has been a real challenge with lag and breaking off between youtube videos.  I'm trying to rectify this by using the HDMI cable method and it works fine from my computer, but I am still looking for a toggle for my iPhone and iPad to accept HDMI.  Further, the device only plays a few kinds of video from my USB.  I'm still looking into android apps that will take and play the .mov, etc extensions. A bit disappointing I must say.

Title: Disappointed beyond words
Comment: Worst nightmare realized through this projector.  Purchased this to watch a video I made for my mom’s 75th birthday dinner party and learned after 2 days of troubleshooting there is no way to play a video and have Bluetooth sound system work together.  Now it’s past midnight and too late for other options.  I’ll not get to show the video I paid $150 to produce now.  YouTube is not an option in this case.  Super disappointed!!!

Title: Does not work with iPhone
Comment: Even if you have subscriptions to streaming platforms, this projector wont let you play them. I tried direct lightning-hdmi, Bluetooth and Apple play. Very disappointed.

Title: This product needs to be cheapier.
Comment: This product would have been good at a below $100 dollar price tag. It was functional but as soon as I figured out that a lot of my streaming services were either incompatible or not supported. It just became an expensive laptop projector. Hopefully they fixed the issues on the new version, but i will not spend the current asking price for the latest version.thanks! just my two cents. :)

Title: Was a fan of Anker until purchasing this piece of junk
Comment: Charged the battery to full, went to login to wifi, it instantly launches a browser. Well... you can't exit the browser. If you turn off the device and turn it back on there's that f-ing browser again. In the process of getting a refund.

Title: Difficult to navigate in any mode
Comment: This is my first projector but I found it very difficult navigation.  Some areas like YouTube for example, cannot be navigated in all areas and cannot do many actions like pausing.  App is very bad, very limited.  Also not very intuitive.  Difficult to set anything up.

Title: Very loud.
Comment: I liked it from the first minute but was disappointed later. The image is ok, Sound is good. The form is interesting.Control and fan killed it. Fan starts spinning immediately and its very loud. I thought that I will get used to it but after a couple of weeks, it's still very annoying. Control is not very obvious and you need remote control always!

Title: Works well as a projector, App is pretty bad for an otherwise polished product
Comment: the projector feels solid and has a good quality out of the box. The picture quaility is good to great for the size.CONS:remote does not light up. Way more annoying than you would expect but since it needs to be totally dark , its difficult to use.the interface is pretty shit. considering the price point and the overall build quality , I expected much better

Title: Speaker Isn't Good
Comment: I was pleasantly surprised when I came across this little speaker/projector. I had been looking for a good bluetooth speaker from Anker. I have two other Anker products and they are awesome. Unfortunately, for as great as the projector is - the audio is pretty bad. The sound is dull and tinny - no bass and no depth. So when you're watching a good movie or video, the sound quality doesn't match the functionality of the projector and it's a less than average speaker for audio only functions. I'm returning mine in hopes that the next version of the Capsule has better sound quality. That would make this one of the best portable projector/Bluetooth speaker combos on the market. It's just not there yet.

Title: Compact disappointment
Comment: The projector is compact and simple to connect (hard wire) to a Blu-ray or DVD.It cannot be used when there is any day light (must be dark). Some reviews state it can be used in low light, however, I was unable to see the movie at dusk.As far as using with an app, the included remote will not work. You must download the Nubula app. I attempted several times to get the projector to connect with the app with no luck. Online support is fair at best.

Title: Need COMPLETE darkness
Comment: I bought this as a teaching device to show power point presentations to my class. It is now one of the most expensive paperweights on my desk

Title: Just OK
Comment: Wanted to love this product however we have had a really hard time with it. The lumens aren’t enough to see until it’s super dark outside which in the summer can be tough. It’s also a pain to deal with the apps. We ended up having to attach a fire stick to make it work.

Title: Problem with overheating within minutes of turning on
Comment: This product worked well and about a month ago I keep getting a message that says it must be turned because it is overheating. This happens within minutes of putting it on.I charge it and unplug, I sometimes don't run it for a couple of days but it keeps overheating and would cut off shortly after that message.

Title: Over all great product, looking into why it glitches so much.
Comment: I love how this is mobile, small and can be used without being plugged in. Small fan not too loud. Brightness is low and you mostly have to be in a dark room or watch at night. I can see really clear a couple feet away. Main issue is it’s glitchy and crashes out of no where, even if it’s charged. One it turns off I can’t turn it back on. Tried to hold down all buttons, held down power for a while.

Title: Mini Projector Mini Issues
Comment: I like it, the issues I have are 1.) It seems to keep cutting off after playing for a bit, before a movie ends and while charged. 2.) The picture adjustment doesnt come very sharp, is close enough but the picture on the wall or screen is sometimes not in rectangular focus, sometimes is oddly shaped

Title: Does not work
Comment: I bought this over a year ago and never was able to use it wirelessly. The OS just never worked and never would update, after multiple tries on several different wifi networks. Now, I can't even use it on HDMI because it won't hold a charge. Of course, now it's too late to return the product so I apparently threw away $300 for something I got maybe 1 hour of use out of over the last year. Garbage.

Title: Missing pieces
Comment: No remote... came with box for it but was empty

Title: Defective Unit
Comment: Received a defective unit. Mine doesn’t charge while powered on, and I’ve tried improved power cords also. I thought it was supposed to be like that so I suffered in silence, but recently found out that is not the case. Wish I would’ve returned it when I could’ve gotten a refund. Portability is great, but not when the battery runs out.

Title: Don’t waste your time if this is a family purchase.
Comment: Barely workable as a media projector for the family.  The remote doesn’t work with many of the apps and it requires a smart phone app to control it.  That doesn’t make it very family friendly for most folks.Customer service was rude.  We decided to try the capsule 2 and that one didn’t fix any of the issues.We sent them both back.

Title: Too dark
Comment: Handy dandy cute invention. Quite portable but not bright enough. Fan noise in the unit as expected.The next model addressed the brightness issue but hella pricey.

Title: Not worth the expensive price
Comment: This projector is decent,  but for the price I paid I expected more. For the most part it worked fine, picture was decent, sound good, etc… but the OS was really out of date and didn’t make it as user friendly as it should. Watching Netflix is difficult. The remote only works like a mouse for certain apps making navigating a hassle.
