Some apps I couldn’t even get the remote to work on and had to use the subpar phone app. It is all just okay, but for 300 bucks I wanted more.

Title: Received repackaged item still connected to previous users accounts. Returning.
Comment: Purchased new from Amazon. Wasn’t new. Item was out of original packaging. When I powered it up, it was still connected to the previous owners apps like Netflix. Contacted Anker Direct who simply forwarded me to Amazon. Will be returning. For what it’s worth, it’s extremely portable and has a decent speaker. That was about the only positives from this entire experience.

Title: portable but not highest sound or image quality
Comment: not very bright, hard to see when light is already dimmed, speaker on the projector is pretty bad quality, remote control on the phone has trouble connecting a lot of times.It's very small and portable and pretty easy to use, for this price it's reasonable, but that's it, I would rather pay a little more and deal with a bigger projector body that is brighter and has better sound quality.

Title: The update that  couldn't wait.
Comment: So, you have some friends over to watch a movie.  Right in the middle of it a message pops up telling you that you must restart device and install update.  Why would they think this is OK?  Update took a bit of time, and movie night ended abruptly thanks to the update that just could not wait.

Title: It’s alright
Comment: I was looking for a device that did not have to be centered but this one most definitely does, I have ordered two of these and the picture is always slanted never perfect I have to prop things under it to level out the display, overall I’d give it a 6 App Store is super limited as well sound is good picture quality is good. I found it difficult to watch this projector during the day. This projector works well in a room that is at least 75% dark. Light kills the picture. the smart features on it are cool, however I don’t think it was worth how much it cost. Ive recently sent mine back And ordered a new one.

Title: It's alright
Comment: It's a good starter projector.  It's easy to use and set up. But if you're tech saavy - this really isn't for you. The projector uses an old android system. We ended up returning it.

Title: Amazing and Nifty but it's always tilted
Comment: Think this is a amazing concept, great for travel, amazing picture and can be used in many different locations.  However on a level surface the screen is always crooked.  I guess something with the bottom rubber piece which is glued incorrectly but no matter the surface I watch something it's always crooked to the right.  I would rate it more stars if it was so lopsided.  Guess I always have to carry quarters to keep it leveled.

Title: Ok for poolside, but obviously needs complete dark to be enjoyable.
Comment: It's ok. The fact that it's portable and have good speakers make it a great niche product, but that's what it is, niche. It's not for everyone and everywhere. It really needs to be completely dark to be able to see anything, and the resolution cap is what it is. It’s good for what it is and if you know what you are getting. I’m left a bit disappointed on its capabilities/price ratio.

Title: Crashes - Draw of the luck
Comment: So I read a review saying when they received their projector, it crashed every 10-30 minutes. Mine does the same thing. I understand there's a year warranty, but I would hate to use mine over something that I couldn't help whenn I received it. Other than that, i would love a new projector but lost the warranty card and return opp from Amazon because I wanted to give it some time to see if it would continue to crash or if I ran into any other errors. Not sure what to do.

Title: It was okay..
Comment: It was an alright projector and now it won’t even charge or turn on anymore, it just tries to power on and powers right off with it plugged in. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. —barely even used it—

Title: Not Worth the Money, Just Novel
Comment: It’s unintuitive to use, dim, and the battery life is nowhere near 4 hours. Closer to 1.5 if you actually want the brightness up, and 3 if you don’t mind it being dim. The software is hard to navigate and clunky, the little “can” shape is prone to falling/being knocked over, and the overall quality is comparable to a $100 projector.

Title: Battery drains while off, more so
Comment: Battery drains while off, more so than expected.  Battery life is so so while in use.  But the pros while in use outweigh the cons.  Thus 3 stars. Give it a try.

Title: This would be great if it wasn’t so terrible!
Comment: It would be so perfect if it wasn’t so useless. If you are looking for a beautiful picture, a simple interface,  unparalleled portability, and have no use for audio, this is for you.  The “sound” quality ranges from terrible, to incomprehensible, to nonexistent.  Customer Support did not even attempt to rectify my concerns.  I returned it.  Avoid.

Title: Would not recommend! Did not work out of box!
Too dim
Comment: Returned item. Would be great if you were in a really dark room and using it as about a 20 inch tv. Features are nice with netflix and all the apps. Speaker leaves a lot of room for improvement.. definitely not the party bumping sound they show in the advertisement. Not a bad thing product but didn’t work for what I needed it for

Title: Very disappointed
Comment: Really wanted to love it. But I can’t actually use it. Won’t screen play from my iPhone. I’ve connected it via Bluetooth and my phone and nebula are connected to the same WiFi network. The remote control is wonky (both the remote and app on the phone). I can’t actually select anything I want to watch on it.I tried so hard and really wanted to love it. The picture is great but I legit cannot use it for anything which is kinda lame

Title: Amazing product! I think I got a used product or the product was damaged on the way to me.
Comment: Amazing product!I think I got a used product or the product was damaged on the way to me.Certain parts of the product wasnt where they were suppose to be.Speaker and image quality is amazing. Not much bass but totally understandable for such a small device with a projector.

Title: Lack Quality features for Gamers
Comment: The projector is great and very compact. But for specifically having a home Theater it isn’t the best. When connected to my xbox one the sound has about a 3 second lag compared to the visuals. I have to wear headphones to play. The visual quality gets frustrating at times, I am definitely getting another projector with better resolution. Nice projector but far from perfect.

Title: Not Worth It
Comment: Not worth the price. Quality was very dark and hard to focus. Even in completely dark room. Will be returning.

Title: Short Life Span
Comment: I can’t believe I bought this two years ago, used it maybe 3 dozen times and now the damn thing won’t hold a charge. It charges but only projects for 38 mins before dying. As far as design goes, it’s incredible, but the quality of everything else is garbage. I would say you get what you pay for but this thing was $300. I will not be buying another Anker projector.

Title: Crooked screen
Comment: Unfortunately, my nebula showed up with a crooked screen placement. It’s as if it slipped and got stuck in an offset angle. That said, I ALWAYS need to prop one sideOf the device up with a few sheets of paper when using which makes it really annoying to use on the go! I contacted manufacturer, heard nothing back!

Title: Mixed feelings on it
Comment: I like this device a lit but it sometimes is awkward hooking the thing to iOS and other devices. Takes 2 or three tries sometimes. It gets frustrating and I just go back to using my old trusty projector.

Title: Need to have certain conditions
Comment: The sound and focus / crispness of the pictures are great- its very hard to see the projection if the conference room lights are one- almost need total darkness for everyone to see.For the price I expected more. Apps also make it fun to use.

Title: Useless for streaming (while using external bluetooth speaker) ... anything (sort of, see update)
Comment: Update II:I exchanged the unit in the hope that the new one would behave better with respect to simultaneous streaming and bluetooth connection to an external speaker. No dice, unfortunately. The problem still exists , sadly. This has nothing to do with the available wireless bandwidth as far as I can tell. The Capsule is connected to a 5GHz wireless-N network which provides 30-40 Mbps at the location of the machine; measured using speedtest.net on an iPhone 5S. Furthermore, the internal battery lasts about 2 hours, most definitely not 4 when playing video, and that's on the 'dim' screen setting. Funny enough, even when it is plugged into the wall, the battery keeps draining when watching a video and using the internal speaker. This was definitely unexpected and reminds me of old Android phones that weren't able to charge while using the GPS due to that component's current draw. You'd hope that a projector would run indefinitely when plugged in ... not so much. So, back to 3 stars.Update:I am adding a star (and a half, 3.5 starts total) based on customer service and the fact that I was able to isolate what looks like a firmware bug. The streaming (Netflix, Amazon Prime, YouTube) problems described below only occur when the box is connected to an external bluetooth speaker or headphone set; no problems using the HDMI port, or playing files from storage attached via USB. This is a bummer, of course, since bluettoth connectivity is able to sidestep the small speaker built into the unit. It's a 100% reproducible bug; I used an Anker Premium Stereo Speaker and Anker Soundbuds to test this, so all three being from the same company, there shouldn't be compatibility issues, you'd think. Let's see if Anker engineers can figure this one out. We do like the Nebula, so here's to hoping that this issue can be fixed.Original Review:Let me start with the good. The device is well made and feels very solid. Great packaging as well, for those who care;-) It is ultra portable, has an HDMI input, can mirror the screen of your iPhone (either via HDMI or AirPlay, the latter shows some lag, so no good for gaming), and plays video from a USB-connected storage device. Since it is based on Android and has built-in WiFi and Bluetooth, it can run applications, such as those used to stream video content either from a local server or the internet (Netflix, Amazon Prime, YouTube, Plex). With its built-in rechargeable battery and speaker, it is really something I could see myself bringing on a trip. While the built-in speaker isn't anything to write home about, it will keep the kids happy enough; a nice feature is the ability to connect an external Bluetooth speaker or headphones (see firmware bug described in the update).Sadly, not all is well at this point.First thing after receiving the Nebula was installing Netflix, Amazon Video, Youtube, and Plex after upgrading to the latest firmware version. Despite the Nebula being placed in the same room as the WiFi router, which is connected via a high-speed cable modem to the internet, streaming failed within 60 seconds for all of the above-listed apps; I tried clearing the cache and also rebooted the device, no improvement. I imagine that this has something to do with the buffering algorithm. I even lowered the streaming quality within the Amazon Video app, and it still didn’t change the behavior.I should mention that streaming to a Roku, a FireTV Stick, iPads, and iPhones never results in buffer problems despite those devices being located nowhere near the WiFi router. I didn't find an option to manually enter a DNS address to see if that might help.Needless to say that one of the key features of the device is the ability to operate it in a portable / standalone fashion. If none of the streaming services work, not even streaming DVD-quality video (not HD) from a local server using Plex, what's the point?I reported the problem to Anker and hope to hear back from them shortly. We have several Bluetooth speakers from Anker which we are very happy with, and I have had a good customer service experience with Anker in the past, which was one of the reasons why I went with the Nebula. I am keeping my fingers crossed that this can be resolved since the product has a lot of potential.

Title: Not very bright
Comment: Not as good as the reviews and ad says, can't see it in a day lit room

Title: Inside of projector screen came with a scratch
Comment: Inside of projector screen came with a scratch, no longer in stock so my only option is return or keep defective item. Solid options for ~$300 item!

Title: Not for iPhone
Comment: Could have mentioned the item is meant for Android devices and doesn’t really work with iPhone or iPad very well at all.

Title: Not compatible with Android or Windows
Comment: Is this worth the price? No.The device has instructions top connect with windows and android phones wirelessly but it is not compatible with either. You will have to use an HDMI cord to screen mirror. Luckily, the apps are decent enough.The speaker system isn't as good as I hoped. This isn't exactly a lemon buy but it's still a bit tart. Will it do all the cool stuff advertised? No. But for a basic portable projection system, it'll do.

Title: Good picture quality, but hard to use with phone
Comment: This is such a disappointment. It already comes equipped to play Netflix and that works fine and the picture quality is really great. However, if you want to attach it to your phone to project something, so difficult and not intuitive.  You need to order a separate attachment to make it work with your phone and that was the only reason I bought this. Kinda lame.

Title: Don't waste your money on this projector.
Comment: Poor sound and quality image. You can get a 10 times better product for this price. It's very annoying to watch a movie  with such a low bright image and pixeled. Battery doesn't long that much either. The only positive thing is its portability.

Title: Can’t stream without WiFi
Comment: Why have a portable projector you can’t use unless you’re connected to a wifi network? It would be great if you use it to stream and cast from your phone but it just doesn’t work like that

Title: Nothing works.
Comment: Remote doesn't work. Does not project onto a ceiling as the picture shows, you need to buy a special stand or create some sort of ghetto-rig to hold it in place. Software is utter garbage. Not worth half the price. I sincerely wish ill on those who designed this piece of trash.

Title: Heading in the right direction... but still needs improvement.
Comment: Pro: Excellent product design. High quality materials. Light weight  & portability.  High screen video quality. Works great to screen mirror from your phone without WiFi!!!!Con: Fan noise from projector. Screen slants to the side... I don't like that.  Returning.

Title: Seems tiny and simple, but is fussy and meh.
Comment: My coworker got one of these. Really talked it up. I bought one and was disappointed. It was fussy to set up, and kept weirdly wonking between “mouse” and “controller” during set up. But the kicker was after two nights of use, right in the middle of a movie, it blanked out the screen and said “update available” with only one button to update now. No postponing. Just update now. No going back to the movie. Just update.This thing is just too fussy pants for me.

Title: Can’t watch Youtube nor Prime!
Comment: The UI is terrible. The remote app is also terrible. I can’t watch Youtube nor Prime Video.Projector itself is not bad but do not expect quality picture. The room has to be pretty dark to see picture clearly. Speakers are slightly more preferable than my iPhone speakers. Also battery does not last long. Can not get through an entire movie without getting a 20% warning screen.

Title: No lo recomiendo
Comment: No se por que tiene buenas reputaciones, la verdad compre por las reputaciones pero no me gusto para nada, lo unico medianamente bueno es el sonido. Para poder ver algo la habitacion debe estar 100% a oscuras, con un poco de luz ya no se ve nada y la calidad de imagen es mala. Para posicionarlo debe estar super alineado a la pared porque no tien mucho margen de configuracion y tampoco viene con tripode. no lo recomiendo para nada.

Title: Maybe good for home, not for business though
Comment: Not bright enough for our commercial use.  Returned and bought a different one, larger and brighter, but also less expensive

Title: Just not as good as expected
Comment: The interface of the system is not user friendly. The picture quality is truly lackluster. It’s cute and convenient but just not great in terms of quality.

Title: Brightness sucks and apps are meh.
Comment: The concept is cool as in its portable and convenient but for the price, it’s not really worth it. The brightness is crummy and the apps are hit and miss. Mostly miss. They don’t work or load and have small selection that actually work. Meh.

Title: Just didn’t work...
Comment: Couldn’t get YouTube to work.Hdmi didn’t workUpdated firmware and I kept getting a window that read, I need to update the firmware.Put in a request for support, they asked me to send a video of the problems.Really disappointed!  Love the design!  Just didn’t work

Title: Very cool concept and works amazingly well in a dark room
Comment: Very cool concept and works amazingly well in a dark room.  Extremely easy to use also.  I ultimately returned the product because my use did not align with the strengths of the product (I.e. picture was not to my standards for a room that had some light.)

Title: Small Movie projector
Comment: Pros: Small enough to take it any where with youCons: Low video quality and poor sound quality of speaker.

Title: OS was terrible
Comment: Great size and brightness (which is the reason for 2 stars instead of 1) but I had incredible trouble with the operating system. Nothing would play! Literally nothing. I had to return because it just didn’t work. It would send me to the google play store but that didn’t work either.

Title: Does not last long
Comment: This stopped working 13 months into use so I would not recommend buying.  While it worked, the sound quality was good for its size, picture quality and brightness was ok for a portable projector.  I did not use this heavily; at max, 5 hours per week and always indoors.  The device stopped taking a charge 13 months in and since it's a month past warranty, there is no solution to fix.  I would recommend not wasting your money on something that lasts approximately a year.

Title: Movie Apps constantly crash
Comment: The picture and sound are very good. The issue is the apps constantly crashes with the majority of the apps (Disney, Netflix etc) therefore making the item useless.

Title: Terrible
Comment: I am so upset, I noticed I revived a used/ return one because the remote is missing and the lens is scratched.

Title: Projector only works with apps that come with projector.
Comment: This projector will only work with the apps that it comes with which means you have to subscribe to Netflix, etc. and pay the monthly fee.  Will not work with other movies apps on your phone.  This was the only downfall as I have movie apps on my phone that I cannot use with this projector.

Title: Good projector and battery life but mirror cast wouldn't work
Comment: The projector was great and very easy to use.  Returned it after 3 weeks, was in talks with the company could not get my S9 to Mirror cast which was mainly why I bought it.

Title: Three Stars
Comment: CPU fan or the inside fan is too loud. Also, it does not support Google Play...

Title: Good but eh
Comment: Works very well but doesn’t hold charge very long, you can’t charge it while you’re using it, and half of the streaming apps don’t work

Title: Good product, not excellent
Comment: It’s an okay product for how expensive it is. I wish it could be brighter, the pixelation was better and the remove had a much better range capacity

Title: Item broke after a few months
Comment: Quality of image not too sharp. Acceptable. Price is not competitive either. It stopped working after 5 months of use.

Title: DONT BUY IT
Comment: This this is TRASH - the batter sucks. Doesn’t charge while in use. Also doesn’t charge while plugged up. I haven’t gotten the battery life over 16 since I opened it. It’s too late for me to return. TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY DONT RECOMMEND

Title: Still it is not bright enough if you are not in a complete dark room
Comment: I do not recommend to purchase this product yet till they develope the brightness more than 600 ANSI LUMEN?

Title: not good
Comment: Bought this to use for senior management meetings and various other things.  What a waste of money.  The clarity is horrible, no use in trying to run a training session utilizing this as no one is able to read the print on the screen (too blurry).  if you are buying this to watch movies on, no problem.  But for my purpose, a total waste of money.  I do not recommend this product, I wish I had taken it out of the box sooner so I could return it.

Title: Poor on brightly lit rooms
Comment: Great Concept. I bought and used on darker rooms.  It was good.  Later on, I had to use to on lightly lit rooms and was not happy with the brightness and picture quality.  Returned it.

Title: Still not ready for prime time...
Comment: For its size and cost, brightness and picture quality are excellent. The remote and apps however are horrible. Flaky and difficult to use. The software to run the projector is far from useful.

Title: Poor Picture Quality
Comment: Not that great picture quality.

Title: Not worth the hype or the money
Comment: Remote doesn't work, picture doesn't focus fully and one side of the picture is bigger. Not worth the money!

Title: It did not recognize HDMI input.
Comment: Tried three different HDMI cords. Projector would not recognize the HDMI input. Returned product and will look for a similar product from another brand.

Title: The bluetooth has a delay with speaker
Comment: The bluetooth has a delay with speaker. The sound is delayed behind the movie. It's a waste of money. I bought the item so I can use bluetooth speaker. It syncs to bluetooth speaker but there is a delay and therefore cant use speaker and sound is not good without the speaker.

Title: Not a sturdy product
Comment: After less than a year, the project screen cracked for no reason

Title: not good
Comment: It is joke product  maybe because it is not expensive

Title: Disappointed in nebula
Comment: So disappointed. I didn’t use it til the return period was over. Remote control was a D. Picture blurry and gray. Not enough apps loaded.

Title: Streaming apps don’t work
Comment: I love it, BUT none of the streaming apps work. They let me log in but then never show movies or anything. And I can’t even use screen mirror for a replacement because of “copyrights” even though I’m still streaming through apps on my phone.

Title: Nebula
Comment: The nebula is supposed to be work without WiFi.  It is not working alone with the HDMI chord and I thought the picture would be brighter.

Title: Remote Control Issue
Comment: I've been using the product for the past 4 weeks. At first, everything worked fine, but about one or two weeks in, the remote control started to malfunction. When I try to press on a button, it clicks multiple times and doesn't work as intended. Also, since the remote power button doesn't work, I have to get up every single time to turn it on, which is a minor inconvenience still nonetheless very annoying.

Title: iPhone user be aware - Softwares won’t work
Comment: I bought this to pair w my iPhone to watch Crunchyroll, YouTube, Netflix Hulu, etc...  The software doesn’t work at all. And I can’t even mirror screen.  This is awful product, please don’t buy.

Title: Avoid
Comment: Broken remote, app crashes. Doesn’t have any options for YouTube tv, hbo, etc

Title: Awesome, except it’s breaking 8 months in
Comment: I really love how portable and accessible this is. It’s awesome. However, it’s been 8 months since I bought it, and I treat it with care, but the charging port is loose and only works sometimes. I definitely think the product should be better quality, unless this is a fluke. Who should I contact?

Title: Sound Output volume is it's biggest issue - Not loud enough for outdoor usage
Comment: The Nebula is a very nice projector but I ended up sending it back. I have owned a regular projector for years and play movies via HDMI and output via headphone jack into a tiny amp with a few speakers.Nebula only has HDMI in and Bluetooth audio out. normally this would be fine, for example for bluetooth headphones for a single person or if you watch movies with Nebula right next to your head.If you use this outside - even with 2 Bluetooth speakers in paired mode (JBL for example, which I tried), it still is not loud enough.I even purchased a bluetooth amp (2 of them) on Amazon and the sound was still not loud enough.The max volume output by Nebula is not enough - and possibly a limit with Bluetooth as well.I had to go back to my old setup because I mainly project outside during summer and I can crank the 2 small speakers and mini amp as loud as I want.Anyway, if you are using this 100% indoors and in a somewhat small space, volume will be no issue.One last thing - PLEX does not really work from what I could tell, on 5Ghz network - right next to the AP, and PLEX on a powerful desktop, it would still error out due to the conversion / transcoding and give a "server not powerful enough" error.Was not a huge deal, but if you are buying for Plex just be aware it most likely will not work.

Title: Not Bright Enough
Comment: It did not have light power or brightness for a moderately lit room at about 6 feet from screen.

Title: It can do everything but is not good at anything.
Comment: It is an all in one package. I purchased on sale for 250 and returned. The speakers are poor, the display is pixelated and dim. The interface is nice, however, the youtube app is junk. and it will not cast.

Title: Not able to login to YouTube.
Comment: I am giving 3 stars because I am not able to login to YouTube and I dont find HBO app to download. I loved the rest of the features but this things are annoying.

Title: Bad quality picture

Title: I really wanted keep this projector but it has a ...
Comment: I really wanted keep  this projector but it has a huge design flaw ... #1. No included micro sd card slot so if you want to play your own media internally you will have to use the included dongle  .The problem with that is  you can no longer  plug in any external power source to that port  .if your battery runs out while your in the middle of a movie or presentation loaded on the usb your out of luck. # 2 most 1080p videos i loaded lagged or froze up you might be able to get some 1080p videos to play via usb but the unit is picky on which encoding  you use ... so  use 720p videos  and you should be ok.#3 In order for you use it in bluetooth speaker mode you have to boot up the projector completely  to be able to switch to speaker mode.#4 Projector slightly  lacking in Brightness...  Hopefully anker will address these issues in the next revision.. i did have a dead pixel/stuck dlp mirror.(see attached Picture.) (update) when i restored the software to return the unit it seemed to have fixed the dead pixel issue .  This unit works well for people who want to stream media via plex/netflix etc.

Title: Sadly dissappointed yet simultaneously awed
Comment: I would have loved to say that I'm happy with this product and that it is what I expected.....but I would be lying. I AM DISSAPPOINTED.  I received my capsule yesterday and was so excited with my new mini-home-theater that I invited my mother over to watch a movie. After tinkering with the Capsule for 3 hours, and NOT being able to watch any movie at all, I'm sadly writing this review. I bought this product because I was tired of watching movies on my computer, so I figured this would be a great option. The possibility of being able to mirror the screen of my computer seemed to be just what I needed. To my sad surprise, the mirroring is terrible. Not delayed-terrible, but mostly not-working-at-all-terrible.So if mirroring is not an alternative, I'm stuck with YouTube and Netflix and the other video apps that I'm not interested in.After a while of trying, we figured we'd just watch some stuff in YouTube. My only remaining option for unpayed content.Additionally to the POOR MIRRORING, the remote control works poorly or not at all. It got stuck, sometimes responsive, sometimes non-responsive. As other reviewers have said, the good thing is that the capsule app offers a much more effective controlling experience than the remote. So the problems of the defective/unoperative/limited remote seem to be solved if using the capsule control app.So now some pros: image was really good, sound ok. Not great but good considering the size of this soda-can shaped device.Beautifully designed, amazing little device for its size. So portability-wise it can't be better. I felt awe to see this tiny thing project such a good image.I understand it's a work in progress and that we're fortunate to have in the market a pico proyector that includes sound.I'm now facing the dilemma if to return it or not. With no mirroring, it's kind of useless for me.I'm not a tech person, so maybe there is an adaptor or cable that I can use to connect the capsule to my computer/iPad/phone and have the screen of my devices protected onto the wall. If this exists, I'll keep it. I loved the experience of a tv sized image (or bigger) anywhere in my home.However if such cable or adapter doesn't exist, I'll return the capsule and find a cheaper projector that can do the job of blowing up my computer screen onto a wall-sized image.Regardless of my seemingly negative review, I'm still amazed st the size and quality of the hardware. It is really picket-size.Thank you.

Title: Software ruins the product
Comment: Cool little device but it is completely ruined by the cripled software.  If they had made the bootloader unlockable there would probably be a way to save it but they didn't.  The phone app is a bad knockoff of the Android TV remote app, the "Chromecast" support doesn't work on any of the 5 devices I tried it with. Without Google Play Services support any app that requires a google login will not work. Off to eBay it goes!

Title: Screencast Not Compatible With Google Pixel Phones
Comment: I wanted to write and warn anyone who is thinking about purchasing this with a Google Pixel phone, the screencast does not work.The Nebula Capsule uses Miracast, which is not compatible with Pixels. I discovered this through my own research, as when I reached out to tech support I was met with the unhelpful response of asking if I followed the instructions for screencasting in the manual (which they then gave me the iOS instructions, despite the fact I specified I am using a Google Pixel with Android 8.1). When I told tech support that my own research shows that Miracast doesn't work with Pixels they confirmed that if you have a Google Pixel running Android 7 or higher, it will not work. I saw through my research that you can potentially get it to work if you root your phone and edit the build.prop, but just want to let people know before hand.I am very disappointed that the incompatibility is not disclosed anywhere, as a Google Pixel is a fairly mainstream phone. I was also disappointed with the lackluster help I received from tech support. I feel that Nebula should be more forthcoming with the compatibility of their devices and ensure this is disclosed in the description and specs.Compatibility issues aside, the unit is pretty great for the price point. Sound and picture are nice (the bluetooth functionality and Netflix still work, just screencasting that doesn't on a Pixel), so anyone with a compatible phone should be fine.

Title: Nebula Capsule Review Updated!
Comment: My original review was based on receiving a used product.After speaking with Anker customer service I have to say that they went out of their way to try and resolve my issue, I wish all companies would work with their customers as well as Anker does.The product itself I only used for a very short time, and I will base my review on that.I loved the size of the unit, I was looking for something that could sit on a shelf when not in use and wouldn't take up a lot of space.While the lumens are not as high as some projectors, it was bright enough to see a clear picture in my darkened game room where it would have seen the majority of its use. The built in apps were an added bonus and I haven't seen other projectors with this extra functionality in this price range.Overall, if it was not for the unit having already been used I would have kept it and used it extensively.

Title: Not impressed - welcome to dongle life
Comment: I wanted to like the Nebula Capsule projector.  I really did ... the size and the speakers are delightful. To be fair, here is what I liked- small size- great sound (plenty loud enough)- able to install Amazon Prime Video and stream my movies over wifiHOWEVER, the Nebula Capsule has a number of issues that I can't stand.  For prospective buyers, you need to be aware of these problems:1. DIM PROJECTION --  If there is ANY ambient light, you will not be able to see the screen projected further than two feet. I can use it at night. Or in a bathroom with no windows. Or possibly camping under starlight. My kids can project onto a piece of paper a foot away.  At short range, the image looks great -- but what's the point when a tablet is the same size with better screen? I've used pico projectors years ago when they first came out, and expected the Nebula capsule to be brighter. It isn't.2. USB DONGLE LIFE -- I bought a 32gb (Fat32) USB flash drive to play back my movie collection. Unfortunately, the device ONLY has a micro-USB port so you have to use a dongle (included) to use USB flash drives.  Now my projector has a permanent rat's tail poking off the back. This looks dumb and you can't charge the device while using the USB dongle.3. REMOTE CONTROL REQUIRED -- This absolutely floored me.  I assumed I'd be able to control the device entirely with buttons on the projector.  Nope. You have to use the included remote control so you better not lose it. The capsule's amazing form factor becomes less impressive when you have to carry another accessory to make it work. The capsule phone app works pretty well but I'm not letting my kids have my phone just to pause their video.4. THE ROCKER BUTTON KIND OF SUCKS -- The device has four buttons on a rocker. Volume Up, Volume Down, Power, and Bluetooth speaker mode.  If my kids try to change volume -- or hold the device the wrong way -- the rocker activates the wrong button and the unit powers down or goes into bluetooth search mode.  The children then bring the projector back to me so I can find their video or use my remote to cancel the bluetooth error message. Poor design.5. CAN'T USE BUILT IN MEMORY -- I can't figure out how to do it.  I assumed the built-in file explorer would have a function for copying files off the USB and moving them into internal storage, but I can't find this function. I've never used android before, but I believe this is some kind of stripped down "tv android."  I tried plugging the projector into my clean Windows 10 PC and the Nebula doesn't show up as a storage device. What's the point of having all that memory if you can't put videos on it? For apps, I suppose.  I tried searching for online manual or PC drivers and can't find any manuals on on anker/nebula's website. The tiny printed manual is less than helpful. I guess I'm stuck watching videos off the dongle. I'm sure you techies have some weird workaround, but people shouldn't have to jump through hoops for this function.6. FIRMWARE  -- failed a few times. Finally downloaded completely, but the device wouldn't let me update until the battery was charged to over 50%.  It didn't matter that the device is plugged directly into the wall. This thing charges SLOW so I'm going to have to wait hours to install the firmware and see if it fixes any of these issues.  Update: it didn't.7. LOUD FAN -- I can live with this, but this is the loudest cooling fan I've ever had on a portable electronics device under five pounds. It almost sounds like white noise. Reminds me of the fan on my old 3000-lumen Epson projector - that device was 30 times brighter and used a halogen bulb, though.8. HARD TO ANGLE  -- the image is projected slightly upward and can't be aimed. The cylindrical shape and round footprint of the Nebula capsule make it hard to angle the device. If you slip a book under one edge, the capsule rolls over. The cube shaped projectors (like the Mars) are easier in this regard. You almost HAVE to get a tripod with this Nebula Capsule's round design.Summary - the Nebula capsule is a neat device, especially if it had come out years ago when the first pico projectors hit the scene. The form factor is cool and the sound is especially impressive for such a small gadget.  However, the projected screen is dim and the projector requires dongles and remote controls to use properly.The Mars seems like a better option as it is brighter (though only 500 ansi lumens), has a full-sized USB jack (no dongles), and most importantly has ALL the control buttons on top. I generally like Anker products (especially their battery packs) and wish the company much success.  However, I recommend passing on the Nebula Capsule. Mine is going back.

Title: Totally waste product
Comment: Waste of money

Title: An Under Baked Device
Comment: Yes, this is a projector the size of a soda can and that is impressive, but there are several major problems with it.1 - The limited Android app store is horrible. The only relevant apps I could use were Netflix and Youtube. This leaves a huge amount of entertainment apps out of the picture for me  (HBO Go, Amazon Prime, etc)2 - With the limited apps available you're reduced to having to use another device for content over HDMI.3 - The input lag on this thing is probably over 100ms making it a no go for any type of gaming.4 - They've already started on the Capsule 2 which means Anker is totally done trying to improve this product... They've already given up on it.Just don't buy this thing. It's a fun toy, but Anker really phoned it in and they really lost interest in this product quickly. Maybe in a few years with the Capsule 5 they'll get it right.

Title: Really wanted to like it, but...
Comment: Where to start, had bought the red one they were having a “deal” on last week.  When I got it, felt nice and weighty. Very portable and sturdy. Issues came when I first plugged it in. Wouldn’t ever fully charge, in fact, it would try to charge but cycle on & off. When it did cycle on, the screen would light up for a couple of seconds and then turn off. I called Amazon and they tried to help but referred me to Ankers customer service #. I tried calling but since they’re in a different time zone were not available. For the price even on a “deal” wasn’t going to mess with it so I sent it back. Will say that for the moments the screen would come on, to have a great viewing you would have to be in a very dark room to get the best results. So I’m hoping they make a newer brighter version because this projector has great potential.

Title: Terrible software on pleasant hardware.
Comment: Hardware wise this little device is impressive.  It's not without it's shortcomings, notably brightness (100 lumens) and resolution (854x480), but they're common for the size and class of the device although there are some with higher resolution.  The size, battery life, and speaker volume and quality are outstanding though and generally make up for any shortcomings.  There are a few minor things to be aware of, the projector lens isn't centered so it can take a little fiddling to get "straight" figured out and it is tall, and thus top heavy, so tripod angles might be more limited than comparable projectors.Software wise this thing is a mess though.  AirPlay blocks most things with copyright protection (e.g. Netflix, Hulu, etc).  Android streaming is limited to Miracast only.  The included Android apps and those on the app store either don't work (e.g. Hulu won't play any actual videos), are limited (e.g. you can't sign into YouTube due to the lack of Google Play Services), or are frustrating to use (e.g. Netflix is there but buggy and frustrating to navigate).  Anker knows most of this it seems, in emails with support they've indicated they're working with Google on resolving access to Google Play Services and they've noted that AirPlay functionality is outside of their control, but it still means the device doesn't live up to its promises here.  As an additional note the included remote doesn't seem to work well or at all with most of the software.A big selling feature of this device is the software, that you can install apps on it and watch your content, but truth be told you can't or you can't easily at this point.  You're left with fine hardware, arguably great for the size, but the device doesn't live up to the marketing Anker provides.  If you don't care about the software, it's a great projector who's only real issue is that the resolution could be higher (e.g. 720).  But, to me at least, I bought this with the software in mind and it completely fails in that aspect for now.Pros:+++ Speaker is loud and clear++ Long battery life+ PortableCons:- On the lower end of resolution (480)- Remote doesn't work fully with a lot of software- Casting support is limited (Airplay blocks copyright material and Android is only Miracast)--- Software support is very poor (doesn't work, is limited, etc)

Title: Not compatible with Disney Plus and app is horrible

Title: Chromecast
Comment: I connected them directly before making any final decision (considering the price) and they told me that a chromecast works fine with the Nebula. I re read the description and it says “does not work with chromecast”. I connected them again and they assured me it did. On a website stating the top 10 portable projectors it said it does not work with chromecast. I connected them again and showed them the proof. They said “unfortunately it does not work with chromecast”. I have screenshots of them assuring me it does. Lying company and almost spent $300 + an additional $30. Final answer, no it does not work with chromecast.

Title: Need help to run Netflix

Title: Missing important integrations

Comment: Ankers products are great they are built to last and most importantly what separates them from their competitors is that they are "dependable" and fairly priced, but this nebula is is overpriced and I understand it was a project and probably has demanding funders but the should have set it at a lower price

Title: Expect better for Anker Ruined my fathers day
Comment: this crappy thing is the opposite of user friendly.  don't say it works with IOS when it clearly does not.  want to try and work around that by trying to down load apps to the thing?  Good luck with that.  these android app stores are garbage also.  I was so excited to get this, and so disappointed when i tried use it.  Thanks for that Anker.

Title: Disposable projector no repair centers in USA
Comment: Had received my capsule as a gift for about 8 months used it about maybe 40 hours of use and the projection went out. Contacted the company for a repair center near me in Los Angeles CA I was told there was none. Disappointed on the longevity of the projector. I received it as a gift if I would have purchased myself I would be very upset

Title: One Star
Comment: It didn’t work with me 😕

Title: Disappointed
Comment: Am disappointed. Picture is very dim/dark. Hard to focus. Blurry at best. The app/remote is just weird.Wish I would have paid more for a better projector.

Title: not working with apps that I am watching on TV ...
Comment: not working with apps that I am watching on TV except Amazon Prime or Youtube. so now I have to watch some programs on small TV and Amazon on capsule. Hotstar, Sling all not working or any other apps if we try.

Title: That's a pretty big deal breaker for me
Comment: Doesn't support Chromecast. That's a pretty big deal breaker for me. Projection quality is mediocre.

Title: Three Stars
Comment: Doesn’t project as vivid as it could but makes up for it in the sound quality

Title: Two Stars
Comment: Android version does not include Google Play, so forget about installing most apps.

Title: Really amazing
Comment: Wow.its a awesome product.i can make my room as home theatre

Title: SURELY IT'S WONDERFUL AND ALL
Comment: I DONT OWN THIS ''THING'', BUT 350 HARD-EARNED DOLLARS INSTEAD OF GETTING A YG-300?????SURELY IT'S WONDERFUL AND ALL, BUT FOR A BUDGET-GADGET-LOVER THIS IS A MUST NOOOOO.DON'T BUY IT UNLESS YOU ARE A MILLIONAIRE!!!

Title: Lack flexibility
Comment: As a projector it is solid. The picture is good and I can’t argue with that.  But it’s portability is very annoying.  I mainly bought it for that purpose and I intend it for outdoor. Camping and such.  However, phone projection is not optional unless it’s connected to the same Wi-Fi...... without Wi-Fi the remote control is the only option.  Even in my friends house, I can’t connect it to my phone because it’s not connected to the same Wi-Fi, and I can’t pair it to the same Wi-Fi without the remote controller ... idk. It’s not for me.

Title: Two defective units right out of the box. Not good odds, skip this product.
Comment: It's neat, it works, the kids love movies outside. The user interface is clunky, and it's ridiculous they didn't add a micro sd slot, once you get past that it works for what it does, just could be a lot better.The trouble I have is, my micro usb slot is crooked, and makes inserting and removing the cable very difficult, and is scratching the heck out of the casing of the unit itself. I emailed anker, they, after sending pictures, CONFIRMED its it's a faulty unit, but since I purchased through Amazon's treasure truck sale, they have no record and insist I bought it 3rd party. Amazon refuses to send a simple replacement, stating I can return, and re purchase at the normal price ($120 more).So I have no choice but to purchase, or, rent another new unit, and send the faulty unit back for a full complete refund. I'm very disappointed in both companies in this refusal of very basic customer care.Update: Anker had reluctantly made an "exception" on my part to replace the defective unit. After receiving it, it does not connect to wifi, or rather, says it's connected, then displays connection error, on my home wifi, and 2 separate hotspots. So here we are, with 2 separate defective units out of the box. I have no recommendations at this time for anyone to purchase this product. I've fired off another email, I'll update or address this review with the results.

Title: Low Res
Comment: Only 480p so very blurry, was not acceptable for me. The customer service was nice and quick though. Returned it and got a different nebula model.

Title: Not worth the price
Comment: Easy to use, but it’s dark. It takes me a while to adjust the projector angle every time. The speaker was too loud (even the lowest volume). Overall, it’s not worth the price.

Title: not working with its own Twitch app
Comment: Upset, not working with its own Twitch app. useless for me.

Title: Poco brillo y baja resolución
Comment: No tiene buen brillo, no sirve para jugar play station, porque se nota aunque leve un retraso en la imagen proyectada, además que no tiene buena iluminación, muy caro para lo que ofrece, he visto otros proyectores con las mismas o parecidas características más baratos

Title: Badluck
Comment: One day the nebula get heated more and suddenly the bad odour smell is coming and switched off i lost my money

Title: Awsome
Comment: Excellent services and fast turn over
